loans.name: Konaba

texts.fr: Konaba F. est une mariée de 47 ans avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle achète en gros divers produits tels que thé, sucre, huile de palme, arachide qu’elle revend en détail dans la boutique qu’elle tient. Elle voudrait renforcer la quantité d’huile de palme qu’elle achète et avec ses revenus générés assurer une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Konaba F., age 47, is married and has 6 children to support. She buys various products wholesale, such as tea, sugar, palm and peanut oil, and retails them in her shop. She would like to buy larger amount of palm oil, and use the profits to ensure a good standard of living to her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Olexandra

texts.en:
Olexandra is single. She sells women’s pajamas, lingerie and t-shirts in the central market of Ivano-Frankivsk. Olexandra has a nice selection of good quality inventory at affordable prices which keeps her business sustainable. Even though she started her business only 1 year ago she is already making 6,000 Grivnyas in profit each month. 

Olexandra is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise, i.e. 50 pajamas and 50 tees. This business is the only source of income for her which is why Olexandra works hard to keep it running and stable. One of Olexandra’s dreams is to open a foster care home for orphans she works with in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pajamas and 50 t-shirts

loans.name: Del Jan Group

texts.en: Del Jan is the group leader of Del Jan group. There are three members in this group. They are wants to take a loan for progress their business and make it larger. Del Jan wants to take a loan for her husband who his taxi . Zaba wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Sosan wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. And they are requested a group of loan 30000 Afghani. They are very happy from this process of loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Independientes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Independientes” esta representado por la señora Marisol y conformado por 13 miembros que son de bajos ingresos, pero muy trabajadoras y con expectativas de lograr crecer en sus negocios para dales a su familia un futuro mejor. Las socias desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales como la venta en abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de comida, cosméticos, atención en puntos viva, ropa, acentúas, zapatos y a la construcción de muebles de madera, una mayoría trabaja en su domicilio y el resto como vendedores ambulantes. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que  constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para el ingreso diario, en caso de que no les va muy bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugares para realizar la comercialización de sus productos o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con sus responsabilidades y su familia. El destino del crédito es la adquisición mercadería para surtir sus tiendas e Insumos para generar una mayor ganancia que ayude a brindar a su familia una mejor calida de vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando ganas de salir adelante, responsabilidad y honestidad para con su grupo.
texts.en:
Marisol represents the Independientes group, which is comprised of 13 members with low incomes. But they are very hard-workers, and they have expectations to grow in their businesses in order to give their families a better future. The members work in different types of commercial activities like selling groceries in neighborhood store, selling food, cosmetics, phone calling services, clothes, accessories, shoes, and making wooden furniture. A majority of them work in their homes. The rest are street vendors. As far as the competition goes, we can say that there are competitors in the neighborhood. But the members have their regular customers who generate the necessary economic movement for daily income. In case it does not go well in the neighborhood, they head to other places to sell their products or do their work so that they can meet their responsibilities for themselves and their families. The loan is to get merchandise to stock their stores and to get supplies to generate greater earnings. This will help give their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their fourth cycle. They demonstrate the desire to get ahead, responsibility, and honesty for their group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La joven María V. de 25 años de edad, vive en memorial Sandino, tiene un hijo de cinco años de edad, madre soltera, con su propio negocio una pulpería lo inicio hace dos años y medio con porciones pequeñas de productos, durante este tiempo ha encontrado dificultades con las bajas  económica del país y menos ventas, tiene en primer instancia la construcción de un cuarto para protección y seguridad de su familia ya que donde habita su casa es sencilla mitad de piedra y madera es por eso la urgencia de poder tener algo mas seguro, anteriormente trabaja como operadora en la zona franca y desde ese tiempo inicio la remodelación y anexos de su vivienda. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, arena, zinc y una puerta. Obteniendo la comodidad y seguridad a al misma vez. Dando gracia a la institución por promover el financiamiento para su vivienda. Espera mantener el margen de venta para seguir mejorando día a día su negocio

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion como:piedra arena, cemento ,hiero y otros para hacer un cuarto

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret D. is a frozen foods store owner who sells frozen chicken fish and other frozen foods in Abotoase. Margaret has received senior high education.  She is married and the husband is also a petty trader whose income is too small to care for the financial needs of the family. 

Margaret has been selling these frozen chickens, fish and other frozen foods since for the past 6 years. She is responsible for the payments of the utility bills. With the high demand for her frozen foods and meats, her loan will be used to buy to more of the frozen fish and meat for sale. She hopes to reinvest the profit from her business.

loans.use: to more frozen fish and meat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She is 50 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Lucsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer D. 46 años sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Eleuterio D. 53 años y su hijo Rubén D. 17 años, y lo que más desea es que su familia tenga una vida feliz.

Su negocio está ubicado en una zona altamente comercial D. su ciudad y está convencida que la variedad D. sus productos incrementaran sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos en la vestimenta que teje.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tejer, se divierte mucho haciéndolo y ese estado D. ánimo lo refleja en los acabados D. su trabajo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus tejidos hasta su puesto D. venta, ya que los fardos pesan mucho. Para más adelante, espera poner una tienda D. tejidos artesanales muy granD., donD. pueda vender sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Evangelina con MFP y en este tiempo a descubierto la importancia D. trabajar en grupo. Ella está segura D. pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no causar problemas a su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad D. tejidos que produce.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 46, is an unassuming, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Eleuterio, 53, and her 17-year-old son, Rubén. Her greatest wish is that her family have a happy life. Her business is located in a highly commercial area of her city and she is convinced that the variety of her products increase her sales so she makes a special effort to keep her designs unique in the clothing she weaves. What she most likes about her work is the weaving itself; she enjoys doing it very much and her state of mind is reflected in the finishes she gives her work. She has had this occupation for 10 years. The most difficult part of the work is transporting the finished items to her sales stall because the bundles are very heavy. For further into the future, she would like to establish a large store from which to sell woven handicrafts and where she can sell her clothing items more peacefully. This is Evangelina's second loan with MFP and she has discovered the value inherent in working in a group. She is confident that she will repay her loan on time and not cause her communal bank any problems where she is very well-liked for the joy she expresses. With the two-thousand soles requested she will buy more wool to increase the number of woven items she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately PHP 800 daily net income for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ceiroding

texts.en:
Ceiroding R. is from the village of Barina-ot, Iligan City. He is 18 years old and single. To make a living, Ceiroding owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Ceiroding is just starting this business.
In 2009, Ceiroding joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Ceiroding plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda M. is from the village of Bangko, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Wilfreda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Wilfreda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilfreda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Catherine Group

texts.en:
Catherine S. is leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Catherine Group'. She is thirty-five years old and is married with three children. She could not continue her education from 7th grade due to poverty.

Catherine’s business is the sale of children's clothes. She sells at Waterside Market, a big market located in downtown Monrovia. She has been running this business for twenty years and hopes to own a store in the near future.

Catherine started her business by selling palm oil but she lost everything during the war when heavy fighting broke out in Monrovia on April 6, 1996. She attracts customers by talking to them in a good manner. Catherine needs this loan to purchase more goods (children's clothes) for resale. She dreams of educating her children and building a home for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Catherine is the one holding the sign. Bandu T. is in the inset at lower left.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: A. Victoire est née le 21 Juillet 1968 et est mariée à AKAKPO Félix, un couturier. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a environs 6 ans que la famille s’est installée au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Victoire a fréquenté l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis 6 ans environs, pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Victoire mène comme activité la vente de boissons en cannettes, de tissus et de divers autres produits (produits de cheveux, produits de toilette, dissolvants, etc.) à son domicile. Victoire s’approvisionne au marché Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Victoire a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Victoire sollicite un autre crédit afin renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Victoire A. was born July 21, 1968 and is married to Felix Akakpo, a tailor. The couple has a child, who is in school. It's been about 6 years since the family settled in Agla neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple contribute together in covering the family expenses. Victoire has education up to university level. But for about 6 years, Victoire has been running a business selling can drinks, fabrics and various other items (hair extensions, bathing items, solvents, etc.) in her home in order to meet the different expenses. She gets her supplies in Gbogbanou market at Cotonou. Victoire already benefitted from a loan from ALIDe which she repaid. She is requesting another loan in order to strengthen her business and better meet the requests of her clientele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products( hair extensions, bathing products, solvents)

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: After being laid-off from a newswire agency in 2004, Felicia, originally from Guyana, decided to start-up her own public relations agency. She runs her business out of her home, and works primarily on public relations in the Caribbean. On occasion, Felicia also writes for a daily newspaper in New York. The turning point in her business was being contacted by an India-based company to do their ad placements in the Caribbean, Africa, and Latin America. She has successfully serviced their account for several years. In addition, she has recently been inundated with all the newswire hits on Haiti. Felicia contacted ACCION USA to provide her with the funds needed to hire a new staff member. She hit some struggles with her business during the economic downturn in 2008, but since then she has been doing her best to build her business. Her current staff of part- and full-time employees needs to be expanded to continue to successfully grow her business. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To hire an employee

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA LUISA G. D. O. tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6TO D. primaria refiere que es D. la sierra y que cuando ella era niña no iban mucho a la escuela por eso sus padre no le dieron mas estudios, es conviviente y tiene 5  hijos ya todos independientes. La socia se dedica a la venta D. vegetales como: zanahoria, tomate, zapallo, papas, etc. en un mercado cerca a su casa y también se dedica a criar patos, ovejas y vacas en la chacra que tiene cerca D. su casa.
Mucho D. los vegetales que María Luisa venD. en el mercado son sembrados y cosechados por ella misma en las chacras que tiene cerca D. su casa. Refiere que este trabajo es fuerte pero que desD. niña esta acostumbrada a trabajar en el campo.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró abono para su chacra y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,500.00 lo utilizará para la compra D. más abono, fertilizante, para arar la chacra y empezar a sembrar zanahoria, papas, lentejas, etc.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa G. D. O., 57, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She is a member of the San Borja community bank. She has six years of primary school. She tells us that she is from a region of Peru where girls often didn't go to school so her parents didn't give her more schooling. Maria Luisa is partnered and has 5 children, all of whom are now independent. She makes a living selling vegetables--carrots, tomatoes, pumpkins, potatoes, etc.--at a market near her house. She also raises ducks, sheep and cattle on a nearby farm that she owns. Maria Luisa plants and cultivates much of the produce that she sells in the market herself, at the farm. She tells us the work is hard but reminds us that she is a country girl, used to hard work. With her first loan of 300 new soles, Maria Luisa bought fertilizer for her farm. She will use this new loan, for 1,500 new soles, to buy more fertilizer and prepare a new crop of carrots, potatoes, beans, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: Don José es un hombre esforzado para lograr un nivel de vida mejor. Tiene 46 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 10 años el cual cursa sus estudios, su esposa es comerciante de venta de prenda de plata el cual ambos se apoyan mutuamente para lograr los objetivos personales. El señor José trabaja en el Ministerio de Hacienda como Responsable del departamento de clasificación de puesto de trabajo, desde hace trece años, el cual ha alcanzado mucho conocimiento. Las dificultades que tuvo fue no lograr terminar su carrera debido a que años atrás no hallaba trabajo lo cual emigro a Costa Rica en donde trabajo en ventas, por ocho años, luego regreso, se caso y decide seguir estudiando, es por eso con este financiamiento lograra pagar el titulo en Licenciatura de Contabilidad Publica, para el un gran objetivo en su vida, nuevas oportunidades de crecer en el ámbito profesional. Contento por este beneficio alcanzado. Sus planes a futuro es poder escalar en su trabajo, y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
José has worked hard to attain a better standard of living. He is 46 years old and has a 10 year old son, who is in school; his wife sells silver jewelry and both support each other in their efforts to reach their personal goals. José has worked for the Ministry of the Treasury as Chief of the Employment Classification Department for the last 13 years where he has acquired much knowledge. A difficulty he has faced is that he was unable to finish his professional career because he had to go to Costa Rica years ago because he couldn’t find work at home. He worked in sales there for 8 years. Then, he returned, got married and decided to resume his studies. He will use the funds to pay for the expenses associated with getting his CPA certification which has been a great life objective for him that will open new opportunities for professional growth. Happy with having reached this benefit, his plans for the future are to continue ascending his career ladder and to have improved income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the expenses associated with getting his CPA certification.

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el sector La Pilca, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de siete años a la comercialización de ganado vacuno, el cría ganado para luego venderlo a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio le provee los recursos que necesita para sostener a su familia por lo que siempre da todo de si para mantenerlo y salir adelante.

José desea mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales para obtener mas ingresos al momento de venderlos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

El es un padre muy entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar y progreso de ellos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
José, 53, is married and lives with his family in the La Pilca sector, a rural area of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a cattle merchant for over 7 years. He raises cattle for subsequent sale to merchants that regularly come by his area to buy. This business provides the necessary income to support his family so he always gives all of himself to insure that it is successful José wants to improve the quality of his animals so that he can earn higher income when they are sold. He is, therefore, approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed. He is a very dedicated father who always watches over his family’s wellbeing and progress. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to improve the quality of life of his loved ones. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce et exerce son commerce dans le quartier d’akodessewa qui est  un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite d WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  cartons de pâtes alimentaires, de cartons de couscous, de sacs de riz et divers.
Elle est mariée et  a un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady has a revenue-generating activity selling general grocery products. She has more than ten years' experience in this business, which she carries out in the Adodessewa district, on the outskirts of the town of Lomé. She is experiencing a decline in her stock and in order to get fresh supplies she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy cartons of pasta and couscous as well as sacks of rice and other diverse products. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: S., aged 25, is a garment worker who lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh. She is married to Thear, aged 25, who is a local farmer. He climbs palm trees (to tap juice etc.) as well as cultivating rice. They have one young child who is enrolled in school. The rice-growing season is coming and S.’ husband lacks some of the farming tools that could ease his hard labor on the farm. Therefore, S. is requesting a loan of $800 to help buy a couple of oxen for her husband, which he can use to plow the farmland. They will then buy fertilizer and seeds for growing. S. and her husband are shown in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a couple of oxen

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul N. is the leader of the group, and she is 39. Her husband works as a builder. They have a daughter and a son. The daughter is fifteen; she studies at school in the 8th class and the son works as a handyman in a store. The son and the husband also breed cattle to make money. With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to purchase three farm animals for breeding. In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock and improve their living conditions.

Shaiyrkul S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 55 and a widow. She has raised a daughter and two sons. The daughter is married, the older son went to Russia to make some money, and the younger son helps his mom around the farm. Shaiyrkul has been breeding cattle for 20 years, if she needs money she can sell some cattle. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase one farm animal in order to increase the number of livestock.

Shapanbubu I. is 57 and her husband is a pensioner. They have three sons and six daughters. The older children are married and live separately with their families. The younger son and the younger daughter study at school.  Shapanbubu and her husband have been farming for 16 years, since 1994. Now she applied for the loan because she needs money to pay for tractor service, to purchase 50 litters of fuel, which is needed for the sowing process, and buy some cattle for breeding. 

Turumkan K. is 58 and married. She has four sons and two daughters. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Three years ago Turumkan and her husband sold cattle for 15000 soms ($326.58), and with that amount they started to breed cattle and sell them later on. In this way they make 6000 soms ($130.63) per month. Now Turumkan wants to get a loan to purchase two cows to sell after fattening.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase three farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Luque y se encuentran trabajando dentro del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. 

Una  de las integrantes es la señora Francisca C.  quien se dedica a la venta de hiervas medicinales  en la zona del mercado de la ciudad  por la mañana por la tarde recorre varios negocios  para ofrecer sus medinas naturales.
Ella solicitó el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mas medicinas naturales así podrá cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza ("New Hope") group is from the Villa Salvador neighbourhood in the city of Luque and are working in the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacion Paraguaya ("Fundacion Paraguaya's Committee of Women Entrepreneurs"). One of the members is Francisca C., who sells medicinal herbs in the market area of the city in the mornings. In the afternoons she visits businesses to offer her natural medicines. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of natural medicines to cover all of her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural medicines

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamranu 45 let. On  jivet v qorode Baku. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey 6,10,13 let. Dochka 6 let malenkaya toka v etom qodu v shkolu poydetn , sin 10 let uchitsya v shkole i xochet stat ekoloqom i zashishat prirodu,i doch 13 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetysa nashimi nacionalnimi tancami. 
 
Pervuyu summu Brala mama Kamrana Leyla Askarova  chtobi pomoch svoyemu sinu, i seychas oni blaqodarni za piomosh KIve. Seychas Kamran nujdayetysa v summe 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapasniye chasti  shini dlya mashin.
texts.en:
Kamran is 45 years old. He lives in the city of Baku. He is married and has 3 children, who are 6, 10 and 13 years old. His 6-year-old daughter is little and will be starting school this year. His 10-year-old son goes to school and wants to become an ecologist and defend the nature. And the 13-year-old daughter also goes to school and is involved in our national dancing. Kamran's mother, Leyla Askarova, obtained the first loan in order to help her son, and now they are grateful to Kiva for the help. Currently, Kamran needs a sum of 2000 AZN in order to purchase spare parts and car tires.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and tires

loans.name: Qhantati Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal QHANTATI es una asociación que está renovando crédito por segunda vez, está compuesta por doce mujeres, tiene como presidenta a la señora Toribia A. de Cusi.

La mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Los Andes.  La señora Toribia tiene como negocio la venta de “Tostado”, de acuerdo a las costumbres es muy común tostar: maíz, arbeja, maní, haba, soya, como otro tipo de golosina muy apreciado por niños y adultos. 

Su primer crédito fue de Bs.2000.- y en este segundo ciclo la asociación le ha aprobado Bs.3000.-, ella indica que servirá para la compra de insumos.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios como el de Tejido de Mantas, artesanía, venta de chicharrón, tejido de mantas, tienda surtida, venta de tostado, elaboración de Disfraces y tienda de barrio
texts.en:
The Qhantati Communal Bank is an association that is renewing a loan for the second time. It is comprised of 12 women, and Toribia A. de Cusi is the president. This communal bank belongs to the Los Andes central office. Toribia has a business selling “Tostado”. According to custom it is very common to toast corn, peas, peanuts, beans, and soy as a type of sweet that is much enjoyed by children and adults. Her first loan was for 2,000 BOB. In this second cycle the Asociación has approved 3,000 BOB. She indicates that she will use it to buy supplies. The members of the communal bank have businesses like weaving blankets, handicrafts, selling “chicarrones” (fried pork rinds), a fully-stocked store, selling tostado, making costumes, and a neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains wholesale

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel C. Q. tiene 40 anos. Es viudo y vive con sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Jose es socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejorara su situación economico. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel C. Quilla is 40 years old. He is a widower, and he lives with his children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He has five children. Jose is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all. Most of them are farmers. Jose is a farmer, and he grows corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. He is requesting a loan in order to make agricultural progress. With the support of the loan his financial situation will improve. In his free time he likes to play with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make progress with his farming

loans.name: Javier Arnulfo

texts.en:
Javier Arnulfo L. M. is 32 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage in Chillanes in Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has 3 children, ages 8, 6, and 3 years old. Javier is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Javier works in agriculture and raises chickens. He has been producing cacao, coffee, corn, and rice for the past 14 years. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Javier plans to use the loan to improve his agricultural productivity by purchasing fertilizer and compost.  His goal for the next 5 years is to have more land and to produce more crops. 

He enjoys the annual festivals of the patron saint San Jose.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to improve agricultural productivity

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 65 years old. Josefina is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat T., 45, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. T. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.50 per day. Her husband is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day.  T. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Virginia;  La socia tiene 42 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando patos, pollos y chanchos, la socia compra animales menores para dedicarse al comercio minorista mediante la venta de estos animales. La socia tiene sus clientes a los cuales lleva los animales una vez que estén preparados para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y de este modo incrementar sus ventas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Sr. De Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district of the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru.

Vriginia is 42 years old, and married with 5 children.  She works raising ducks, chickens, and pigs.  She buys the small animals and then sells them retail.  She delivers the animals to her customers once the animals are ready to be sold.  She is seeking this loan to purchase more small animals to increase her sales.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: Purchase of small animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
El clienta Zeneyda T. T.. Vive en departamento de león Reparto Mariana Samsom Del Tanque 2 C abajo., Es un cliente Casado  trabaja actual mente en MINSA santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como Enfermera tiene 7 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El clienta cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Construcción de un Porche de entrada, el cual le permitirá la facilidad de su familia.  
Esto le permitirá que el cliente pueda obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Zenaida T. T. lives two blocks from the tank in Reparto Mariana Samsom, León department.  She has been employed as a Nurse by the Ministry of Health for seven years and works in Santa Rosa del Peñón.  She owns her house and she’d like to make some improvements to it.

The loan will be used to build an entry porch which will provide more ease for her family.  This will allow her to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To build an entry porch.

loans.name: Comfort Adjoa Brokuma

texts.en: Comfort Adjoa Brokuma M. is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She has received junior high education. Comfort sells plastic bowls at Abura. Her income is used to assist her husband in taking care of the family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more plastic bowls for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort wishes to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: purchase more plastic bowls for resale

loans.name: Sonrisa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sonrisa está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas Ivania Mercedes Enríquez Cerda  en 1984 a la edad de 15 años estudio costura en sus inicios cosía en la máquina de su tía hasta que su cuñada le regalo una maquina actualmente cuenta con tres máquinas. Además de este negocio con los préstamos invirtió en cosméticos Avon marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. 

Ella invertirá el crédito en telas, hilos y aplicaciones para la realización de ropa para niñas que es en lo que se ha especializado y sueña con tener su tienda de ropa. Enríquez tiene dos hijos uno de 17 años y una de 20 años la cual está en la universidad.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa C. Zapata quien comercializa cosméticos desde hace año ½  y Ana Patricia R. López vende cosméticos Avon aproximadamente desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The Sonrisa ["Smile"] Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Ivania Mercedes Enríquez Cerda, who studied dressmaking in 1984, at the age of 15.  She started sewing on her aunt's sewing machine, until she received her own as a gift from her sister-in-law.  Now she has three sewing machines.

With the loans she has received, she has invested in her sewing business as well as in Avon brand cosmetics, which are known for their catalog sales.  She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, and appliques for making clothing for girls, which is her specialty.  She dreams of having her own clothing store.  Ms. Enríquez has two children: a 17 year-old son and a 20 year-old daughter, who is enrolled in university.

The other group members are Rosa C. Zapata, who has sold cosmetics for a year and a half, and Ana Patricia R. López, who has sold Avon cosmetics for approximately two years.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making girls dresses

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo vive en Anticrético cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la villa exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto. Juan Pablo es Chofer y trabaja en el radio taxi omega y su esposa vende productos de belleza de la línea  de Esika. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene un hijo. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la realizar un mantenimiento general a su herramienta de trabajo. Esto le permitirá trabajar mejor.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo lives in 'anticrético' (a special rental system particular to Bolivia).  His home is located in Villa Exaltación, in the city of El Alto.  Juan Pablo is a driver and works for Radio Taxi Omega.  His wife sells Esika beauty products.  This is Juan Pablo's main source of income.  He has one child.

This loan will be used to have his vehicle serviced which will allow him to work better.

This is his first loan from Impro.

loans.use: To pay to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 28 years old and has a 5-year-old child. Evelyn is involved in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops. Evelyn also decided to put up a sari-sari (general) store to help with her family's daily needs. She sells a variety of different products at her store. 

Evelyn is a member of CEVI, a partner of KIVA. She applied for a loan of PHP 8000 which will be used to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell at her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe HEREMAKONO sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 4  enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien soldés. Elles font la vente, de l’atiéké, du bois chauffe et  des  fruits et légumes   avec  ASSITAN D.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 20 paniers de fruits et légumes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle vend en ambulant à Sikasso ville et à domicile, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 49.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager son coin de vente.
texts.en: The members of the group HEREMAKONO are essentially married women averaging 38 years of age and four children.  They live for the most part in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their eighth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.   The group members sell atiéké (cassava couscous), firewood, and fruit and vegetables, as is the case for Ms. ASSITAN D.. With her new loan, ASSITAN plans on buying 20 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso.  Accepting cash and often credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales door-to-door in Sikasso City and also out of her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 49,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs.  The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital to satisfy her customers better and to fix up her sales location.

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Gloria Cecibel

texts.es:
Gloria de 33 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, vive con sus padres y hermanos, ella está soltera y se dedica al comercio en una tienda y chalet, este negocio consiste en vender panes con pollo, pupusas, refrescos y golosinas como galletas, dulces y boquitas, lo administra desde hace 3 años lo tiene ubicado en la escuela del lugar donde reside.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir la tienda en época de clases, ya que se acerca el tiempo de regresar a la escuela y ella debe estar preparada para comenzar con el chalet bien diversificado en mercadería.
Sus objetivos son seguir este nuevo año proveyendo para los estudiantes todo lo que sea necesario para alimentarse en sus recreos, en su vida personal quiere ahorrar para poseer su propia vivienda y formar su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 33 years old and she lives in Delicias de Conception in the department of Morazan.  She lives with her parents and siblings. She is single and she is a merchant who owns a store and a food stall. Through this business she sells chicken sandwiches, pupusas, drinks and snacks, including cookies, sweets, and finger foods. She has had the business for 3 years and it is located in a school in the neighborhood where she lives. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise to supply her food stall for the school year. Back to school is soon to come and she wants to be ready to have her store well supplied.

Her goal for this New Year is to keep providing the students with snacks during their recess times. As for her personal life, she wants to save enough money to have her own store and to have a family of her own.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as cookies, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Cissy has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for one year. Cissy also has a second business of tailoring.
To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal and materials for making clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees and also buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Cissy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to dance and do tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  Patrick has a small retail shop, which he has had for two years.         

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees and basic needs for his family.  In the future, Patrick hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of plastic bags

loans.name: Jorge Edgardo

texts.es:
Jorge Edgardo C. G. tiene 79 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero para que a los hijos no les falte nada.

Le gusta que el monto de los créditos sea mas alto para comprar mas insumos para la producción.
texts.en:
Jorge Edgardo C. G. is 79, is married and lives with his wife and five children in the province of Bolívar.

The members of V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO live nearby in the town of el Calzado, Cantón San Miguel; these 12 farmers grow corn, potatos, beans and raise domestic animals.

Jorge makes his living from agriculture and grows corn, potatoes, beans and has farm animals as well. He buys products in the market of San Miguel each week and brings his products for sale on Thursdays in the same market.

Jorge requests a loan in order to buy crop seed and feed for farm animals. This credit will help him economically to meet expenses, and to confront difficulties such as insects, disease and climate unpredictability. He hopes to be able to continue working and provide for the needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and feed for farm animals

loans.name: Graciela Del Carmen

texts.es: Graciela Del Carmen tiene 47 años. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdo, hace más de 6 años que sabe de este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven ya que su familia tenía esta misma actividad, y a ella le gustaba ayudar a su familia para que así salieran adelante. Al ver que esta actividad era rentable decide establecer su propio negocio y es así como este negocio le queda a ella para sufragar los gastos de su familia y proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, alimentos, entre otros.
texts.en: Graciela del Carmen is 47 years old.  She has worked buying and selling pigs for more than six years.  When she was young, her family worked in this same business and she liked to help her family so that they could get ahead in life.  Upon noticing that this was a profitable business, she decided to establish her own business and this is how she came to having it as a means to defray her family’s expenses and provide her two children with what they need.  The loan she is requesting is for working capital to purchase pigs, feed, and other items.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and other items

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Rasheed Park with her family for the past 8 years. She is married to M. H. who is 60 years old and doesn’t work. Sardaran is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 

Sardaran has given birth to two sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide education to her sons due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a grocery store while the 2nd one works in a factory. Her daughter studies in class 8. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son son who wants to buy groceries for the expansion of his grocery store. The bulk grocery stock will help him sell a greater quantity to his customers and earn better income. Sardaran is hopeful that through the loan investment her son will be able to make better profits from his business and become established in it. 

 She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Kweterana Kakumiro Group

texts.en:
Edith is a hardworking 45-year-old married mother of seven children aged 9-26 years old. They live in Karuguuza Uganda. She is the leader of Kweterana Kakumiro group which is a group of hardworking mothers with a common goal. It should be noted that one of the members did not take a loan but as a group policy each member has to guarantee the other. 

She looks after her family since her husband is a peasant and they live in a 5-room semi-permanent house with four of their children. Her family goal is to be able to pay fees for her children's school. She has a retail shop which she has been running for 24 years. With the income she has been able to provide the basic needs for her family and pay school fees. 

However she faces a challenge of a high default rate of her debtors and she hopes in the future to upgrade her shop to a wholesale shop. Edith intends to use the credit to buy dry cereal, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, soap and corn flour for sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su conviviente y su  menor hijo.  Vive en casa propia, ubicada en caserío Jesús maría, que se ubica a 3 km de cruceta, que es un anexo del distrito de  Tambogrande.  En su domicilio cuentan con servicio de luz pero aun no tiene agua y desagüe.

Benjamín se dedica a  la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas)y aves de corral, los cuales una vez que tiene el peso y tamaño ideal los vende en mercado local. También trabajo como seguridad en una procesadora de fruta y con estos ingresos afronta sus obligaciones familiares. Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 01 año. 

Benjamín esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles , dinero con el cual desea comprar  alimento para su ganado y mejoras en su corral  pues espera incrementar sus inventarios y por ende las ventas, para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Benjamín es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 26 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and dependent child.  He lives in his own home, in the small village of Jesús María, 3km from Cruceta, which is an outlying village of Tambogrande district.  He has electricity in his home but does not yet have piped water or sewerage.

Benjamín raises sheep and poultry.  Once they have reached an ideal weight and size, he sells them in the local market.  He also works as a security guard in a fruit processing company.  With the money from these jobs, he faces up to his family obligations.  He has been in his business for more than one year.

Benjamín is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He would like to use this money to buy feed for his animals and to make some improvements to his animal pens since he hopes to increase his stock and, thereby, his sales, so that he can continue growing in his business.

Benjamín is a father who is committed to his family and he always watches over their well-being and development.  People who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to improve his animal pens

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в джамоате района. Сама Рахима занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Rahima lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in the regional village council. Rahima does agriculture. She mainly grows vegetables for resale. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She is taking the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. Aba has been through junior high school.

Aba sells cosmetics, earrings, panties and so forth at Ankwanda village near Elmina. Her business is just two years old.

Aba wants to increase the volume of goods sold. A loan is going to help her buy more cosmetics for resale. Aba anticipates reinvesting new profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven children. Five children attend school while two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a used clothing business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 Mupa wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Seriba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seriba est âgé de 27 ans, marié et père  de 2  enfants.  Il   vit  dans une famille nucléaire   avec sa femme et  ses enfants  au quartier Bougoufié  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença tôt le commerce  auprès d’une connaissance. Après des années d’apprentissage à ses côtés et riche de cette expérience, il  finit par évoluer seul pour faire le commerce d’articles divers. Il mène cette activité depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Seriba est très connu dans beaucoup de structures professionnelles et dans la ville de Ségou car il vend en ambulant dans une charrette.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, il  a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, il est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 5 paquets de torches et 2 cartons de pâtes dentifrices. Il  s’approvisionne sur place. Seriba vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Il  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de subvenir à ses charges familiales. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Seriba is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a nuclear family with his wife and children in the Bougoufié area of Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
Not having attended school for societal reasons, he very early on began to work in business with an acquaintance. After several years of training alongside his acquaintance and enriched by this experience, he finished by starting his own business selling various items. He has run this business for 5 years and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Seriba is very well-known in many professional organizations and in the city of Ségou because he sells his goods door-to-door in a cart.
With the hope of increasing his sales, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy 5 packs of torches and 2 boxes of toothpaste. He gets his supplies locally. Seriba sells his goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. He foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow him to repay his loan and provide for his family. 
His ambition is to build a home in the city of Ségou.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupos solidario se llama Diamante Verde se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, esta conformado por las señoras Alicia, Carolina y Maria Teresa van a comprar con su prestamo abono, insecticida, fumigantes, fertilizantes y quimicos para darle mantenimiento a la siembra de nopal, la señora Caritina va a comprar Libretas de raya, cuadro, cartulinas, juegos geometricos, etc. para surtir su papeleria, la señora Veronica va a comprar penca de nopal para sembrar, producir y vender. 
La señora Carolina tiene 27 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Galilea de 10 años de edad, Hector de 8 años de edad ellos estan estudiando la primaria y Evelin de 4 años de edad, ella tiene su parcela de nopal, ella solicito su prestamo para comprar insecticida para su parcela de nopal.
Ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años por que su esposo le enseño a trabajar en el nopal, su negocio es importante porque con la venta de la produccion del nopal les ayuda a solventar los gastos de la familia, a ella le gusta cuando vende el nopal porque tiene ingresos para pagar el prestamo y algunos gastos imprevistos, las ganancias las utiliza una parte para la familia, para comprar abono y para la renta del motocultor para picar y despencar el nopal que ya se paso, su negocio es popular por las propiedades alimenticias y curativas del nopal.
En Tlalnepantla hay muchos productores de nopal pero todos venden su producto llegan trailer de varias ciudades por el nopal o van a venderlo a la centra de abastos de la ciudad de Mexico. Ella tiene la esperanza de construir su casa propia y darles lo mejor a sus hijos en alimentacion, estudios y casa, ella esta contenta con este prestamo que le brindan le va a ayudar mucho a la produccion del nopal. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad, "gracias por ayudarnos con sus prestamos y que nos sigan apoyando con sus prestamos para crecer los negocios y las familias vivan mejor muchas gracias". Tlalnepantla es un pueblo bonito de clima templado producen el nopal, aguacate, durazno, mispero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Diamante Verde."  It is located in the community of Tlalnepantla. With this loan, the members Alicia, Carolina and Maria Teresa are going to buy manure, insecticide, fumigants and chemicals to maintain their nopal crops.  Caritina is going to buy ruled notebooks, notecards, protractor sets and other items to stock her stationery store.  Veronica is going to buy nopal pads to plant, grow and sell.

Carolina is 27 years old.  She is married and has 3 children: Galilea, 10, and Hector, 8, who are in school, and Evelin, who is 4 years old.  Carolina has a plot of nopal.  She requests this loan to buy insecticide for her crops.  She started this business 10 years ago because her husband taught her how to grow nopal.  Her business is important because with the sales of her nopal products she helps to cover the household expenses.  She likes selling nopal because she has the income to repay the loan and some unexpected expenses, and she uses the profits in part for her family, and also to buy fertilizer and to rent a rotavator to turn over the land and extract the remains of the plants once the nopals have been harvested.  Her business is popular because the plant is used as a food and also for medicinal purposes.

In Tlalnepantla there are many nopal producers; they transport their products to sell in different cities, or they sell to the distributors in Mexico City.  Carolina hopes to build her own home and provide her children with food and a better house and education.  She is pleased with this loan that you are providing her; it will help her a lot with her nopal production.  

The members of this group want to say to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad, "thanks for helping us with these loans, and we hope that you will continue to support us with loans so that we can grow our businesses and so that our families can live better.  Thanks so much."

Tlalnepantla is a pretty town with a temperate climate where nopal, avocados, peaches and sapodillas are grown.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide for her nopal crops

loans.name: Audeli Paulina

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica, su actividad es venta de comida y refrescos en general, es casada su núcleo familiar consta de 4 personas 3 hijos y su esposo, los hijos están solteros una de ella esta laborando en su especialidad, los otros están estudiando en león, esta señora tiene 9 financiamientos recibidos con la empresa , los cuales les han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, y de esa manera a apoyado al hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, dicho negocio comenzó como venta de refrescos y hamburguesas, actualmente está más amplio y mejores condiciones competitivas, en todos los aspectos, dicho negocio nació de la necesidad misma de desarrollar su familia y emprendió la ejecución de lo que hoy esta establecido
texts.en:
This woman is originally from Telica. Her business is the sale of food and soft drinks in general. She is married and her nuclear family consists of four people, three children and her husband. Her children are single and one of them works in their field. The others are studying in León.

This woman has received nine loans from the company. They have helped her to improve her condition and standard of living. They have helped with the home and with her children’s studies. The aforementioned business began as hamburger and soft drink sales. Now it is much bigger and in a better competitive condition, in all aspects.

The business came about due to the need to support her family and she undertook the creation of this business that today is well established.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, beans, chicken, beef, eggs, vegetables, fire wood and plastic containers.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a fermented shrimp business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing. Violeta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients including shrimp and fish for her enterprise.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as shrimp and fish for her business.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with three children. 
Roxanne has a pigpen and she sells grown, matured pigs.  She has had this business for three years.  Her husband provides motorela and habal-habal (transportation services).  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs she sells.
Roxanne has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Roxanne hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs she sells

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 37 years old and lives in the village of Coluban Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child to care for.  

Marisa has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. Her husband drives the motorcycle. She has been doing this for over two years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle accessories for a better service quality. 

Marisa joined GDMPC in 2010 and this will be her third loan. She was able to repay previous loans in full. 

In the future, Marisa hopes to sustain the daily needs of the family. She plans to further improve the service, appearance and quality of her business to attract more passengers and start saving for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle accessories for a better quality of service.

loans.name: Yiapaso

texts.en:
Yiapaso is 43 years old and married to Saitoti. They are blessed with two children who go to school. She sells Masaai blankets and jewelry to local people at Bissil market where most of her clients are female and male. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Yiapaso was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET officer. She has a good credit history and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy Masaai blankets, beads for making jewelry, earrings and necklaces. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

She hopes to open a big store at Bissil market and be the supplier for other markets like Kajiando, Isinya and Kitengela. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more Masaai blankets and beads for making jewelry, earrings and necklaces for sale

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana Deysi tiene 28 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser: ropa interior, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, Shorts, etc. Sus principales clientes son las personas que visitan el mercado municipal, su negocio le da rentabilidad y ganancias.
 Ana Deysi dice sentirse muy bien, ya que sus ventas han aumentado y su negocio esta creciendo, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y asi tener mas variedad de ropa.
su meta en un futuro es alquilar un local para instalar su negocio y asi tener una tienda grande de venta de ropa.
texts.en: Ana Deysi, 28, sells new clothes like: underwear, skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, shorts, etc.  Her main customers are people who visit the municipal market.  Her business is profitable and produces income.  Ana Deysi says that she feels very good because her sales have been increasing and her business is growing.  She will use the loan to buy clothes to have more variety available.  Her future goal is to rent a locale to set up her business and have a large clothing store.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, jeans, t-shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap made of  essense of conch shell and mother-of-pearl creams.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía forma parte del grupo mujeres trabajando ella se dedica a la  venta  de artesanía  como son: blusas, batas y huipil.
Empezó su negocio desde hace diez años , tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos  dos mujeres  Maribel de trece  años , Milagro de  tres años de edad , Luis de  veinte siete años de edad  y Ricardo  de veinte dos años de edad.
Ella tiene cuarenta  y cinco años de edad, esta felizmente casada con el señor  Andel  de sesenta años de edad.
Se siente muy feliz  por que su negocio le deja muy  buenas ganancias.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de  listones, manta, agujas y aros.
Quisiera comprar manta de color  para  que su costura se vea bonita  y  sus clientas se las puedan comprar.
Uno de las cosas que mas le gusta de su negocio es tejer y dibujarle figuras a su manta.
Le da las gracias a fundición por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sofia is a working woman and she sells handicrafts such as blouses, housecoats and embroidered dresses. She began her business ten years ago. She has four children, two of which are daughters--13 year old Maribel and 3 year old Milagro, and Luis is 27 years old and Ricardo is 22 years old.

She is 45 years old, and happily married to Andel who is 60 years old. She is very happy because her business brings her good income.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy ribbons, blanket, needles and embroidery hoops.

She wants to buy colored cloth to sew that will look beautiful and that her customers are able to buy. One of the things that she likes most about her business is to draw and weave figures to her cloth. She gives thanks to the community bank for the support that they have given to help her succeed.

loans.use: to buy thread and ribbon in order to make typical clothing

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is a 28-year-old young and vigorous trader. He is married and has 2 children. He sells food products as rice, cookies, confectioneries and beverages in the central market of Imishli city. He has 4 years of experience in this field. His monthly income is 250 AZN per month and he would like to increase it to 400. To make it possible he needs more capital to purchase more goods and meet customer demand. For this purpose he applied for 800 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell and generate more profit.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her brother’s business who lives with her and operates a tailoring business.  With the loan investment, he will buy a new sewing machine and also hire a worker who will help him in completing the orders on time.

Shumaila also sews clothes. She is an expert in ladies' clothing and knows about the latest trends and fashion about clothing. This helps her prepare beautiful looking clothes and satisfy her clients.  Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron products. He is an expert in his work and earns reasonably good profits every month.

Shumaila is the mother of 2 children. Both of them are very young and not of school-going age yet.   Her brother is married and Shumaila is hopeful that after the loan investment, he will be able to run his business better and his family will be able to have a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Oseas Neftali

texts.es:
Óseas vive rodeado de  familiares, se dedica a la venta de francés y dulce, trabaja todos los días de la semana elaborando el pan y ofreciendo a los clientes, su trabajo inicia a las cuatro de la mañana y finaliza a las dos de la tarde.
Actualmente él solicitó un préstamo para invertirlo en harina, manteca, azúcar y leña, con estos productos podrá mantener la panadería, comparando al por mayor y recibiendo un mejor precio de sus proveedores.
