La aspiración de óseas es convertirse en una persona servicial a la sociedad, creciendo su panadería y ofreciendo una fuente de empleo a jóvenes de la zona.
texts.en:
Óseas lives surrounded by relatives. He is engaged in the sale of French bread and sweet rolls. He works every day of the week making bread and offering it to his customers. His work begins at 4:00 in the morning and ends at 2:00 in the afternoon.

Currently, he is applying for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of flour, lard, sugar and firewood. With these products he will be able to maintain the bakery, purchasing them at wholesale and receiving a better price from his suppliers. Óseas’ goal is to become a person useful to society, enlarging his bakery and offering a source of employment to young people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, lard, sugar, and firewood.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Phea is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase chickens in order to run a poultry farm. In the future, she would like to invest more money in order to expand her poultry farm. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase chickens in order to run a poultry farm

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señorita Sandra con este quinto préstamo desea seguir realizando mejoramientos en su domicilio y este crédito lo utilizara para los enjarres y pintura del exterior de la vivienda. 
Sandra es una persona muy responsable, es soltera vive sola en su domicilio y solventa todos sus gastos, además apoya a su padre con algunos gastos cuando le es posible. 
Es empleada de una oficina desde hace ocho años.
texts.en:
Sandra wants to use this fifth loan to continue making home improvements; she will use this loan to stucco and paint the exterior of her home.  
Sandra is a very responsible person.  She’s single and lives alone.  She pays all her expenses and also helps her father with some of his expenses whenever possible.  She’s been employed in an office for the last 8 years

loans.use: to stucco and paint the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel forma parte del Banco comunal “Mataquito” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa reciclada desde hace tiempo, su mercadería la vende en un puesto que arrienda en diferentes ferias libres de la ciudad. Su horario de trabajo es de las 9ºº de la mañana hasta las 14ºº horas. Los días de trabajo son los sábados, domingos y festivos.
Su mercadería la compra por fardos a conocidos, en estas maletas vienen 60 productos. Cuando la temporada es más baja se dedica a vender dulces, específicamente cajas de cocadas, trufas, cuchuflis, entre otros, los compra en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago y realiza los pedidos por encomienda.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva para adolescentes.
Las metas en su negocio son abastecerse de mercadería para continuar vendiendo.
Raquel vive junto a su marido, sus 3 hijos de 29, 16 y 11 años, además de su nieto de 10 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta mucho de la compañía de las demás socias en las reuniones impartidas en el grupo, comenta que le ha servido para compartir y distraerse en su tiempo libre. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, comenta que le han servido para mejorar las estrategias en su negocio.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Raquel is part of the "Mataquito” communal bank, in the city of Curicó. For a long time now, she has devoted her time to selling second-hand clothing, from stalls which she rents in different open-air markets across the city. Her working hours are from 9am until 2pm, on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. She buys her merchandise as bundles of 60 garments per bag. In low season she also sells sweets, including coconut sweets, truffles, and filled sponge cakes among others. These she buys from a distributor in the city of Santiago, sometimes buying them to order. With the loan she will buy clothing for teens. Her business goal is to increase her stock so she can continue selling. Raquel lives with her husband and their three children, age 29, 16 and 11, and their 10 year old grandson. Her dreams, on a personal level, are to offer a better standard of living for her family.

She is very happy and grateful to have this opportunity offered by [the field partner] Fondo Esperanza, because it has enabled her to invest in her business. She also very much enjoys the companionship of the other members of the communal bank, and she says that meeting them has provided a chance to share experiences and a pleasant way to spend free time. Referring to the training they receive, she says this has helped her to improve her business strategies. 

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the centre of the country. The climate there is a mediterranean one, considered one of the most pleasant in the counrty. It is an area well known for wine-growing and for its beautiful natural scenery. However, despite an increase in the workforce, the last census showed that the region continues to be one of the poorest parts of the country.

loans.use: To buy clothing for teens.

loans.name: Wendy Carolina

texts.es: Wendy Carolina de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos; ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal por catálogo, cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, entre otros tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y ya tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente siempre está a la orden de los clientes; Wendy es una mujer visionaria con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan porque sabe que solo así logrará llegar al éxito; quiere aumentar sus ventas pero no posee de capital suficiente para invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar variedad de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, etc. Wendy Carolina tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar el financiamiento en el periodo establecido y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: cosméticos, perfumes, cremas

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa started a business three years ago selling candies, beer and sodas. Things were going well and she was able to rebuild her house out of wood instead of bamboo and even buy a new roof. But when she separated from her husband, the business nearly fell apart and she was forced to resort to borrowing from a chulquero, or loan shark. She has now paid this debt but hopes to use new loan money to invest in more candies and beer and restart the service to the payphone she has outside the store. Elsa is 32 years old and has four daughters. She is in a new relationship with a man who supports her and her business. She hopes that, with the rebirth of her business, she will be able to cover the costs of running her home and will be able to send her daughters to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase her inventory and restart the service to the payphone she has outside the store.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. is an industrious woman who has benefited from a LAPO loan for the upkeep of her children for the past five years. She is married with four children. She promises if given the loan of $800 she will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sales

loans.name: Maria Herlinda

texts.en:
Ms. Herlinda is married and she has five children, the youngest of whom are 6 and 8 years old. For many years, Herlinda worked in a clothing factory. When the company was restructured, her boss proposed that she do the work from her home, and in this way she started her seamstress workshop in her own home. With the money from her layoff, she bought two sewing machines and started doing work for her previous employer.

Today her business has increased, and she also makes sports uniforms for a school near her house. In order to complete her work, she needs a loan for $275, which she will use to buy the supplies for her work, such as fabric, buttons, thread, etc. She will repay the loan over a period of 4 to 8 months. Your help can contribute to making Herlinda's dreams come true. She is sincerely grateful for your valuable help.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Herlinda es casada y tiene cinco hijos, los menores son de 6 y 8 años de edad. Durante varios años Herlinda trabajó en una maquiladora de ropa de la localidad, ante cambios en la estructura de la empresa, después su jefe le propuso que hiciera el trabajo desde su hogar, y de esta manera inició su taller de costura en su propio domicilio, con el dinero de la liquidación compró dos máquinas e inició maquilando para la empresa en la que anteriormente laboraba.

Actualmente su negocio se ha incrementado, y maquila los uniformes deportivos a una escuela localizada cerca de su casa, para poder terminar su trabajo requiere de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de su trabajo, como tela, botones, hilos, etc., ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir a que se cumplan los sueños de Herlinda, ella agradece sinceramente tu valiosa ayuda.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. is a 36-year-old mother of four children, who makes buns, etc. from home.  Her children are all in school. Because Lisa is a breadwinner for the family, it is very important that everything is done in a proper and neat manner as the products are sold to customers near a school within the village.  Lisa is grateful for her husband, who supports her in her endeavor, as well as for S.P.B.D. for enabling her to receive this loan.  Without it, her business wouldn’t have started.

loans.use: Establish Micro-Business

loans.name: Mónica Elena

texts.es:
Mónica is a young mother who works harder every day to give the best to her family. She is the mother of two small children, who receive love and care from her. Faced with an economic crisis, she received the support of her mother-in-law, who encouraged her to start a small business selling women’s clothing. She has been doing this for the past three years, and her perseverance has made her store one of the most prestigious in the area. She is now able to help out with the household expenses.

A while ago, some friends taught her how to knit shawls and hats, to which she gave beautiful finishing touches using her well-known cleverness and creativity. Mónica longs to increase the products she has in her small store, with the goal of giving a better quality of life to her little ones. Knowing that it isn’t easy to break new ground, she works diligently each day to get ahead. She is requesting a loan of $325.00, which will serve to increase her capital so that she can continue her business with more new items, which will benefit her regular customers. Let’s help her so that she can convert her dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica es una joven madre que cada día se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia, ella es madre de dos pequeños, los que a través de sus cuidados reciben su amor y cuidado. Ante la crisis económica que atravesaba recibió el apoyo de su suegra y la animó a iniciar un pequeño negocio de prendas de vestir para damas; al cual viene dedicándose desde hace tres años, su perseverancia hizo de ella una de las modistas con mayor prestigio en su localidad y en la actualidad puede sostenerse y apoyar con los ingresos de la canasta familiar, hace poco sus amigas le enseñaron a tejer chalinas y gorros a los que les brindó excelentes acabados con su ya conocido ingenio y creatividad.Mónica anhela incrementar sus productos en el pequeño taller que tiene con el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños amores.Consiente de que abrirse campo no es fácil ella diligentemente trabaja cada día para salir adelante y por ello que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que le servirán para incrementar el capital de su negocio y así poder implementarla con más novedades a beneficio de sus asiduas clientas.Apoyémosla para que pueda convertir su anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: Mónica wishes to invest in many new items for her discerning customers

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mwasiti H. is a 37-year-old resident  of the Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. She owns a shop selling food and household utensils. Mwasiti has been running the shop for the past three years, and dreams of turning her retail shop into a wholesale shop. To help expand, she needs a loan of $325.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en: Yassine is a 25 year old man who lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Yassine is a barber and needs $1000 to buy the required products for his business. This is the second time Yassine is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He is an honest and hardworking micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: Yassine would like to buy the required products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O. is 38 years old.  She is married, has one child, and lives in Benin City.  She sells frozen chickens and turkeys.  She is requesting a loan of $875 to buy more frozen chickens and turkeys to sell. She spent a year learning how to do business from her sister and started her own business in 2002. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy frozen chickens and turkeys to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is married with 5 children and is 50 years old. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuff, a trade she learned from her mother. She has been in LAPO for 8 years and she is the leader of her group. She needs a loan of $525 to enable her to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions, drinks and foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Miss. Chinda T., 23, is single and lives with her old mother on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River. Her father died many years ago. She is the only child in the family.

Miss. Chinda learned to weave from her mother and started silk production when she was twelve years old. She sells her finished products inside the island. Her mother does farming. She grows tomatoes for resale to middlemen in the village.

Chinda is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $100 to buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun K. and her husband married in 1970. They have six children:one son and five daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home and three children live under their roof and help them in doing farming.  The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soeun and her husband have been doing farming almost thirty years. They grow jasmine flowers and bananas on the farm near their home. Besides farming, Mrs. Soeun sells jasmine flowers at market in Phnom Penh. She buys jasmine flowers from farmers in the village for resale. 

Mrs. Soeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 for purchasing jasmine flowers from farmers.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers from farmers.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.id:
Art Figure sales business of Ratna W. and husband is until now expanding quite well, since its stategic location at Teuku Umar barat streer, which is close to famous tourist locations of Legian and Kuta. The customers are not only local tourists, but also foreign tourists, even many become permanent customers. The profit obtained are used to pay for house rent, and household expenses. Ratna W. expects that with this loan her business could further expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha jual arca yang ditekuni Ratna W. bersama suaminya hingga saat ini cukup berkembang, dikarenakan letaknya yang strategis yakni berada di Jl.Teuku Umar barat, yang berdekatan dengan lokasi pariwisata terkenal Legian dan Kuta. Para pembelinya bukan saja para wisatawan lokal, tetapi juga dari mancanegara bahkan ada yang sudah menjadi langganan tetap. Keuntungan yang didapat dipergunakan sebagai biaya membayar rumah kontrakan, dan juga untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga tentunya. Ratna W. berharap dari pinjaman kali ini, usaha yang ditekuninya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Talita

texts.en: Talita Foleni, 33, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the fish business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Talita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband does the fishing duty.

loans.use: To buy an extra pair of fishing shoes for her husband, a fishing net, and to make home repairs.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly C., 32, a widow with two sons, lives along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her sons is in local school.   
For five years, Mrs Somaly and her sister have been reselling vegetables purchased at Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh.
To this point she has been renting, but now is requesting a loan of $500 to add to her own money to purchase a shop from which to sell the vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a shop for selling vegetables.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Hello, pleased to meet you. My name is Oralia L., I sell ladies’ wallets and I have done this for a number of years as it generates enough income for the maintenance of my home and to support my family. A few years ago I bought this small house which I remodel little by little and at the moment I would like to fix the courtyard – to lay down cement and to put bricks around it so that it is not made out of earth. For this reason I am asking for your help so that I can improve my home. Thank you. 
With the profits I make from selling ladies' wallets I can cover all of my obligations to this loan. Greetingsh. 

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.



hola mucho gusto mi nombre es oralia L. me dedico a la venta de carteras para damas, ya tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad la cual me genera lo suficiente para el mantenimiento de mi hogar y de mi familia.
hace varios años atras compre esta casita en la cual voy remodelando poco a poco, y en estos momentos deseo arreglar el patio de la casa, hacerlo de cemento y ponerle ladrillos de exterior, para que el patio ya no sea de tierra.
por tal razon estoy solicitando la ayuda a ustedes para poder mejorar mi hogar, gracias.
con las ganancias que me dejan mis ventas de carteras puedo cubrir todas mis obligaciones.
.saludos

loans.use: Purchase of materials to rebuild the courtyard and to pay for the labour

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis F., 36 year old woman, is married and has three kids. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, and so on. She needs a loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other goods, in order to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, and cartons of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia A. is 36 years old. She is single with three children:  one has successfully completed high school and the other two are still in school. Olivia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, evaporated milk, bottled water, body and hair creams, powdered milk etc. However, she is constrained by low capital from making meaningful progress. She requests a loan to buy more inventory to increase her profits. She believes that with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to realize her dream. She is a member of the group called "Biako ye" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id: Keseharian Ni Ketut Sudantri yang hidup di desa selalu dihabiskan untuk menggarap ladangnya bersama suaminya. Penghasilan dari ladang yang tersebut tidaklah mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya serta untuk menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih di bangku sekolah. Ni Ketut Sudantri juga mencoba usaha sampingan yaitu jual beli kakao kering serta memelihara babi di rumahnya. Melihat perkembangan ternak babi yang semakin pesat serta menarik untuk ditingkatkan maka Ni Ketut Sudantri mencoba menambah modal usahanya beternak babi dengan cara mengajukan pinjaman ke DINARI . Ini merupakan pinjaman pertama ke DINARI yang besarnya Rp.5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan serta untuk pelunasannya akan dilakukan pada akhir periode dengan perhitungan babi-babi peliharaannya sudah terjual. Sebagai langkah awal Ni Ketut Sudantri membeli bibit penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dengan harga Rp.350.000,- / ekor. Pinjaman ini juga digunakannya untuk membeli pakan babi selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Ni Ketut Sudantri berharap keuntungan yang diperoleh selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan bisa mencapai Rp.1000.000,- sehingga mampu dijadikan tambahan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari serta membiayai sekolah anaknya.
texts.en:
Dengan keadaan ekonomi keluarga yang pas-pasan tidak membuat Putu Oko berusaha dengan setengah-setengah dalam menghidupi keluarganya. Putu berusaha membantu suaminya yang sebagai petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu setiap bulannya dengan mengembangkan ternak babi di rumahnya. Ternak babi memang menjadi keseharian ibu-ibu di desanya dan Putu sendiri sudah lama menekuni beternak babi. Tetapi sekarang Putu bertekad meningkatkan usahanya ternak babinya supaya maksimal dan memberikan penghasilan yang bagus. Maka timbullah kerja sama antara Putu dengan DINARI untuk pertama kalinya dengan besar pinjaman Rp.5000.000,- dimana sistem pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman yaitu dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dengan harga Rp.300.000,- serta selanjutnya berencana juga membeli induk babi. Disamping itu pinjaman ini juga berguna untuk membeli persediaan pakan ternak selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Diharapkan keuntungan yang diperoleh nantinya minimal Rp.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui program KIVA ini memberi harapan besar bagi Putu Oko untuk meningkatkan ekonomi keluarganya dan bisa menanggung kebutuhan kedua anaknya.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi dan pakannya

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora Encarna pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-2 Lt. 15, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 63 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, 2 mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa y por las noches vende pollo broaster. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo y de su hijo Loser. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 3 cajas de leche, 2 cajas de vinagre y sillao, 1 saco de azúcar, etc.

Encarna es feliz porque tiene una familia unida. Agradece a Dios por toda la felicidad que siempre le brinda.
texts.en:
Encarna belongs to the “Las Divinas” community bank, which is located in Urbanización Municipal Mz. A-2 Lt. 15, in the Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali department. She is a 63 year old mother of 6 children; 2 of whom are grown. She is married, and her husband works independently in his job. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently she has a small convenience store in her home, and in the evenings she sells roasted chickens. She has the support of her husband and her son Loser. With this 3000 sol loan, which will be paid in 6 months, she will purchase 1 bag of rice, 3 boxes of mil, 2 boxes of vinegar and soy sauce, 1 bag of sugar, etc. Encarna is happy because her family is together. She is grateful to God for all of the happiness in her life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 1 bag of rice, 3 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of vinegar and soy sauce, one bag of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal N. is a villager who lives in Kraing Leav village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Sophal N. is a grocer who makes a small income, which is used to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sith Buntheourn, is a security guard.  Together, they are still unable to provide a good standard of living for their family. Therefore, Mrs. Sophal N. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
For 13 years, Shamil M. has been raising cattle, as well as growing potatoes and carrots. His wife and oldest son help him with looking after the calves. Shamil is planning to spend the income he generates from cattle activities to pay the fees for the education of his children, as he has three of them.

Shamil also has an old car which he uses to take people from his village to the local bazaars or nearby villages. But their main source of income is calf-breeding. Shamil is planning to purchase two cows for breeding. He also wants to improve the winter conditions for his cattle, because this year it is unusually cold in Azerbaijan. For this purpose, Shamil is requesting US$ 1200 for the term of 15 months. Shamil is counting on your help.

loans.use: purchase two calves to raise

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licores, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Reyna son que su hijo sea profesional y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. Reyna is single, 31 years old, and has one son. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries and drinks every day. Reyna needs a 1500 soles loan which will be invested in the purchase of liquor, rice and sugar. Reyna's dreams are that her son learns a profession and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de licores, arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 54 años, esta casado con la Señora Fermina Duarte y tienen 2 hijos menores en edad escolar. Hace 16 ( Dieciseis años) aprendiò a elaborar las guampas (que la gente se usa para beber mate y terere), cuando estaba en la Penitenciaria Nacional de Tacumbù. Don Mariò ingresò a la correccional por un error de la Justicia Paraguaya. Su conyuge es profesora de peluquerìa y tiene montado en su domicilio un instituto de enseñanza y de esta forma generar otro ingreso para la afamilia. El credito será destinado a la compra de cuernos de vacas y toros y asi poder elaborar sus productos atendiendo a la demanda actual.
texts.en:
Mario is 54 years old; he is married to Fermina Duarte and they have two minor school-aged children. Sixteen years ago, he learned to make guampas (glasses made from horn which people use to drink mate and terere - traditional herbal drinks) when he was in the National Penitentiary of Tacumbù. Mario was sent to the detention centre due to an error made by Paraguayan Justice. His spouse teaches hair styling and runs her school in their home in order to have another income for their family. The loan will be used to buy cows' and bulls' horns to be made into products on demand.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows' and bulls' horns

loans.name: Victoria Porfiria

texts.es: La sra. Victoria se dedica a la confección de polleras, Faldas para personas del campo, aprendió este oficio desde muy pequeña, y ella también les enseña la confección a sus hijas. Se compró su casita en la zona de Kupini, donde vive con sus hijas, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Argentina, en el rubro de costura, y cada mes le manda un monto de dinero para los gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela.
texts.en:
Victoria dedicates herself to making “polleras”, skirts worn by the people in the countryside. She learned the craft as a young girl, and is also teaching it to her daughters. She bought her little house in the Kupini zone, where she lives with her daughters. Her husband is working in Argentina in the sewing trade, sending her money each month for household expenses. The loan would be invested toward the purchase of fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric.

loans.name: Makiese Plus Group

texts.fr: Wivine M. a 47 ans, veuve et mère d’une fille âgée de 24 ans qui est encore étudiante. Elle vend des beignets, saucisses ainsi que d’œufs. Son capital actuel représente une valeur de $200. Wivine vend dans un quartier au centre de Kinshasa où elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle a commencé pour la toute première fois la vente des poulets en 1989. Son capital initial était de $40. De 1990 à 1993, avec le bénéfice accumulé de son affaire, Wivine a décidé de diversifier son affaire en ajoutant des saucisses qu’elle achetait en gros et les livrait aux magasins d’alimentations. Cela lui procurait assez de revenus jusqu’à $1000. En 1993, Wivine fut victime des pillages à Kinshasa et perdit toute sa marchandise et resta sans fonds ni marchandise. C’est ainsi de 1994 à 2004, elle tentait de vendre des cartons des savons sans succès et était déséquilibrée avec la mort de son mari en 2003. Elle changeant d’activité en 2005 pour se lancer dans la vente d’épices qui lui procurât un capital important de $ 2400 qui malheureusement furent emportés par des voleurs. Vers la fin de la même année, Wivine reprit l’activité de fabrication des beignets avec un faible capital de $20 jusqu’à ce jour. Son affaire croit rapidement et produit un bénéfice de $30 par semaine. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu lui a permis d’acheter 1 sac de farine de froment, 1 bidon d’huile végétale raffinée de 25 litres, du sucre et autres ingrédients pour la fabrication des beignets dans le but d’accroitre le bénéfice. Son rêve est d’ouvrir un dépôt des boissons afin de livrer aux détaillants.
texts.en:
Wivine M., 47, is the widowed mother of a daughter who is 24 and who is still a student. She sells fried dough and sausages and eggs. Her present working capital amounts to about US$ 200.

Wivine has her sales point in a neighborhood in the center of Kinshasa where she has lots of customers. She began by selling chickens in 1989. Her intital capital was US$ 40. From 1990 to 1993, with the profits she had accumulated from her business, Wivine diversified and added the sale of sausages which she bought wholesale and delivered to grocery stores. This brought her working capital up to US$ 1,000.

In 1993, Wivine fell victim to the pillaging in Kinshasa and lost all her merchandise. She was left without merchandise and without funds. Thus, from 1994 to 2004, she tried selling cases of soap without success. In 2003 she was caught off balance at the death of her husband. She changed her business in 2005 to begin selling spices which brought her to a significant capital of US$ 2,400--which sadly was stolen by robbers.

Around the end of that same year, Wivine took up selling fried dough again with the insignificant working capital of $20, a business she has continued until this day. Her business is growing rapidly and producing a profit of US$ 30 per week. The loan that she has received has allowed her to buy 1 sack of wheat flour, 1 jerrycan of 25 liters of refined vegetable oil, sugar, and other ingredients for making fried dough in order to grow her profit. Her dream is to open up a drinks depot so as to be able to supply retailers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing one sack of wheat flour, 1 jerrycan of 25 liters of vegetable oil, and some sugar

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a charcoal-selling business in the Tandika ward of the Temeke district in Dar es Salaam. Charcoal is the main source of power in Africa and other developing countries, due to high charge and unstable electrical power. Lucy purchases her charcoal directly from the producers in wholesale and sells in retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Parikhanım

texts.en: Parikhanım

loans.use: To purchase one calf and six sheep

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel M. is 25 years old and married. He lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, in the southern part of the Philippines. He has a business buying and selling bananas.

Joel strives hard to provide for the needs of his wife and his family. Unfortunately, his income is not enough because of the smaller supplies he gets during harvest time. He wants to grow his business and be competitive enough to satisfy his customers. Joel needs additional financial assistance of Php 5,000 to buy more bananas to meet his customers' demand and generate a higher income. This will be his first loan with HSPFI (a Kiva partner), where his brother is already a client.

loans.use: To purhcase additional bananas to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima sells sarongs to her customers. She is 35 years old and is married with five children. Fatima hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more wrappers to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo A. M. es un señor de 35 años el cual vive con su esposa y  cuatro hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace poco más de dos años que don Guillermo se dedica a la ebanistería. Construye muebles de diferentes diseños y para diferentes usos. Dice que desde que inició el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
 
En estos momentos lo que desea don Guillermo es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más madera y otros materiales que necesita para la elaboración de los muebles. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 

Don Guillermo forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un  microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Guillermo A. M. is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a town located 150 kilometers south of San José Province, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. Vegetables and coffee are farmed there and people also engage in other economic activities such as fattening cattle and hogs. There are also some organic agriculture projects, such as hydroponic vegetables. In addition to agriculture, the community has mechanic shops, a supermarket, small restaurants, and a furniture workshop. Guillermo has been working as a carpenter for a little more than two years. He makes furniture in a variety of styles and for different uses. He says that since he started this business, things have gone well for him. The business has been well accepted in his community and the income it has generated has helped him to support his family. At this time Guillermo is requesting a loan of 685,000 CRC to buy more wood and other materials that he needs to make the furniture. With this, he hopes that his small business will grow and that it will generate enough income for him to improve his living conditions. Guillermo is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, he has received a small loan that has allowed him to grow like other small business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Guillermo  from  Costa Rica

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Lucila Otilia

texts.es:
La señora LUCILA OTILIA C. D. C.    tiene 65 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO  , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios Hasta 6to D. primaria  , tiene 3 hijos mayores y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Lucila  se dedica a la vender en la bodega D. su casa productos alimenticios como: arroz, azucar,fideos,leche,aceite,gaseosa,etc
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos para implementar su bodega.
 Con el crédito D. 800  soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra productos D. abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros; los cuales venD. en la tienda D. su casa.
Lucila tiene como sueño implementar con mas productos alimenticios su negocio y empezar a vender carne D. res, pollo, gallina, pato
texts.en:
Lucila Otilia C. D. C. is 65 years old and lives in the Laredo district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur has finished schooling through the 6th level of primary school. She has 3 grown children and none of them are dependent on her. Lucila sells food products from her cellar such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, soda, etc. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought more products to stock her cellar. With this loan of 800 PEN she will invest in her business by buying grocery items such as rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, among others. She will sell these in the store in her house. Lucila dreams of offering a greater variety of food products and beginning to sell beef, chicken, and duck.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items such as: rice, sugar, pasta, and milk, which she will sell from the store in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more furniture to increase his sales

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Mgodi North borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 18,9 years .

Christina started her own food business selling chips 2 years ago,she works 13 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Christina`s First loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes and cooking oil for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Christina hopes to save money and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and cooking ol for her business

loans.name: Las Superpoderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Superpoderosas” están representadas por la señora Maida y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cosméticos, joyas de plata, comida, ropa interior pan y al servicio de peluquería. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Superpoderosas" group is led by Señora Maida and is comprised of 12 members who are in the midst of their second cycle with the institution, demonstrating responsibility, honesty, and the desire to move ahead and continue growing with the economic support that the institution provides. Most of the members sell cosmetics, silver jewelry, food, breads, underwear, or provide hairdressing services. The strength that these women have brought since their first business cycle has recently begun to bear fruit; therefore the new need for a loan will be used to grow their businesses and to increase their merchandise in order to put high quality and competitive products on the market. The members' hope is to have a productive business that provides their families with a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Milda

texts.es:
La socia Milda, pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene  35 años de edad, es conviviente, la socia aún no tiene hijos , nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica desde siempre al cultivo de hortalizas y de muchas variedades de flores, el río grande una zona bastante fértil para estos productos, nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para la fertilización de tierras, semillas, y distribución de las mismas.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina M. is in the business of selling rice, beans, and eggs at a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to purchase larger saucepans.  With the extra profits she receives from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy chickens, beef etc to cook in the restaurant.

Regina is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has 3 children who all go to school.  

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bigger sauspans

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, he is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and feed.

Mr. Vuthy C. lives in Srae Nong village in Takeo province. His wife, Mrs. Nao Srey Neang, is a farmer. He is the father of a young child who is 6 months old. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel has worked as a builder since 2005. He’s 23 years old and living with his parents. He helps his family to raise his three unemployed brothers who still go to school.

Today, Fadel is requesting $800 to buy a special wood support for his business.

loans.use: To buy a special wood support

loans.name: Joseph Liembuli

texts.en: Joseph Liembuli S. runs a retail shop where he has sold goods like sugar, tea leaves, cooking oil, rice, soft drinks and salt to walk-in customers during the last 12 years.  His business challenges are low sales and strong competition from similar retail kiosks.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES30,000 loan to add to his stock of sugar, flour, rice and salt.  Joseph's goal in the future is to become a wholesaler.  He is married and has four daughters ranging from 2 to 10 years.  He describes himself as hardworking and polite.

loans.use: To buy five bags of sugar, bales of flour, rice and salt.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro S. is from the village of Tabo-o in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old. Pedro is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Pedro provides a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) services to local community members. Pedro has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Pedro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide services. This will be Pedro's second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide a service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Segundo Hermógenes

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 16 y 15 años en el distrito de Pucalá, ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la apicultura. El nos cuenta que viene criando abejas en terrenos cercanos al complejo arqueológico Huaca Rajada (Complejo donde fué encontrado el Señor de Sipán) y vende la miel que recolecta en un pequeño complejo comercial cercano al museo de sitio.

La iniciativa del negocio surgió gracias a una oportunidad de capacitación que diera el fondo Italo – Peruano a los pobladores de la zona para que empezaran a ganarse el sustento haciendo actividades de producción, como por ejemplo apicultura, elaboración de artesanía, trabajos en madera, etc.

Segundo desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de nuevas colmenas, pero para ello necesita de láminas de cera natural con las cuales pueda facilitar el trabajo a las abejas, así como de un insumo para evitar que las hormigas ataquen las colmenas. El no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar lo que necesita por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales de éxito. Esta es la tercera vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la fotografía nos muestra las láminas y las placas que necesita rellenar para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo, 47, is married and lives with his wife and two children, 16 and 15 years old, in Pucalá district, which is 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a beekeeper for the past two years. He tells us that he has been raising bees on lands near the Huaca Rajada arqueological complex (where The Lord of Sipán was found) and he sells the honey in a small commercial complex near the site's museum. He started this business thanks to training opportunities provided by the Italo-Peruano Fund to residents of the area so that they could earn their living in productive activities, like beekeeping, crafts-making, woodworking, etc. Segundo wants to increase his production by installing new hives. To do so, however, he needs natural wax panels that will facilitate the bees' work as well as a certain substance that will prevent ants from attacking the hives. He does not have sufficient funds to do so; therefore, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa requesting a 1500 new sol loan. His greatest wish is to continue working in order to see his children become professionals. This is his third collaboration with our Institution and he has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client with respect to repayments. In the photo, he shows the panels and plates that he needs to fill in order to reach his objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural wax panels for his bee hives.

loans.name: Violetas 3 Group

texts.en:
Yane is the coordinator of her group Violetas (Violets), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. (Many Haitians recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic.) Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty, industrial area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Yane is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "fansasia (fantasy)" which is a sort of variety store for women and girls. She will invest in her business by purchasing skirts, underwear, jeans, stencils and arts and crafts supplies to sell in her store. She will use the profits to save towards sending her children to the university when they are of age. Yane thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy skirts, underwear, jeans, stencils, arts and crafts to sell

loans.name: Herlinda Susana

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Herlinda es soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Herlinda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa, mantas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, cereales.
Los sueños de Herlinda son tener casa propia y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the community bank "Nobleza" (nobility).

Herlinda is single. She is 31 years old and has two children. Herlinda travels to the different markets in the area, where she sells clothing and blankets and she buys grains that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Herlinda needs a loan of 1500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and grains.

Herlinda's dreams are to have her own house and to save for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes and grains

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 44 años, es soltera tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, ambos cursan la educación primaria.
Posee una despensa en su domicilio, con una antigüedad de 10 años aproximadamente, se inicio con la venta de bebidas en frente a su domicilio, luego de a poco cargo un pequeño kiosko que  fue creciendo, actualmente tiene buena clientela y un buen inventario de mercaderías.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: azúcar, yerba, fideos, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 44 years old, single, and has two dependent children who are in elementary school. She runs a food pantry out of her home and has approximately ten years of experience in this business. María started selling drinks in front of her house, but she later set up a small kiosk that continued to grow. She currently has a good clientele and a sufficient inventory of merchandise.

María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Esther pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal Villa de Sol ella se dedica a las confecciones de artículos para el hogar hace 4 años es casada y juntamente con su esposo desean seguir progresando con sus ventas, ya que su objetivo es alquilar un local para hacerlo un taller y dar trabajo a otras personas.
Otilda alquila y vende trajes de vestir y vestidos de fiesta, con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar su stand hace mucho tiempo, con este negocio apoya con los gastos en casa además contribuye con los gastos de sus 5 hijos  
Juan es uno de los socios optimistas y responsable del grupo el hace jaulas para mascotas, de diferentes materiales, asi el crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos para mejorar la calidad de los acabados ya que hay mucha competencia, y sabe que tiene que innovar sus trabajos.
Nuestros socios destinaran el reciente préstamo para la compra de mercadería y otros artículos que le ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Communal Bank “Villa del Sol” (Village of the Sun) and has been selling everything from clothing to household products for four years. She and her husband want to continue progressing with their sales. Her goal is to rent a location for establishing a workshop where she can provide employment to other people.

Otilda rents and sells formalwear and party dresses. After much effort, she was able to buy a vending post where she spends most of her time. This business helps her with the household expenses and supporting her five children.

Juan is one of the optimistic and responsible members of the group. He builds animal cages out of different materials. His loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies that will improve the quality of his finished goods. He experiences much competition, so he knows he has to be innovative in his work.

The members have designated this loan toward the purchase merchandise and other items that they need to improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old and married with one child. He runs a retail shop selling general merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour and cooking fat to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has one employee.

Ronald has joined a group of young entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya who meet on a weekly basis to save their money and guarantee each other's loans. He is determined to improve his business now that he can access loans. He has requested a first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add stock of maize and wheat flour. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale and open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Fayziddin

texts.ru: Наимов Файзиддин проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Файзиддин имеет высшее образование по специальности "Бухгалтер". Работает по профессии. Одновременно занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Fayziddin N. lives near Vose. He is 50 years old. He is married and has six children; his wife is a homemaker. Fayziddin has a college degree in accounting and works in his professional field. In addition, he raises livestock. He mainly raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this for four years already. He is taking out a loan in order to purchase large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita C. is from the village of Alibago Enrile in Cagayan.  She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Vita owns and runs a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products like shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community.  Vita has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

Vita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI.  Now Vita is requesting a loan of 13000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be her third from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

---------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sarai Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarai está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María José G. M. quien vende gaseosas y bisutería desde hace cinco años. Ella tiene tres hijos el menor tiene 2 años y los mayores tienen 11 y 15 años de edad quienes estudian y le ayudan a ver el negocio.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Incilla E. S. Martínez quien tiene una pequeña pulpería y Melba del Socorro Baltodano quien vende frescos y helados. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios con el propósito de prosperar.
texts.en:
The Saraj group is made up of three hard working women. One of them is María José G. M. who has sold sodas and costume jewelry for the last five years. She has three children, the smallest is 2 years old and the older ones are 11 and 15 years old, in school and help with her business. Her partners in the group are María Incilla E. S. Martínez, who has a small convenience store, and Melba del Socorro Baltodano, who sells fruit drinks and ice cream. They will invest the proceeds of the loan in their businesses with the goal of prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of costume jewelry and soda beverages.

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es:
Freddy es un joven, de 24 años de edad, con deseo de superación, padre de un hijo, su esposa trabaja con el despachando para lograr la atención al cliente.
Antes vendía verduras y frutas en un mercado de la capital, había veces que perdía las frutas y era cuando le bajaba el capital. Es por eso decide cambiar de negocio y vende su pequeño tramo.
Y comienza a poner su pulpería, el cual tiene un año de estar administrando.
Su objetivo es lograr aumentar de inventario para logar mejorar las ganancias ya que queda poco por productos, es por eso quiere invertir mas y opciona por el financiamiento para lograr el objetivo de crecer.
Con esto lograra comprar, quintales de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, caja de jabón, golosinas, lácteos, gaseosas. A si como aumentar la venta de leña. 
Sus planes a futuro es lograr hacer mejoras a su casa, ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Freddy is a 24 year-old youth who has a desire to succeed. He is the father of a son, and his wife works with him providing service to his customers. Before, he used to sell fruits and vegetables in a market in the capital. There were times when he lost the fruit and when his capital was falling. For this reason he decided to change businesses and sell his small stand in the market. Then he started up a small grocery store, which he has been running now for a year. His goal is to increase his inventory so that he can have better earnings, since he currently has only a small number of products. For this reason he wants to invest more and he has chosen to take this loan in order to achieve this objective. With this loan he will buy 100 pound units of rice, sugar, beans, and corn, boxes of soap, snacks, dairy products and soft drinks. He will also increase his sales of firewood. In the future he plans to make improvements to his house, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy 100 pound units of rice, sugar, beans, and corn, boxes of soap, dairy products and soft drinks to increase his sales

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es soltera y tiene un hijo de 13 años, Dionisia vende ropa de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía y por las tardes se dedica a la atención de sus hijos, además viaja a las diferentes ferias. Solicita un crédito de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, buzos, polos.
Dionisia es socia del Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son los talleres Gals y los incentivos para ahorrar.
Dionisia vive en casa de su abuelita y su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia además de que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dionisia is single and has a 13-year-old son. She peddles clothing in the Nery García market from 6am until noon. Afternoons are dedicated to child care. She also goes to various markets. She is asking for a 2500 sol loan to buy sweaters, t-shirts and polo-type shirts. Dionisia is a member of the Sarita communal bank. What she enjoys most are the GALS (gender equality) workshops and savings incentives. Dionisia lives in her grandmother’s house and her greatest wish is to own her own home and that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, t-shirts, polo-type shirts.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz P. G. tiene 33 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9, y 6 anos.  

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y a trabajo laboral con su vecino. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Ventanas. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en labores agrícolas como maiz. El apoyo del préstamo cambiaria mucho su vida. Lo permitirá comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que se pone en el cultivo de maíz. Su sueno es tener una casa propia y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta ver las noticias en la noche.
texts.en:
Maria Luz P. G. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has three children (ages 16, 9, and 6).

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Maria is a farmer who grows corn and also performs work for her neighbor. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her farming activities, such as growing corn. The support provided through this loan will bring great change to her life. It will allow her to buy the supplies and fertilizers she needs to grow corn. Her dream is to have her own home and provide her children with a good education. The challenges she faces in her work include the diseases and pests that impact her corn. One of these pests is known as “langosta”.

At night, Maria enjoys watching the news.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Tara Devi

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Tara Devi P.. She is married and has two children aged 15 and 12. In 2000, she established her vegetable-farming business and, working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. Tara Devi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW. She used this most recent loan to purchase seed and fertilizers for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer, which enables them to grow cash crops to sell in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. About Patan BPW: This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner in Nepal: micro-finance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  Neither of her children is currently in school.  Stella has a business of selling plastic materials for home use, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to invest in another business like rearing chickens.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and help her with her transport costs.  In the future, Stella hopes to go back to school and expand her business more.        

Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing her business sense.

loans.use: to invest in another business like rearing chickens

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke N., 47, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She and her husband are police officers, earning an income of 5 USD each per day.

Ke is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to repair her house. In the future, she would like to send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Milton Eliezer

texts.es: EL SEÑOR MILTON ELIEZER A. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO, AUN NO TIENEN HIJOS.  EL SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE HUEVOS, TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA GRANJA EN DONDE TIENE A SUS GALLINAS DESDE QUE SON PEQUEÑAS HASTA QUE EMPIEZAN A PONER LOS HUEVOS, EL CUENTA QUE LAS CUIDA Y LES DA SUS ALIMENTOS MIENTRAS VAN CRECIENDO Y ASI DESPUES OBTIENE LA RECOMPENSA DE SU ESFUERZO, EL ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR GALLINAS YA GRANDES  QUE ESTEN LISTAS PARA PONER LOS HUEVOS,  ASI VE MUCHO MAS RAPIDO LA RECUPERACION DE SU CAPITAL INVERTIDO YA QUE INMEDIATAMENTE EL VENDE LOS HUEVOS, AHORA TIENE MAS DEMANDA DE HUEVOS YA QUE HAY MUCHAS TIENDAS Y PERSONAS QUE LE COMPRAN LOS CARTONES DE HUEVOS, GRACIAS A DIOS LE HA IDO BIEN, EL ESTA SEGURO QUE ESTE CREDITO LE SERÀ DE MUCHO BENEFICIO  YA QUE TIENE MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y PROYECTOS,  EL CONFIA  QUE SU NEGOCIO VA A PROSPERAR AUN MAS CON ESTE CREDITO Y VA A OBTENER MAS GANANCIA Y ASI CUMPLIR CON SUS METAS.
texts.en: Milton Eliezer A. is 22 years old; he is married, but the couple does not have children. He sells eggs. He has a small farm where he raises hens from the time they are little until they start laying eggs. He says that he cares for them and gives them what they need while they are growing, and then he is rewarded for his work. He is requesting this loan to purchase hens who are already grown, who are ready to start laying eggs. This is so he will recuperate his investment much more quickly since he will immediately sell the eggs. These days there is more demand for eggs since there are many stores and people who buy cartons of eggs. Thanks to God, things have gone well for Milton; he is sure that this loan will help him greatly, since he has so many dreams and projects. He said that his business will prosper even more with this loan and he will have more income so he will be able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: Purchase laying hens

loans.name: Rubén Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rubén Valdés vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón de León. Trabaja actualmente en una institución en el municipio esforzandose para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillo y cemento para mejorar su vivienda ya que requiere llevar a cabo dicha obra a lo inmediato para así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que tanto lo necesita hoy en día.
texts.en:
This client's name is Rubén Antonio Valdés L.. He lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, in the department of León, 1 block east of the health clinic. He has a live-in partner and currently works for the Santa Rosa eel Peñón MINSA [Ministry of Health] as a disease vector control technician. He has worked for this institution for 15 years. 

The client has his own house, which he would like to improve. The loan will be used to buy bricks and cement for his house, since he plans to construct a new room. This will allow him to achieve a better life with his family.

loans.use: Buying bricks and cement to improve his home

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 33 años, es un hombre trabajador, convive con Maribel, de 28 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que crían y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en zona rural de “Santa Clara”. Cuando apenas era un niño, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, por ello, cuando estableció su propia familia, ya tenia experiencia en el cultivo de papa, y como padre responsable, en cada cosecha realizada, comercializaba su producción en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde pudo adquirir buenas ganancias y utilidades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y ver como la semilla crece poco a poco. Por ello para el futuro, está pensando ahorrar lo suficiente, para adquirir una camioneta con el que podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad no solo a la capital, también a otras ciudades del país, ya que Ignacio quiere ser un comerciante mayorista de tubérculos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal, agradece el apoyo ofrecido en los momentos difíciles que pasó. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y guano (fertilizante natural), para nivelar su cultivos de papa de la variedad “pericholi” y “única”, que cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en: 33 year old Ignacio is a hardworking man who lives with 28 year old Maribel. They have four young children who they are bringing up and educating in their own home which is located in the rural area of Santa Clara. When he was just a boy, his parents taught him how to work the earth. This meant that when he started his own family he already had experience growing potatoes. As he is a responsible father, each harvest time he takes his crops to the central market of the country's capital and sells it there where he can get a good price and make a profit. What he likes about his work is sowing the crops and seeing how the seed grows little by little. For the future, he is thinking of saving enough to buy a truck that he can use to take his harvest not just to the capital, but also to other cities in the country. Ignacio wants to be a wholesaler of potato tubers. This is his fourth loan from MFP and, as a member of the community bank, he is grateful for the support offered to him in difficult times. He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy natural fertilizer to improve his crops of "pericholi" and 'única" variety potatoes, which he will be harvesting in the coming months.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his potato crop

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonía II está conformado por cinco personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ellos es la señora Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez ella hace 27 años que trabaja realizando bebidas típicas de pozol, semilla de jícaro y vende chatarra de los cuales hace 7 años que reside en Managua. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa.
Rodríguez de 47 años madre de seis hijos invertirá el crédito en chatarra y verduras para seguir creciendo y mejorando.    
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Adelia de los Ángeles L. Ortiz de 20 años se dedica al comercio de prendas de plata; Claudia Vanessa F. Rodríguez se dedica al comercio de frijoles cocidos y leña; Debora Rebeca Godíne tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cocidos y Alfredo Mauricio R. venta de nacatamales y sopas los fines de semanas.
texts.en:
The Armonia II group has five members, all determined, hard-working and entrepreneurial.  Martha Lorena D. Rodriguez is one of the group's members.  She has operated a business making and selling food and drink--pozol (a traditional drink made with cacao and maize), jicaro seeds and snacks--since she moved to Managua 7 years ago.  She wants to make improvements to her house.
Rodriguez, 47, has six children.  She will use her share of the loan to buy snacks and vegetables to stock her business.  The other members of the group are: Adelia de los Angeles Lopez Ortiz, 20, who operates a business selling silver pieces; Claudia Vanessa F. Rodriguez, who operates a business making and selling frijoles and firewood; Deborah Rebeca G., who makes and sells tortillas and frijoles; and Alfredo Mauricio R., who makes and sells nacatamales and soups on the weekends.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married, with four children aged between sixteen and one. She has been doing mixed farming for eight years and selling her milk, maize and beans products locally.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. It is her second loan, after the first one of 25,000 KES. Her purpose is to expand her poultry farming project. This expansion, she believes, will enable her to pay for her children's educations and improve their economic status in general.

She sees poultry feed scarcity as a threat, since it makes returns quite unpredictable.

loans.use: Expansion of her poultry business

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Vin V., age 61, lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Vin V. is a married woman who is devoted to her two children, one of whom is single, studying in school and dependent on her care. The other one is married, but still living under her roof. 

Vin V. grows various crops on her farmland. Now, she is planting rice and corn. Her husband helps her to grow crops. The coming rainfall is good for planting her crop, so Vin V. is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and corn seed for additional planting. 

Vin V. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and corn seed for planting.

loans.name: Kings Of Kings Group -Lugazi

texts.en:
33-year-old Haurat K. belongs to the Kings of Kings Group-Lugazi.  Twenty years ago, she began her small cinema business in Buziika-Lugazi, which provides about 90,000 shillings a week in earnings.  Haurat credits her husband for providing the inspiration to start this business.  Prior to that, she was operating a retail shop. 

Haurat also has a side business selling fast food, which she says brings her extra profit. Haurat is happily married with 4 children.  Her plans for the future include constructing a house for the family.  She has placed a deposit on a plot of land, and she plans to use this loan to pay the remaining balance to purchase the land.

loans.use: To pay the balance for a plot of land

loans.name: Angela Lastenia

texts.es:
Angela Lastenia B. A., tiene 28 años, es soltera vive con los padres y los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando y ayudar a los hijos para que tengan el estudio.

Le gusta mirar la televisión y limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
