Angela Lastenia B. A. is 28 years old, she is single and she lives with her parents and her children. They live in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. She has 4 children. 

The members of the communal bank named "Valle Alto, are originally from the Voluntad de Dios community in Ventanas. This group is primarily involved in short-cycle agriculture, such as corn and rice. 

Angela is an agriculturist who plants corn and rice. She buys and sells the products in the Pena market in Ventanas, and she resells them from her home or in the Ventanas market every day.

She requests a loan to be able to sow corn, to purchase products and seeds. With the help of this loan she will be able to provide for her needs, and to face challenges such as plagues, illness, and the changing weather. Her dream is to purchase land to up her work and to keep her children in school. 

She enjoys watching television and to do housework.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural materials and seeds.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a posho mill (a maize grinding machine) business for the past eight years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Harold faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the availability of maize for grinding is very low, hence low turnout of customers. He hopes to purchase another posho mill for grinding maize in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a posho mill machine. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a posho mill (maize grinder) machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph T. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Joseph has a bar, which he has had for 2 years.

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and beer.  With the help of this loan, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Joseph hopes to complete his residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more sodas and beer

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es:
Juana Iris, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, el negocio tiene 2 años D. administrarlo, este negocio lo aprendió D. sus padres.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa y así diversificar el inventario, y con la oportunidad D. que sus clientes encuentren  las prendas que necesitan.
Las proyecciones D. Juana son que dentro D. un par D. años su negocio se haya multiplicado tanto en mercadería como en clientes, que sus condiciones económicas hayan cambiado y pueda tener una vida más confortable y solvente.
texts.en:
Juana Iris lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with her husband and two children.  Her business is selling new clothes.  She has been running her business for 2 years and she learned it from her parents.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy clothes and diversify her inventory so that her customers can find what they need.

Juana's plans are for her business to have multiplied within a couple of years both in terms of the merchandise she has and in terms of customer numbers.  She hopes that her financial situation will have changed and that she will be able to become more solvent and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
Algunos problemas de salud hicieron que Amparo de Jesús Loaiza T. se viera obligada a dejar su trabajo en una fabrica de arepas, situación que la impulsó a crear su propio negocio ya que es madre cabeza de familia y ella junto con su hijo son quienes cubren los gastos del hogar. 

Desde entonces y con la pujanza característica de una mujer emprendedora, Amparo empezó con una miscelanea en la que vende productos diversos, pues es ésta la oportunidad no sólo para vender sino para realizar diferentes manualidades para aprovechar sus habilidades y así ofrecer otros productos. 

Actualmente, Amparo necesita de un préstamo para comprar alguna mercancía y así tratar de recuperarse, puesto que su cartera ha aumentado y ello le ha generado descapitalización. 

En el futuro Amparo sueña con tener un negocio amplio y con gran variedad de surtido y así generar empleo para otras mujeres que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Due to various health problems, Amparo de Jesús Loaiza T. needed to leave her job in an "arepas" factory.  (Arepas are kind of local corn bread).  Her health situation drove her to create her own business.  She is a mother and the head of her household.  Together, she and her son cover the household expenses. 

With the characteristic strength of an enterprising woman, Amparo opened a small general store in which she sells various products.  This created an opportunity for her to not only make sales but to also take advantage of her skill in making different handicrafts, which allows her to offer other products in her store. 

Currnetly, Amparo needs a loan to purchase some merchandise to try to recover her business.  Her client list has increased, but that has generated a loss of capital.  

In the future, Amparo hopes to have a bigger store with a large assortment of merchandise, which she hopes will generate jobs for other women who need work.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad de artesana hace 20 años.

Ella labora de lunes a viernes con su artesanía y los fines de semana son las ventas de la misma. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia  ya que es más frecuente por su sector. Con préstamo ella quiere comprar hierro, bloques, tablas para su negocio. En un futuro quiere construir su vivienda de cemento y ampliar un taller tanto artesanal como mecánico para su esposo y así sacar adelante a su familia en lo que más necesiten.
texts.en:
Inés is 30 years old and is a hardworking woman who began her handicraft business 20 years ago.

She works from Monday to Friday with her handicrafts and sells them on the weekends. What affects her business is the delinquency, as it is more common in her area. With the loan, she wants to buy iron, blocks and tables for her business. In the future, she wants to build a cement house and set up an artisanal and mechanic workshop for her husband in order to get her family ahead where they need it the most.

loans.use: to buy iron, blocks, and tables

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. José gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Tiene dos años de experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Conoce a la perfección esta actividad porque la aprendió de su padre, quien lo apoya en sus deberes diaria del negocio. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: Jose is 23 years old and he is single. He lives in his parents' house in the district of Olmos, an agricultural region with significant commercial movement located in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Jose earns a living by providing passenger transportation services on his motorcycle rickshaw. It is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin where to to transport passengers. He has two years’ experience in the field and he has very good personal and work-related references. He knows this business very well having learned it from his father. He supports him with his daily business obligations. He wants to use his loan to carry out maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle rickshaw. He needs to maintain his vehicle in good condition to be able to keep offering his clients a good level of service. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance and repairs for his rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits to make pulp.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two teenage children. She owns a small business growing vegetables in greenhouses. Olga has been in this business for 17 years. She’s got five large greenhouses. This business provides her and her family with necessary income as well as vegetables for their own use.

Olga is very entrepreneurial and wants to develop her business further. She would like to purchase a modern watering system that will save water and increase the productivity of her greenhouses. To do so, she needs 10,000 Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH). After raising good crops and making good sales, Olga plans to build one more greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase a modern watering system for the greenhouses that will save water

loans.name: Nyabuto

texts.en:
Nyabuto is 39 yrs old and married to Nancy who contributes to the income of the family. They have one child who is nineteen years old. Nyabuto has been running his farm for a period of about seven years with an income of KES.12,000 a month.

This is his second loan with Kadet after repaying the previous one successfully. He wants to use this loan to pay the school fees for his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his child up to the highest level of education and thus improve his child's future.

loans.use: He wants to use the loan to pay the school fees for his child.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 33, is married to Carolyne who is a teacher and they are blessed with one child. Samuel sells fruit wholesale which he has been doing for eight years.The business earns him a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use it to buy fruit, e.g., apples, grapes, and mangoes for resale. Samuel intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and hopes to supply fruit to all parts of the country using a truck in future.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as apples, grapes, tangerines, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 36 years old and married with four children between the ages 10 and 15 years old. Speciose sells tomatoes and onions in her store. Her business is well organized. She has three years of experience in her business and she works from 6 A.M. until 8 P.M. every day. Speciose currently employs one person to help her. Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Speciose will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, etc

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 29 years old and single. He has worked in the transportation sector since 2002, when he bought a van that he uses to transport people and tourists all over Lebanon. He started out as an employee, but he has started his own business. 

Walid is requesting a first-time loan from A. Majmoua to complete necessary maintenance on his van, which is his only source of income. He hopes to improve his life through his work and to have a family in the future.

loans.use: to maintain his van

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: María Fidelina, es miembro del Grupo Solidario El Triunfo, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, y reside en el Municipio de Mangulile. Desde muy joven María se dedica a la venta de Golosinas, ella es una persona muy luchadora y conocida en la comunidad. Su familia es de muy escasos recursos económicos y por tanto cada vez que se le presenta una oportunidad de negocio no la desaprovecha. Así que el préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar la matera prima para la elaboración de golosinas como tacos, baleadas, tajaditas, pastelitos, yuca con chicharrón,etc., y como su casa queda junto al Centro de Salud de la comunidad quiere aprovechar la afluencia de personas y desea instalar una pequeña pulpería, asi que tambien quiere comprar productos de la canasta basica asi como refrescos, churros, galletas, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo María podrá continuar con su negocio y podrá tener uno nuevo y eso le alegra mucho porque sus condiciones de vida serán mejores. Su meta es hacer crecer sus negocios y sacar adelante a sus hijos. María tiene tres ciclos de ser clienta en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
María Fidelina is a member of the “El Triunfo” (Triumph) communal bank.  She’s 49 years old, married and has three children.  She lives in the town of Mangulile.  She’s sold snacks since she was very young.  She is a very tenacious, well-known person in her community.  Her family is of very limited economic resources so every time an opportunity for business comes up she takes advantage of it.  So, the loan she’s asking for now she needs to buy raw materials to make her snacks like tacos, baleadas (wheat flour tortilla, often quite thick, folded in half and filled with mashed fried beans), tajaditas (fried plantain), little cakes, manioc with fried pork, etc.  and, because her house is located next to the health center she wants to take advantage of the crowds there and set up a small grocery store so she also wants to buy basic groceries like soft drinks, snacks, cookies, etc.

With support from this loan María will be able to continue with her business and be able to have a new one too and this makes her very happy because her living conditions will improve.  Her goal is to make her businesses grow and to move her children forward.  María has been a FEMA client for three cycles and she’s made all her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
José es un hombra de 43 años y está casado, vive con su esposa Ana de 34 años y sus dos hijos, de 13 y 15 años. Vive en la Cabecera Cantonal de Santo Domingo y es propietario de un taxi, su esposa en cambio es ama de casa dedicada de lleno a sus hijos.

Hace 5 años decidió iniciarse como taxista. Con mucho esfuerzo pagó la cuota por agremiarse a una cooperativa de taxis ya que en Ecuador esto es costoso. Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana, más o menos desde las 7am hasta las seis de la tarde. Su cooperativa se encuentra en un lugar muy céntrico de la ciudad cerca del registro civil por lo que clientes no faltan. Pero el auto de José se ha ido desgastando y es hora de cambiar sus llantas y su tapiz interior, de esta manera él podrá seguir trabajando y dar a sus clientes un buen servicio.

El sueña con tener su pequeña empresa de transporte, él quiere seguir trabajando en este sector y aunque cree que ser taxista implica riesgos, le gusta mucho su trabajo y sobre todo se esmera por cada día dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is a 43-year-old married man living with his wife, Ana, 34, and their two children who are 13 and 15 years old.  He lives in the Santo Domingo municipal seat and he owns a taxi.  His wife is a housewife dedicated full time to caring for the children.

He started working as a taxi driver five years ago.  With much effort he was able to pay the membership fee to join a taxi cooperative which is expensive in Ecuador.  He works from very early in the morning, from about 7am until 6pm.  His cooperative is very centrally located near the public recorder’s office so customers are plentiful.  But, José car is showing signs of wear and it’s time to replace the tires and reupholster the interior so that he can stay in business and provide good customer service.

He dreams with having a small transportation firm.  He wants to continue to work in this sector and believes that although being a taxi driver implies risk he enjoys his work very much and above all strives every day to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tires and to reupholster his taxi.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is 31 years old and married to a housewife. They have two children, age 5 and 6. They live in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is the sole bread winner for his family, and his dream is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity for the family. 

He runs a business of produce and has been in it for 11 years. From this business he was able to build his family house. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations, however, and his dream is to have a bigger store. 

Amir wants a loan to buy rice, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 38 años convive con la madre de sus dos hijos, vive en casa de su madre junto a sus dos hermanos.El trabajo de Luis es el de transportista en la ciudad de Pucallpa, sale muy temprano a buscar los eventuales pasajeros en una unidad móvil conocido como motocarro (un vehiculo de tres ruedas muy usado en la ciudad), este trabajo lo hace en las diferentes calles de la ciudad, lleva en este trabajo ya casi 8 años, y cuenta con la ayuda de su conviviente quien le espera todos los días con algunos preparados para mantener en forma sus maltratados riñones por las duras calles de la ciudad.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que  se siente independiente y puede ir a recoger a sus hijos de sus centros de estudios, siempre tiene pasajeros ya que este vehiculo es muy utilizado en la ciudad y espera poder crecer junto a su familia en cuanto a infraestructura así como en la educación de sus menores hijos.Este es el préstamo numero 7 entre ]Luis Alberto y la institución MFP, esta contento ya que esta integrando un grupo muy responsable, espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución de forma responsable como lo hizo hasta ahora y esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad y la confianza que le brinda la institución.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles el comprará piezas para el arreglo de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 38 years old, lives with the mother of his two children; they live in his mother's house, along with his two brothers. Luis' work is providing transportation in the city of Pucullpa. He goes out in his vehicle very early to look for possible passengers. His vehicle is known as a "motocarro" or motorcycle taxi. It is a vehicle with three wheels and is very commonly used in the city. He works on the various streets of the city. He has been doing this work for almost 8 years, and he has the help of his wife, who waits for him every day with something ready to help keep his kidneys in shape, since they are treated roughly by the hard streets of the city. 

What he likes about his work is that he feels independent and can go to pick up his children at their schools. He always has passengers, since his vehicle is very well used in the city, and he hopes to be able to grow, along with his family, in terms of infrastructure as well as in the education of his young sons. 

This is loan number 7 between Luis Alberto and the MFP institution. He is happy since he has joined a very responsible group. He hopes to be able to continue working with the institution in a responsible way, as he has done up to now, and he is very grateful for the opportunity and the confidence that the institution has shown in him. With the sum he has applied for, 1500 PEN, he will buy parts to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy parts to fix his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married and has five children.

Maytham has been an owner of a food market since 2003, selling sweets, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has more than eight years experience in this field, He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan to make an outdoor ceiling and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for himself and for his wife.

loans.use: To make an outdoor ceiling and to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Lea has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Maritza De La Paz

texts.es:
Maritza, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, ella es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana vendiendo en las escuelas de distintos pueblos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de artesanías como collares, aretes, pulseras, poster animados, calcomanías, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar y surtir el negocio.
Su objetivo es que a través de la inversión, pueda desarrollar su negocio y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza sells handicrafts. She is a single mother of a three-year-old son. Maritza works every day of the week, selling at schools in different towns.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts such as necklaces, earrings, bracelets, cartoon posters, and decals. This investment will help her to improve and restock her business. Her goal with this investment is to develop her business and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as necklaces, earrings, bracelets, cartoon posters, and decals.

loans.name: Norma Rocio

texts.es:
Norma de 29 años de edad,es soltera, reside juntocon sus padres en cu casa, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito Yonan que pertenece al deparatamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad minera, agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 5 años Norma a colocado en su casa su negocio donde vende todo tipo de productos de ferretaria, en este rubro no hay competencia y tiene buena acogida con sus clientes por los productos innovadores que ofrece en su ferretería, con los ingresos que persiva podrásolventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad, ya que sus ventas se han ido incrementando y necesita satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, con las ganacias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y puede seguir ayudando a salir adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in their home, which has running water and electricity. It is located in the urban area of the Yonan district, which belongs to Cajamarca department.  This area is characterized by mining, agriculture and livestock.

For the last five years, Norma as had a business in her home where she sells all kinds of hardware.  There isn't any competition in this sector, and she is recognized by her customers for the innovative products that she offers for sale in her hardware store.  With the income she earns, she is able to cover her personal expenses and necessities.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise, as her sales have been growing and she needs to meet her customers' orders.  With the earnings she will get, she will be able to pay back her loan and be able to continue helping her family to move ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise for her hardware store.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos,  dos de ellos  independientes.  Estudió la secundaria pero no puedo culminarla.
La señora se dedica a la venta  de artículos artesanales, bordados en bayeta (tela) y compra y venta de ovinos y porcinos, trabaja más de once años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero comprará diez metros de bayetas, lanas de diferentes colores para realizar matices, cultura y paisajes.
Ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Arequipa.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artesanías.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima", located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito and department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married and has 6 children, 2 of them independent. She studied at high school but was not able to finish. 

The lady sells handicrafts, embroidered material, and buys and sells sheep and pigs. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than 11 years. Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN). 

With this new loan of S/. 500.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 10 metres of cloth, wool of different colours to use for shade, culture and landscapes.

She has the help of her children with the business. Her husband works in the city of Arequipa.

Her dream is to have a handicraft shop. What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and sharing with the members.

loans.use: to buy 10 metres of cloth and different colours of wool.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 29 years old, married and blessed with a four-year-old child.  He sells mobile phone accessories to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. This is because he has been trained on business management skills.John has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Davaachuluun

texts.en: Davaachuluun is 52 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with her business, and his son is a college student. He started his meat retailing business in 1995. His business is pretty much the same since then, therefore this year he decided to travel across countryside by himself and buy the livestock himself. He has already done some research and found a number of suppliers. However, due to his financial problems, it is impossible to buy livestock. He is a sharp and hard-working man who says, "It's been tight since my son joined college, so I had to do something to make this right." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with five children. 

Antonio has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel.  He has had this business for six years.  He has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Antonio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Antonio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Terimbere Muhinzi Nº30 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Aloys  fait partie du groupe Terimberemuhinzi No 30. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Aloys est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Aloys voudrait agrandir la surface de culture en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aloys belongs to the Terimberemuhinzi no.30 group. He is 33 years old and married with four children ranging from two to nine years old; both his children are at school. He has six years of primary education.

Aloys is a rice farmer. This is his second loan with ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

He plans to grow his business by selective rice sowing. In the coming years he would like to expand his farming land by buying other fields. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en: Joaquin is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and children. He started working as a farmer 15 years ago and is specialized in cultivating rice. Some of his children are still attending school, and this is the reason he was obliged to do this job in order to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm. In the future, he plans to diversify his business operation and start cultivating different types of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es: Wilbert de 34 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Ruth de 28 años y fruto de ello tienen 02 hijos, Anali de 10 y Edison de 04 años; a quienes desea ofrecerle una buena educación. Wilbert, es un hombre profesional, con mucho sacrificio logró terminar su carrera es técnico en Computación y reparación de computadoras, agradece al apoyo brindado de sus padres quienes se esforzaron por mantener los gastos de estudio. Hace 06 años que egreso de su casa de estudios y hoy pone todo sus conocimientos adquiridos en su puesto de servicios donde brinda mantenimiento de computadoras, configuración y cableado de redes. Su ingreso le es muy favorable porque gracias a ello esta creciendo y de a pocos va implementando su tienda. Wilbert necesita el apoyo crediticio para seguir surgiendo y prosperar con su negocio con el apoyo del crédito comprará monitores, estabilizadores, cables de red. Para el bien de sus ingresos posteriormente piensa en comprar un auto para también poder trabajar ya que necesita una economía para solventar en los gastos de su familia. Este es crédito numero 05 con MFP, por ende necesita el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socio muy participe y muy colaborativo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar un auto para que pueda trabajar dando el servicio de transporte y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilbert, 34, is an entrepreneur who lives in his own home with his common-law wife, Ruth, 28, and their two children, Anali,10, and Edison, 4, who they want to receive a good education.  Wilbert is a professional who with much sacrifice was able to get a degree in computer science and technical repair.  He is grateful for his parent's support since they made every effort to cover the cost of his education.

Six years ago he finished his studies and now he has a business offering computer maintenance, configuration and network cabling services.  His income is good and has allowed him to grow and set up his shop little by little.  Wilbert is in need of a loan to keep growing and prosper, and to be able to buy monitors, stabilizers, and network cables.  He plans to use part of his earnings later to buy a car to start a transport business which will help resolve family expenses.  This is his fifth loan through MFP and he depends on the lenders to help him grow.  In his communal bank he is an active member and very collaborative.  He plans to use the 3,000 PEN loan to buy a car and run a taxi service to earn more income.

loans.use: To help pay for a car.

loans.name: Mariuxi Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mariuxi es socia del banco comunal Los Laureles, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar que de clima frió, en su entorno se encuentran  grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas y viejas haciendas, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de ganado y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita Mariuxi tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive independiente en una casita arrendada.

Ella es empleada privada desde a hace 6 meses, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga, con su crédito lo va a comprar víveres para su hogar y pagar loa servicios básicos de su casa.
 
Su meta es volver a estudiar y culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Miss Mariuxi is a member of “Los Laureles” (The Laurels) Communal Bank. She lives in the environs of  Cumbe parish, Cuenca. There we find a cold climate and the large pastures of cattle ranches and old haciendas. The people are dedicated to  commerce, cattle raising, and agriculture. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Mariuxi is 22 years old, single, and lives independently in a rented house. She has been a private employee for the last 6 months, working Sunday to Sunday from 9:00 am until 9:00 at night.

This is Mariuxi's first loan through her communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. With this loan she will buy groceries and pay for basic services for her home. Her goal is to resume studying and complete her university degree.

loans.use: buy groceries and pay for house's basic services, while she resumes studying.

loans.name: Elisa Yajaira

texts.es: elisa de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde hace 13 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de ropa, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros todo por mayor y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros todo por mayor

loans.name: Jovcho

texts.en: Jovcho B. is 57 years old. He has own business for more than 20 years. He had tried various kinds of business but for 7 years he has a small workshop in which he manufactures plastic details for different purposes. Besides this workshop Jovcho is a private agriculture producer. He plants over 1 000 decares land on which he grows wheat, sunflower and corn. Being in business for so long time Jovcho has great experience and lots of clients. Jovcho B. applies for a $ 2000 loan, which he will use to buy a new special vacuum press for plastic treatment.

loans.use: To buy a new special vacuum press

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard day after day to support her family. she is 31 years old, is separated from her husband and she has custody of her two small children, who are currently attending preschool. Her business selling barbeque has allowed her to provide support for her family, as her husband does not provide them with any kind of support. The income Veronica earns through her business is practically the only source of income that her family can rely on.

And she wants to pull her two kids through, which is why she requests a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase ingredients for the production of her product. You can help Veronica continue on with her business. She depends on your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica se esfuerza día a día por sacar a adelante a su familia, ella tiene 31 años, está separada de su esposo y tiene a su cargo a dos pequeños niños, de los cuales uno ya asiste a preescolar. La venta de barbacoa le ha permitido obtener el sustento para su familia, ya que su esposo casi no les proporciona dinero. El ingreso que Verónica recibe de su negocio es prácticamente de lo único que depende esta familia.

Y ella quiere salir adelante con sus dos hijos, por lo que pide un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 dólares para la compra de la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración y venta de su producto. Tú puedes ayudar a que Vero pueda continuar con su negocio, ella confía en tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is an optimistic married mother of three with a strong desire to move up in the world. As her children grew, so did the costs of their education, and the salary her husband made was insufficient to cover it all. To earn extra income, Dolores started to make and sell pieces of jewelry from gold, silver and quartz. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown.

Thanks to her work, Dolores has been successful in seeing her children continue their education. To be able to increase her production, Dolores is requesting a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase material needed to make her jewelry. She plans to repay the loan within three to six months. With your help, you can improve the life of Dolores and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dolores es una mujer optimista y con grandes deseos de superación, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Cuando sus hijos empezaron a crecer, también los costos de sus estudios se incrementaron y el salario de su esposo resultó insuficiente, para poder obtener un ingreso extra Dolores empezó a fabricar y vender piezas de joyería en oro, plata y cuarzos, gracias a la calidad de sus productos tuvieron mucha aceptación entre sus clientes y la demanda por ellos se ha incrementado.

Gracias a esta labor, Dolores ha logrado que sus hijos continúen estudiando. Para poder incrementar su producción, ella solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra del material que requiere para la elaboración de la joyería, ella devolverá esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda mejorarás la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchase material needed to make jewelry

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Misael Onan

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Misael Onan. I grow ornamental flowers. I have had a small nursery for several years. I sell the flowers in the wholesale market and in several schools in my city. I have a very good clientèle. Thanks to my business, I am able to help my mother, who is a senior. My business is growing every day and due to the demand, I need an increase of capital that will allow me to offer a better variety of plants to my customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Misael Onan , mi actividad principal es el cultivo de flores ornamentales, cuenta con un pequeño vivero desde hace varios años, las que vendo en el mayoreo y en las diferentes escuelas de mi ciudad, tengo muy buena clientela, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi madre con los gastos siendo ella de la tercera edad, actualmente mi negocio va creciendo cada día en vista que la demanda a crecido por lo que requiere de mayor capital para poder ofrecer a mis clientes mas variedad de plantas.

loans.use:
Compra de Cubetas, jaulas y plantas
To buy buckets, crates, and flowers

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar is a 35 year old resident of the town of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is married and has three children. He breeds cattle, which is a traditional and common occupation in the Azerbaijani countryside. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them to local butchers while they are still alive. He currently has two cows.  He does not have any other employment, so his cattle rearing business is the only source of income for his family. He wants to develop this business by purchasing more cows and increasing his income. For this purpose, he is applying to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a $500 loan.

loans.use: to buy two more calves

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is a man who has struggled to get ahead. For several years he worked in the U.S., where he has residency. Unfortunately, the small business that he had built with his brother did not succeed and had to be sold to the competition. He returned to Mexico where, in order to generate income, he started to build furniture such as entertainment centers, dining room furniture and other small pieces that nearby residents order from him.

Gerardo is asking for a loan of $475USD, to be repaid over a period of six months. He would like to be able to purchase wood/other furniture that he can offer for sale during the fast-approaching holiday season – a time when there is higher demand for his products to give as gifts. With your help, Gerardo and his family can overcome the previous difficulties that forced them to return to their country and to succeed there.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gerardo, es un hombre que a luchado por salir adelante, hace varios años, trabajó en EUA, puesto que tiene residencia, sin embargo la pequeña empresa que había fabricado junto con su hermano quebró y se la tuvieron que vender a la competencia, así fue como regresó a México, en donde para salir adelante, comenzó por vender muebles, sobre pedido y a fabricarlos, tales como comedores, centros de entretenimiento, en sí muebles pequeños que las personas a su alrededor le solicitan.

Debido a que la temporada Navideña está por comenzar, Gerardo, está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Gerardo podrá comprar madera y muebles para venderlos, puesto que en esta temporada es cuándo más compran muebles como regalos de navidad. Con tu ayuda Gerardo y su familia podrá superar el fracaso que los hizo regresar a su país y salir adelante en México.

loans.use: Purchase wood/furniture for carpentry business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Roes E. is 46yrs old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, E. State, Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes and has been in business since 2004. She requests a loan of $200 to buy more fairly used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
From the age of 12, in a small stand at the Israel Lewites Market in Managua, Martha P. has been selling all kinds of plastic products such as chairs, plates, glasses, clothing storage, lamps, etc.

Martha is a single mother who is highly motivated to provide a better life for her son. Today, thanks to the support of Ceprodel, she has obtained 8 loans which she has used to purchase new plastic products to sell. She makes a great effort to increase her income to provide an education for her son, as she is the only income provider in her home.

Desde hace 12 años, en un humilde tramo del Mercado Israel Lewites en Managua, la señora Martha P. se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de producto de plástico tales como sillas, bancas, platos, vasos, contenedores de ropa, lámparas, etc.

Martha es madre soltera, sin embargo posee un gran espíritu de superación para seguir manteniendo a su hijo que se encuentran en la etapa escolar. Hoy en día gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel, ha logrado obtener 8 créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de nuevos productos plásticos y por tal motivo con mucho esfuerzo busca la manera de aumentar sus utilidades para brindarle la educación a su pequeño ya que ella es el único ingreso económico en su hogar.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PLASTIC PRODUCTS TO SELL,  AND INCREASE HER INCOME  IN ORDER TO PAY FOR HER SON'S EDUCATION

loans.name: Almedina

texts.en: Almedina was born in 1989, and she is from Visoko. She is not married, and she lives with her family. She has two brothers and one sister. This is her first loan. She intends to use this loan, in the amount of 1,200 KM, for purchasing the clothes that she will sell at the market. She wants to expand her business and ensure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Buying more clothes to sell

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 63 year old woman who lives with her husband in the town Derventa. Her husband is a pensioner and his monthly income is 450 KM. Milka is a pensioner too and she receives 400 KM monthly. This is her first loan  in the amount of  1,200 KM ($950). Milka  wants to use this loan  for purchasing seeds, compost and other materials for soil cultivation. She hopes that she will ensure an easier life for herself and her husband, because she will produce vegetables and she will not need to buy it.

loans.use: For purchasing seeds, compost and other materials.

loans.name: Sili 1 Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
For these 2 women of Sili 1 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They both undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faitala T., 27, is married with 3 children. She has over 10 years of involvement in the taro, banana and yam business. She sells her produce at the Salelologa market once a week. With her loan, she wishes to purchase weed killer, pesticides, wire, 2 knives, and fertilizer.

Faigalotu T., 28, is married with 4 children. For more than 5 years, she has been selling taro, bananas, and chips to people shopping at the market. Her family is very well respected for the quality of its produce. With her loan, she intends to purchase a machete, a cap, a frying pan, an oven, plastic bags, a scraper, a scoop, and an iron.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, a machete, an oven, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet I. is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Juliet is an innovative person. Her innovativeness is seen in the way she distinguished her business premises with the combination of provisions and baby wares. She uniquely arranged her products in a colorful way. Juliet has been in this business for 4 years. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and baby wares. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and baby wares

loans.name: Sreyoun Sam Group

texts.en:
A group that consists of four members is in Ka Art Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sreyoun S. is the group leader and she owns a small grocery store in the village.

In her business, Mrs. Sreyoun S. has faced a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase more grocery products. Thus, Mrs. Sreyoun S. asked for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Sreyoun S. is 24 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chanphakdey Pin, always assists his wife’s business. Previously, Mrs. Sreyoun S. obtained a loan to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz Z. is a 58-year-old man who sells vegetables in the small local bazaar of Sabirabad village. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field. This is the only source of income for his family. It is just enough to cover basic family needs but not enough to expand his business. To improve his business and purchase more vegetables, he has applied for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
S. Célestine is married and has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for a year and a half. She sells vegetables at the Tilène market in Ziguinchor. Her business consists of buying and reselling cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, okra, chilis, etc. She contributes to her family’s daily expenses and medical care. She will repay the loan she seeks after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

S. Célestine est une femme mariée et membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 1an et demi. Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché Tilène de Ziguinchor. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des choux, des pommes de terre, des tomates, des gombo, du piment etc … Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et aux soins médicaux de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: vegetable business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida was born in 1970 and she lives with her husband and three children in the town of Doboj. Her husband works in construction in Croatia and earns about 1 000 KM monthly. This is Aida's first loan through WWI and she will use it to buy material for making cookies to sell. Her wish is to start to do something for her household, because she has a lot of free time and she likes to make cookies.

loans.use: To buy material for making cookies to sell

loans.name: Iziegbe

texts.en: Iziegbe I. is 33 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells foodstuffs and provisions like tin tomatoes, indomie, palm and vegetable oil. She is requesting a loan of $525 to increase the inventory of her foodstuffs and provisions for sale. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions for sale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. ChE. E. was born in 1950 and she now lives in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  She is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land for cultivating rice to earn a living.  In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have any animals to plow the rice field.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the field.  With the rest of the loan, she will purchase rice seeds and fertilizers in order to cultivate rice. 

Mrs. ChE. E. is a 58-year-old widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field, and purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es:
La señora Ilmer pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Divinas”, ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo Nº 252-A, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y 2 que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como Profesor Administrativo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. golosinas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta ropa. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte su mercadería D. ropa a sus clientes. 
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 3 docenas D. blusas, 4 docenas D. faldas, 2 docenas D. ropa interior, etc.

Ilmer manifiesta que el banco comunal ha formado mujeres trabajadoras y responsables para el trabajo, es por eso que desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Ilmer belongs to the community bank "Las Divinas," located at el Jr. Trujillo Nº 252-A, in the district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 47 years of age and a mother of four children, two of which are older and two who still depend on her. She is married and her husband works as an Administrative Professor. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the sales of sweets. She has three years experience working with the community bank. Presently she works with clothing sales. In the mornings she works from her home and in the afternoon she delivers her clothing merchandise to her clients. With this loan for 1500 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy three dozen blouses, four dozen skirts, two dozen underwear garments, etc. Ilmer demonstrates that the community bank is maD. up of hardworking and responsible women, and it is for this reason that she wants to continue making it a part of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 3 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, and 2 dozen underwear garments.

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hồ Thị Liên  45 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Liên là từ kinh doanh đồ điện. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm cán bộ thuỷ nông của chồng nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn  định với thu nhập  5.000.000đ/ tháng
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh đồ điện của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Hồ Thị Liên is 45 years old. She, her husband and their 3 children live in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá province. Her family main income comes from electronic goods retail business. Her husband is a cadre in agriculture. Their family income is stable, 5.000.000 VND a month. For this round of loan, Mrs Liên is requesting 9.000.000 VND to invest in her electric goods retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her electronic goods retail business

loans.name: Anwar Sultana M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
My name is Anwar sultana. I am 55 years old and married. I live in a city of kind hearted people named Borewala, Pakistan. I have lived here for the past 20 years. My husband's name is M. A.. He is a fruit seller by profession, and has sold fruit for the past 10 years. I help my husband to pack fruit in cartons. I have one son who is a contractor by profession. He takes building construction jobs on contract.

I am applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruit to expand my husband’s fruit selling business.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Khurram hussain baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for selling

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "QORILAZO" se fundó el día 09 de febrero del 2009; este banco alberga a 12 socios, 07 mujeres y 05 varones; con domicilio en el distrito de santiago, en la comnidad de cachona de la provincia del Cusco.

Los miembros de este banco se dedican a las actividades de comercio, en la modalidad de venta de productos agricolas de la época, vendiendo maíz, otros de ellos  estan dedicados a la panadería y a la venta de abarrotes.

Estos socios agradecen el apoyo brindado en estas zonas rurales, ya que no existe intituciones microfinancieras.
texts.en:
The community bank QORILAZO was founded on February 9, 2009. This bank is home to twelve members, seven women and five men, who live in Santiago district, in the region of Cachona , Cusco province. The members of this bank work in commercial activities, such as selling seasonal agricultural products, corn, and groceries. Others work running a bakery. These partners appreciate the support offered in these rural areas, as there are no micro finance institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grains and seeds

loans.name: Temporal Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Temporal" esta conformado por 12 integrantes y representado por la señora Maria Antonieta. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica ha actividades como el transporte público D. pasajeros, empleados y ala venta D. comida, repostería y refrescos. Los negocios siempre prosperan si se tienen entusiasmo y ganas D. trabajar es por eso que los integrantes del grupo no temen a la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar y mejorar sus negocios para ofrecer a  los clientes una mejor calidad D. servicio y D. productos para mejorar los ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Las socias no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios  pero saben como manejar fondos y crecer con ellos y también son gente responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
The group " Temporal" is maD. up of 12 partners and is represented by Maria Antonieta. The majority of the group is dedicated to such activities as public transportation and food, pastry and beverage sales. The businesses always prosper if they have enthusiasm and a willingness to work. For this reason, the group partners do not fear the competition. The purpose of this loan is to purchase supplies and materials to increase and improve their businesses and offer clients a better quality of service and products, which will improve profits and the quality of life for their families. The members do not have experience with support groups, but they know how to manage money and grow their businesses with it. They also are responsible and honest people.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Iddrisu

texts.en: Iddrisu A. sells poultry at a farmer in Adisadel, near Cape Coast.  He has no formal education.  He is married and has four dependants.  His wife is a trader.  Iddrisu has been selling poultry since 1987.  His loan will be used to buy feed and drugs for his poultry, since that is his major challenge.  Iddrisu is responsible for providing food, clothing and other basic needs for his family.  He hopes to reinvest new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy feed and drugs for his poultry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 48 years old and married with four children. Three of her children go to school. Mercy lives with her husband who is now a teacher. She is an achiever and committed to her work. She sells detergents such as toilet soap, and washing soap etc. Mercy travels to Accra to purchase her stock of goods in bulk in order to sell them at retail price. She goes door to door selling her products. She has been in this business for twenty years. She therefore request for a loan support to buy bulk supply of soaps to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Merciful God’.

loans.use: Mercy wants the loan to buy assorted cartons of soap for supply.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa area with his wife and their two children. Elias has been selling aluminum for 16 years. He has requested a loan of $2,000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for sale. This is the first time that Elias has requested a loan.

Elias sees himself as speciA. in his business because if his many years of experience. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Elias had significant financiA. difficulties when he first began his business, and he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Genadiy

texts.en:
Genadiy is married with two children. He sells various small items at the market. He has been in this business for 10 years. His profit is about 4,000 UAH per month. His kiosk is like a small store with one small entrance. Unfortunately, you can't see all the inventory when you pass by the kiosk.

Genadiy would like to get a loan to purchase more inventory and locate it on the street outside his kiosk. This should attract people to the kiosk where all the inventory is available. Genadiy hopes that in this way he can expand his clientele.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: "I started my piggery with only one sow. For a long time, I have been able to manage my business well... of course with the help of my husband and CEVI. The income I get from my pigs is what I use to pay all the expenses in our home," says Jocelyn L., 48-year old mother of eight children. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. The loan will truly help her grow and sustain her business. CEVI is reaching out to a lot of pig raisers. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Sheyi

texts.en: Sheyi sells curtain rails and carpet. She is 32 years old and she has three children. She is a LAPO client and hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more curtain rails and carpet to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more curtain rails and carpet to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda.

loans.name: Marla

texts.en:
Marla P. P. is 56 years old and is a single mother of four children. She sells beauty products, soft drinks and candies out of her home. Marla lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Puccallpa.

Marla invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in a small grocery shop. She is currently requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles which she will invest in purchasing more products for her current business.

Marla is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for the financial support and for the trust that the organization places in her. She also appreciates the educational sessions given by Manuela Ramos during each monthly meeting of her communal bank, "Las Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes). Marla is committed to progressing with her business and to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanabo,Iringa,she is 47 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 21,18,16,14 years.

Eva started her own food business selling vegetable 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Eva first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vegetable.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Eva hopes to get more food for family,save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable

loans.name: Kuruthum

texts.en:
Kuruthum is a member of the Pangani borrower group in ilala,Iringa,she is 34 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,her children are aged 15,07,04 years.

Kuruthum started her own shop business selling commodities like soap,cooking oil,sugar 16 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Kuruthum first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Kuruthum hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the size of her business.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon D., 28, is a low-income person living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Here she has her own small business: she sells sugarcane juice to students at the local public high school.

Chuon D. was married years go and has two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver.

Chuon D. would like to operate her business at the school but she is required to pay the cost of renting her place. Therefore she would like a loan to help pay those fees so she can continue operating her business there which is an attractive place for generating extra income. She proposes to use the rest of the loan to buy a machine for taping sugar cane.

loans.use: To pay the cost of renting her place and to buy a machine

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 39 years old and married with four children. She sells medicines and has been in this business for the past three years. She uses part of her profit for the family upkeep.

Adenike hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en:
Mr. Khuon H. is 78 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where he has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. He is married to Mrs. Nhem Ra, age 56, who works with him in the farming business. This couple has four married and two school-aged children. 

Due to the coming dry season, which is when conditions are good for planting rice, Khuon H. has requested a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on his own farmland. 

Note: Mr. Khuon H.'s wife is pictured in their farm field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on his own farmland

loans.name: Cipriano Justino

texts.es:
En el departamento de León el señor Cipriano C. se destaca por tener su negocio de venta de llantas, filtros y aceite para vehículos en su propio establecimiento donde a diario vende estos productos a sus clientes que le visitan. Al negocio le ha puesto por nombre Vulcanización Venceremos y también presta los servicios de cambio de aceite y lavado para el vehículo.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas, aceite y filtro para el vehículo con la finalidad de ofrecerlos en su local y así generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo para salir adelante y desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Cipriano C. sells automobile tires, filters and lubricants from his own business, located in the department of León, to his customers who daily visit him to make their purchases. His business is called Vulcanización Venceremos and he also provides vehicle services like oil change and car wash. He is requesting financing to buy automobile lubricants, tires and filters to offer for sale so that he can generate income to support his family which so depends on him to get ahead and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automobile lubricants, tires and filters.

loans.name: Gaberi

texts.en: Gaberi is a member of LAPO microfinance and he is excited to take out a Kiva loan. He will use this loan to invest in a business selling tyres which he will buy in bulk to get a better price. He is 27 years old, married with a child. He sells tyres to meet the need of his family.  He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes and they both contribute to supporting the family. The challenge he faces in his tyre business is capital.  He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more tyres to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more tyres to sell

loans.name: Nelieza

texts.en:
Nelieza R. is from the village of Kiwalan in Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Nelieza is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelieza owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nelieza has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelieza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelieza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Nelieza's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Altantsooj

texts.en: Altantsooj is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a Mongolian traditional tent called "ger". His son, who is 7 years old, attends a local secondary school while his daughter, who is 1 years old, has not reached school age yet. His wife is a janitor at a state-owned organization and Altantsooj operates a taxi service in his town. He transports people from Zavkhan province to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Altantsooj started his taxi service business in 2008 and besides his transportation business, he manages a raw material trading business in order to supplement to his earnings. He says, "I am working hard in order to save some money to buy my own house." Altantsooj is requesting a 350,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and some raw materials, such as sheep and goat skin, for his other business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts for his car and some raw materials, such as sheep and goat skin.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe C. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tienen casi todos los servicios básicos en su casa, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 30, 19, 16, 18, 13 años de edad.

Lupe antes tenía un comedor en el mercado del sur de Guayaquil, al cambiarse de casa tubo que terminar con el negocio, al ver que necesitaba un ingreso para su familia decidió comprar un tacho de pescados y comenzó a vender en la esquina de su casa.  

Ahora Lupe trabaja desde las 05h00 todos los días vendiendo la libra de pescados a $ 1.8, la libra de camarones a $ 2.00 y otras tipos de mariscos, tiene un promedio de 30 clientes diarios. Uno de las incomodidades que tiene es que hay muchas personas borrachas por donde vende los mariscos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una carpa, camarones, pescados para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para poder construir su propia casa y poner hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Lupe C. is 43 years old and lives in a periurban district located along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. Her home receives almost all of the basic services. She is a single mother of five children (ages 30, 19, 18, 16, and 13).

Lupe previously owned a diner at the market south of Guayaquil. When she moved into a different house, she had to quit her business. In order to generate an income for her family, she decided to buy enough fish to fill a trash container and began selling them on the street corner outside of her home.

Lupe begins work every day at 5am. She sells fish for $1.80/lb, shrimp for $2.00/lb, and other types of seafood. Lupe serves an average of 30 customers each day. One of the problems she encounters is the number of intoxicated people who loiter near where she sells seafood.

With this loan, Lupe will buy carp, shrimp, and other types of fish in order to expand her business. In the future, she wants to buy land where she can build a house and establish a business there.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seafood to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una joven muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene 28 años, por el momento vive en la casa de su hermana. 
Desde hace 7 años trabaja como docente en una escuela de su localidad, pero el año pasado la animaron a incursionar en el alquiler de disfraces, teniendo a una socia para este negocio, el cual le resulta muy rentable, sobre todo en la etapa escolar (de abril a diciembre).
A su vez, tiene como ventaja el ser profesora, pues está al tanto de los eventos que se realizan en los colegios donde los alumnos deben ir disfrazados.
Para el futuro, quiere ser independiente para obtener las ganancias completas, pero sabe que para ello debe hacerse muy conocida en su localidad.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete pagar todas cuotas puntualmente, pues quiere seguir trabajando y sus anhelos es de crecer con la ayuda de estos préstamos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más disfraces, especialmente para niños.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working woman. She is single and 28 years old. For right now, she is living in her sister’s house. For the last 7 years she has worked as a teacher in a local school, however, this last year she decided to become involved with a costume renting business. Having a partner for this business made it very profitable, especially during the school year (April to December). Being a teacher puts her at an advantage since it is at the events put on by schools where the children dress in costumes. In the future, she would like to be independent in order to obtain all the profits, but she knows that for this she needs to become well known in her area. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to pay all the installments promptly. She would like to continue to work and her dream is to grow with the help of these loans. With the money she is currently soliciting she will buy more costumes, especially children’s costumes.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's costumes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria A. M. tiene 25 años, es casada, y vive con su marido y 3 hijos que se llaman Alex de 8 años, Mercy de 4 años, y Josely de 1.5 años.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura sembrando mora desde hace 10 años.  Vende la mora semanalmente en la comunidad. Su otra actividad economica es la crianza de animales, actualmente tiene gallinas y vacas.  También tiene cultivos de habas, papas, y maiz para consumir y para alimentación para los animales.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, liquidos, y fertilizantes para mantener el cultivo.

Su sueño es tener una buena casa con terreno para cultivar.  Quiere también que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria A. M. is 25 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children: Alex (age 8), Mercy (age 4) and Josely (age 1½).

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan”, which means “New Road” in Quechua. The group consists of 18 women who work in agriculture. They live in the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. All of them have a great desire to work with credit so that they can get ahead in life.

Maria has been growing blackberries for ten years. She sells the fruit on a weekly basis in her community. Maria also raises animals to earn income, which currently consists of chickens and cows. In addition, she grows lima beans, potatoes, and corn for personal consumption and to use as feed for her animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy compost and liquid fertilizers to maintain her crops. Her dream is to own a nice house with land for farming. She also wants her children to pursue an education so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase composts & fertilizers

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
El señor Orlando Jose M. Z. tiene la edad de 70 años vive en el Barrio La Borgoña, es casado y su esposa es agricultora ella le apoya en los gastos y trabajos de la casa, ellos son una familia con 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.

Ellos se han dedicado desde hace 6 años a la siembra de la piña, uno de los principales problemas que tienen es la escases del vital liquido, que les abastece cada 8 días, el padre del Sr. M., le heredo esas tierras que hoy en día son el sustento económico de la familia, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos, que garanticen una mejor producción a corto plazo, esto les brindara mejores condiciones económicas para el desarrollo a nuevos fuentes de negocio e inversión.
texts.en:
Orlando Jose M. Z. is 70 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. He is married and his wife is a farmer. She supports the family with the expenses and housework. They are a family of four grown children who are independent.

They have worked planting pineapples for the last six years. One of the principal problems that they face is the scarcity of vital liquid, which they have to re-stock every 8 days. Mr. M.'s father inherited these lands that today are the economic sustenance of the family.

They seek this loan to purchase fertilizers and plant materials, which will guarantee a better production in the short term. This will bring better economic conditions for the development of new sources of business and investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and plant materials

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel A. B., tiene la edad de 43 años, es casado y su esposa vende frutas y verduras en el mercado central, ellos son una familia de 3 hijos, el mayor les apoya en los trabajos del campo al señor A., y los otros menores estudian la escuela primaria. Ellos son agricultores desde hace 28 años, dentro de los frutos que cosechan esta la piña, café y plátano. 

Se ha ocasionado una erosión del terreno  en su finca,  gracias al exceso de escorrentías, ellos comenzaron sus actividades laboriosas, gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria de los años 80's, es ahora que ellos solicitan, un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus terrenos, con el crédito compraría abono foliares y edáficos, esto con el objetivo de mejorar paulatinamente la erosión del terreno. Permitiéndole la diversificación a futuro de otras cosechas, que aportará mejores condiciones económicas que favorezcan a la familia entera.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel A. B., 43, is married and his wife is a fruit merchant in the central market. They have been farmers for the past 28 years; they grow pineapple, coffee and banana. They have three children; the oldest helps Mr. A. with the farming chores and the two youngest are in elementary school. Their farmlands have suffered erosion due to excess water run-off. They began their farm work thanks to the Agrarian Reform laws of the 1980s. They are asking for funding now to do some soil maintenance work. They will buy various kinds of fertilizers and manure to gradually improve the eroded fields so that they can diversify crops in the future in order to provide improved economic benefits for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
