loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Bayarlhagva

texts.en:
Bayarlhagva is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His two children, ages 12 and 10, attend a local secondary school. His wife, Otgontsetseg, is a salesperson and her monthly salary is 150,000 tugrugs (~ 110 USD). 

During the day, Bayarlhagva earns his living by operating a meat and raw material trading business in his town. He has been operating his businesses since 2000, and has steadily expanded both businesses. His meat trading business is seasonal and his profit is high during the summer. Bayarlhagva's monthly profit is between 80,000 – 150,000 tugrugs (~  60 – 110 USD).  He sells his products at his rental counter and has a loyal customer base. 

Originally he was a herder  between 1990 and 2000 before he has started the meat and raw material trading business. Bayarlhagva is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. He says, “I started saving money for my children's tuition fees to provide a good education for them.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a plot of land with a house and yard for his family.

loans.use: Tp purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Monzoto Plus Group

texts.en:
Monzoto Plus is a community bank made up of seventeen micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Jules N.. These members are united in the same goal: to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva via the MFI HOPE DRC.

Jules operates a drugstore in the northern suburban area of Kinshasa. He is 38 years old and is the father of three children who are between the ages of 7 and 14. All of them attend school.

Jules began his business in 1994. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, his business has prospered and has permanent customers to sustain it.

Jules’s wife has been helping him by promoting the business, which generates $40 of profit per week. She has been helping Jules make best choices about purchasing appropriate drugs in the area and works with him in developing the drugstore. They both like their business and they also like talking to their customers about their health.

Jules has already received and successfully repaid five loans. He is planning with the new loan to expand his business by buying more medicines needed by his customers. His ambition is to open another drugstore.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his drugstore

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.en:
Rosario R. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 37 years old. Rosario is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Rosario R. Group'.

Rosario is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosario from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Three people make up a group loan. They are located in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saroeurn E., 38 years-old, has been selected as the leader of the group by the members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Saroeurn E. is a farmer who owns 1.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice.  To support this farming, Mrs. Saroeurn E. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for a water machine. Her husband, Mr. Set Chhoeng, is a fisherman and a construction worker who earn insufficient income to support his family. This couple has four children. One child is a farmer while the other three are students in the local school. Mrs. Sarrat P., is acting as a guarantor for the group.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for a water machine.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana M., 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Asiscio M., a sales coordinator, they are blessed with three children. Viviana makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. To this end, she has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Viviana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, Viviana would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and by buying the groceries needed to increase and replenish her current product inventory. She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to increase and replenish her current product inventory.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a member and the secretary of Masaba Self Help Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is 25 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 and 12. All her children except one attend school.

Mildred has been farming for the last five years and employs one farmhand. Her products are maize, beans, green grams (mung beans) and vegetables which she sells locally. She is also employed as an Early Childhood Development teacher. Her biggest challenges have been fluctuation in the price of her products and unpredictable weather patterns which affect her production.

Mildred has requested this loan from Juhudi for 41,600 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With this loan, she will be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and earn income through the sale of milk which will assist in educating her children. In the future, she would like to supply poultry and dairy products to other farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap K. is a villager in Damnak village in Takeo province and she was born in 1964. She is a farmer who owns three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also Khmer cake maker at her home. In her field now has some problem because it is time to do farming, but she did not have enough money. So to improve production, Mrs. Pheap K. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers,  plow machine to plow her field, buy piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Van Uom, is a security guard who gets low salary to support his family. She is a mother of four children whom all are attending school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria R. R. tiene 20 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la província de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hija que se llama Silvia.

Luz es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Luz se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para avanzar en su agricultura. El apoyo de este préstamo ayudara la situación economica de gastos de insumos. Su sueno es tener un terreno. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

En su tiempo, trabaja y pasa tiempo con su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Maria R. R. is 20 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has a daughter named Silvia.

Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesús”. There are 15 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Luz is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in the canton of Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan so that she can make progress in her farming activities. The support provided through these funds will help improve her financial situation and pay for supplies and expenses. Her dream is to acquire her own land. One challenge that she faces in her work is fighting pests that can ruin her corn. One specific pest is known as “langosta”.

Luz spends her time working and being with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her farming activities

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Cuando Aurora de los Santos ayudaba a su amiga en  su negocio de comida no pensó que algún día ella tendría el suyo propio y así fue, su amiga viajo y se lo encargo  pero ya no volvió es así que ella se hizo cargo del negocio  son  12 personas que trabajan en una fabrica  a quienes les vende el  almuerzo también tiene su negocio de venta de desayuno   dentro de un mercado  le va muy bien por que los trabajadores del mercado son sus mayores clientes  gracias a su trabajo  ha podido comprarle a su hijo una computadora  y pagarle los estudios a su hijo en un instituto particular. 

En lo que se refiere a su negocio  para el futuro esta pensando  alquilar un puesto de venta mas grande y poner una jugueria  ahora empezará  otro negocio de venta de menudencias de pollo ya tiene una congeladora que compro con sus ahorros y con su préstamo  actual comprara las menudencias para empezar a vender, el grupo al cual pertenece se llama “ UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” son 10 socias y ella es la presidenta por primera vez espera desempeñar una buena función.

*Aurora de los Santos es la cuarta de la derecha
texts.en:
When Aurora de los Santos was helping a friend in her food business she never thought that one day she would have her own. But that´s how it was, her friend traveled and left her in charge, but she never returned and so Aurora took over. They sell lunch to 12 people who work in a factory and they also have a business in the market selling breakfast. It is going quite well because the workers at the market are their best customers. Thanks to this, she has been able to buy her son a computer and to pay for his studies at a private school. As for her business, in the future she is planning to rent out a bigger space and install a juice bar. For now she is starting another business selling chicken giblets and she already has a freezer that she bought with her savings. With this loan she will buy the giblets so she can start selling. The group that she belongs to is called "UNIDAS TRIUNFAERMOS", there are 10 members and for the first time she is the president and hopes to do a good job. * Aurora de los Santos is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a young woman from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She is married and the mother of one daughter, Maha. Fida's husband also takes care of his old parents.

Fida's husband is a barber. He owns a shop he inherited from his father and, five years ago, he decided to use it to start his own business. He now wants to apply a few changes to his barbershop to make it look better in order to attract more customers.

Fida is taking a $1,500 loan to help her husband fix up his barbershop. The photo shows him in the barbershop as he is the one working there. The business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: To enable her husband to fix up his barbershop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana D. is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Juana is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector  selling dried fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Juana is just starting this business.

In 2006, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juana is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Juana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana, D. 67 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su esposo Hipólito D. 69 años y D. sus 2 hijas mayores y nietos. Sin embargo a pesar D. su avanzada edad se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante. DesD. muy joven esta trabajadora mujer se ha dedicado a la agricultura y al comercio, D. esa manera ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Hoy en día continua tan activa como antes, es así que se dedica a la venta D. comestibles en una tienda que instaló en el interior D. su casa. Manifiesta que le va muy bien en el negocio, ya que obtiene considerables ganancias, pues por la zona donD. vive no tiene competencia cercana. Paralelamente a este negocio, también se dedica a la siembra D. vegetales, para su consumo propio, aprovechando además para la venta al menoreo. Luego D. muchos años D. esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado terminar D. construir su casa, a base D. material noble, por lo que se siente en la capacidad D. realizar cualquier cosa que se proponga, ahora desea abastecer su negocio con variedad D. productos para así ofrecer tener poco a poco un minimarket. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir sus pagos puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Damiana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mercadería para abastecer mejor su tienda D. productos comestibles, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Damiana is 67 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Hipólito (69 years old) and her two grown daughters and grandchildren.  Despite her advanced age, she strives daily to get ahead.  Since she was young, this hard-working woman has worked in farming and business, and thus has been able to successfully raise her children.  Today she is as active as always, and sells food in a store she set up in her house.  She states that the business is doing well.  She brings in significant earnings, as there is no competition close by.  In addition to this business, she plants crops, for personal consumption, and also for retail sales.  After many years of effort and hard work, she has finished building her house, using high-quality materials, and she thus feels she is ready to take on anything she proposes.  She would now like to stock her store with a variety of goods, thus gradually becoming a mini-market.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to making her payments punctually.  She wouldn’t want to leave a bad impression with those who have maD. it possible for her to continue working to get ahead.  Damiana plans to invest the amount requested to purchase goods to better stock her store with food products.  She hopes thereby to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Abastecer su tienda con variados productos.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La señora Marbella V. V., vive en ocotepec Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre  con el señor Humberto Morales C., los dos están ansiosos esperando a su primer bebe que nacerá en unos meses y están muy felices.

      Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos y guajolotes de rancho, lleva practicando esta actividad desde hace ocho meses, durante éste tiempo le ha ido muy bien, y gracias al préstamo que solicita podrá invertirlo en la compra de alimentos para que crezcan bien y los pueda vender a un buen precio y pueda tener mejores ingresos en su hogar.
 
    Lo que lo inspiro fue su familia ya que con ello podrá sostenerse y obtener ingresos en su  hogar apoyando a su esposo y juntos salgan adelante con su pequeño que esta por nacer y quiere darle lo mejor.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta compra  más animales  para seguir criándolos, como también comprarle alimento para que se críen en buena calidad y su clientela se sienta satisfecha con su compra que realiza.

   Su sueño es que con su actividad logre  ahorrar para  comprar un solar en donde pueda construir su casa ya que donde vive es de su mama y quiere algo mejor para su familia que es lo más importante para ella.

Se integro al programa por las promociones que se realizaron en su localidad, la cual ella se intereso, le platico a su mama la señora marcela, buscaron otra persona más y formaron el grupo. El grupo se llama vista hermosa la razón del nombre es porque en donde viven es un lugar de muchos árboles y dan una vista muy bonita.
   El grupo se integra de tres personas dos mujeres y un hombre quienes viven en el mismo lugar y son las siguientes:

  Marbella V. V.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos de rancho y guajolotes y luego venderlo en la misma región.
  Marcela V. C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de alimentos y maíz para mantener sus pollos y guajolotes.
  Edith Pérez C.: el es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo y también lo invertirá en la compra de pollos y guajolotes de rancho.
texts.en:
Marbella V. V. lives in Ocotepec, Chiapas in Mexico.  She lives with her partner, Humberto Morales C., and both are anxiously awaiting the arrival of their first baby who will be born in a few months.  They are very happy.  

She works buying and selling chickens and turkeys from the ranch.  She has been doing this for eight months and during this time it has gone very well for her.  Thanks to the loan she is requesting, she will be able to invest in feed so that they grow well and so that she can sell them for a good price and have more income for her home.

What inspired her was her family so that with this she can sustain them and have income for her home to support her husband so that together they can get ahead with their baby that is about to be born and give him the best opportunities.  With the profits that she receives from the sales she will buy more animals to continue raising them and will also buy them feed so that they grow into a good quality product so that her customers feel satisfied with their purchase.  

Her dream is to be able to use this business to save in order to buy a lot where she can build her house as right now where she lives belongs to her mother and she wants something better for her family because her family is the most important thing to her.

She joined the program because of the advertising they did en her area, this interested her and she talked to her mother, Marcela, and they looked for another person to form the group.  Their group is called Vista Hermosa (Beautiful View).  The reason behind the name is because they live in a place with many trees and beautiful views.

The group is made up of three people: two women and a man who all live in the same place and are the following:

Marbella V. V.: will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens and turkeys and then sell them in the same area.

Marcela V. C.: will invest the loan in the purchase of feed and corn to take care of her chickens and turkeys.

Edith Pérez C.: this is the first time that he is requesting a loan and he will also invest it in the purchase of chickens and turkeys from the ranch.

loans.use: To buy chickens and turkeys from the ranch to sell them in the area.

loans.name: Virginia Victoria

texts.es: Virginia Victoria se dedica a la venta de tortillas, leña y frijoles. Como toda madre responsable tiene que sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. A pesar de tener este humilde negocio, busca la forma como mejorar los ingresos de su hogar la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos pues conocen muy bien que las tortillas de Virginia son muy ricos y buenos. Ella inicio este negocio con muy pocos ahorros que tenia, pues ha sido muy difícil ya que poco a poco fue que creció y estableció también el negocio de leña y frijoles. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, frijoles, entre otros insumos necesarios.
texts.en:
Virginia Victoria sells tortillas, firewood, and beans.  Like all responsible mothers, she has to get her four children, who are still dependent upon her, ahead.

In spite of having this humble business, she is looking for ways to improve her household income.  Most of her customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends.  They know very well that Virginia’s tortillas are good and delicious.  She started this business with the very little savings that she had.  It has been very difficult.  Little by little the business grew, and she established the business of firewood and beans.

She is now requesting a loan to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, and beans, among other needed supplies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La señora Sabina (de camisa morada y a rallas) es la presidenta del grupo “Ríos de Agua Viva” cuyo nombre significa "Living Waters."  Escogieron este nombre porque algunos miembros del grupo son cristianos evangélicos.
Sabina tiene 48 años y está casada con diez hijos.  Vende "salchipapas" (hotdogs con papas) en una esquinita por la tarde.  Lleva dos años vendiendo sus ricas salchipapas y todo va bien con el negocio, además  para aumentar  a sus ingresos ha comprado unos chanchos con este préstamo.  Los está criando para vender durante la temporada navideña, luego en enero, tiene planes de comprar unos chanchitos más para criarlos y más tarde, venderlos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina (wearing a purple striped shirt) is president of the group “Ríos de Agua Viva” which means “Rivers of Living Water”. This name was selected because some of the group members are evangelical Christians.

Sabina is 48 years old, married, and has ten children. She sells “salchipapas” (hot dogs and potatoes) on a street corner in the afternoons. Sabina has been selling her rich foods for two years and has done well with her business. To increase her income, she plans to buy a few pigs with this loan. She will raise and sell them during the holiday season. In January she plans to buy mO. piglets to raise for later resale.

loans.use: Acquire pigs to raise for resale

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à un gendarme. Elle est coiffeuse de profession mais associe la vente de mèches et produit de beauté. Elle achète au magasin mèche Amina à Lomé et revend dans son atelier à Hédzranawoe à côté de la clinique de l’Aéroport. Elle est aidée par une employée et cumule dans cette activité 7 ans déjà. Le prêt demandé permettra d’acheter de nouveaux lots de mèches et produits de beauté.
texts.en: She is 28 years old and married to a policeman. She is a hairdresser by profession but also sells hair strands and beauty products. She buys her stock at the Amina hair strand shop in Lomé and sells her produce in her salon in Hédzranawoe next to the Airport clinic. She has an employee to help her and has been working in this activity for 7 years already. The loan requested will enable her to purchase a batch of strands and beauty products.

loans.use: purchase of hair strands and beauty products

loans.name: Hassina

texts.en:
Hassina is 42 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 9 and 25 years old. Hassina owns a small business selling vegetable oil and rice in the Kicukiro market.  Hassina’s business is well organized and she employs one other person to help her.  She decided to start her small store, as these items are much in need in her neighborhood 

Hassina has requested a loan to purchase new products such as rice, salt, sugar and other foodstuffs needed by her customers. This loan will allow her to attract new clients, helping her to obtain more profits. With the extra income, Hassina will save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy new products such as salt, sugar and rice

loans.name: Dairon Ezequiel

texts.es:
Dairon Ezequiel Z. R. tiene 24 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con el hijo,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Dairon Ezequiel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es contar con buena salud.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Dairon Ezequiel Z. R. is 24. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and child in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has one child. The V.R.C. Jerusalen is located in the Caimito area, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Parish in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend much time doing thos work. Darion Ezequiel works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. He purchases his products in the Garcia and Lopez Markets and sells them in the Vaca Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice and gandul beans. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have good health. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Mery Frida

texts.es:
La Sra Mery Frida se dedica a la peluqueria, tiene un salon de Belleza que ella lo administra, lo atiende, y gracias su eficiencia en su trabajo ella ha podido tenre una demanda muy alta de clientes que necesita ampliar el local y renobar sus equipos.
Ella empezo desde muy joven en el campo conla cria de ganado pero, con el tiempo migro a la ciudad, esperando una mejro vida, empezo con un pequeño cuarto en su propia casa donde atendia solo por las tardes, ahora ese pequeño ambiente no le alcanza para poder atender a todos sus clientes; por ese motivo se vio en la necesidad de ampliar un ambiente mas comodo donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio y comprar mas equipos, que le generara mas ingresos.
La sra. Mery vive por la zona de Puntiti al Este de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene una expericia de 5 años en el rubro que se desempeña, tiene 3 hijos 1 de ellos ya terminara este año el colegio; la Sra Mery se encarga sola de sus hijos desde hace 5 años pues su esposo viajo a la Argentina buscando mejores oportunidades pero no ha regresado desde entonces ni tampoco les envia dinero.
texts.en:
Mrs Mery Frida is a hairstylist. She owns and runs a beauty salon. Thanks to her efficiency, she has had so much customer demand that she needs to expand her shop and renew her equipment.
She started working in the fields caring for livestock at a very young age, but in time she migrated to the city hoping for a better life. She started with a small room in her own home where she only worked in the afternoons. Now this small space is not enough to tend to all of her customers; for this reason, she has found it necessary to expand into a more comfortable location where she will be able to offer a better service and buy more equipment. This will generate her more income.
Mery lives in the Puntiti zone, to the east of the city of Cochabamba. She has 5 years' experience in hairstyling. She has 3 children, and one of them will finish school this year. Mrs Mery has taken care of her children alone for five years because her husband traveled to Argentina in search of better opportunities and has not returned, nor does he send them money.

loans.use: the purchase of beauty salon equipment; working capital

loans.name: Alba Maria

texts.es:
Alba de 41 años, es una microempresaria que en la actualidad tiene una tienda de víveres. Con dedicación y una buena administración ha podido mantener su negocio durante varios años. 

Su tienda la tiene surtida con arroz, azúcar, bebidas, legumbres, enlatados etc. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 21:30pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar surtiendo la tienda. Pero para ello necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, legumbres etc. 

En el futuro quiere vender frutas a través de su tienda y así comprar una casa y un carro para transportase y tener su propia cadena de frutas.
texts.en:
Alba, 41, is a micro businesswoman who currently has a grocery store.  With dedication and good administration she’s managed to stay in business for several years.

Her store is stocked with rice, sugar, beverages, vegetables, canned goods, etc.  She is open for business from 6am to 9:30pm.  She has many hopes for her business so she always wants to continue stocking it.  For this she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

In the futures she’d like to sell fruit in her store and thus buy a house and a car to transport herself and have her own chain of fruit stores.

loans.use: For rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Maria Antonieta es compra y venta de carros de segundo uso, ella vende sus carros en la famosa feria sabatina del parque industrial. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Maria Antonieta invertirá el dinero del préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de los carros que compró, ella  desea comprar llantas. El sueño de Maria Antonieta es tener más de cuatro carros para vender. 
 
Maria Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is 38 years old, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Maria Antonieta purchases and re-sells used automobiles as her form of income.  She sells the automobiles on Saturdays during the famous fair held in the industrial park.  She has been in the business for 8 years and has been doing well thanks to her dedication to her job.  Maria Antonieta will invest the money from the loan to perform maintenance of the autos she purchases; she wants to purchase tires.  Maria Antonieta's dream is to have more than 4 automobiles to sell. 

Maria Antonieta belongs to the communal bank, "Yahuar Maqui", of the Arariwa Association.  She is thankful for the opportunity presented to her through this medium and because of it, she commits to fulfilling her payments according to her time frame.

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of seafood and ingredients for pupusas

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, no tiene hijos vive en casa familiar se dedica al servicio de transporte hace 2 años, brindando el servicio de flete en movilidad alquilada y compra venta de productos de pan llevar tiene el objetivo de tener su propio vehiculo para asi poder tener mayores ingresos y solventar sus gastos con holgura,  con el dinero Wilfredo compra accesorios para mejorar su vehiculo tambien tiene  el sueño de expandir su negocio con su propia movilidad y asi cumplir sus metas y objetivos.
texts.en: Wilfredo is single, 35 years old, has no children, and lives in a family member's house. For the past two years he has engaged in transportation service, offering charter services in rented vehicles. He also purchases bread products for resale. He dreams of owing a vehicle of his own to be able to increase his income. Wilfred will use the money to buy accessories to improve his car.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Genny Patricia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito, esta ciudad es conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos que conocidos dentro y fuera del país como por ejemplo los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, llamados también sombreros panamá a pesar de ser fabricados en el Ecuador.

La señora Genny  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 11 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado de Tarqui en Mana. Trabaja todos los días desde las 4h00 hasta las 13h00, sus productos los compra en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas que llegan en la madrugada a entregar a los pequeños comerciantes como él.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque estos créditos son de mucha ayuda para poder seguir adelante en su negocio y así poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia. 

Su sueño es tener su casa bien acabada.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mi Banquito” (My Little Bank) meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi every fifteen days. This city is known for the diversity of traditional products that are known within and outside of the country. One example of this is the famous straw hat called a Panama hat, even though it is manufactured in Ecuador.

Sra. Genny is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the convenience of accessing the loans. Genny is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 12, 11, and 2). The two older children attend school. Her husband is a merchant.

Sra. Genny is an excellent homemaker who is requesting a loan for her husband’s business. He sells fruits and legumes at the Tarqui Market in Mana. Her husband works every day from 4am to 1pm. He acquires his products at the same market from the wholesale distributors who arrive at dawn to sell to small merchants like him.

This loan will be used to buy fruits and legumes. Genny has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the fact that the loans have helped her husband’s business move forward and generate daily income for their family. Her dream is to have a well-finished house.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and legumes.

loans.name: Jinane

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 25 years old and married. She has three children and her husband is a worker. 

Jinane has had her own beauty center for women since 2009; she has four years' experience in this field. She has an excellent reputation and she is well known in her local area.

She is requesting a $2000 loan to buy a new machine for massage and a machine for cleaning faces. She aspires for a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for massage and a machine for cleaning faces.

loans.name: Tambuka Group

texts.fr:
Elisabeth N.  est une  commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite la localité de Mumuri en Commune Makebuko de la Province de Gitega au centre du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 3ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fait ses études primaires jusqu’en 6e année. Elle est une veuve et a 5 enfants qui étudient tous. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités de bananes à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle est très optimiste quant à l’avancement de son business et espère réussir sa vie familiale avec le succès de ses enfants. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Tambuka».
texts.en:
Elisabeth N., 40, is a businesswoman who lives in Mumuri in the township of Makebuko, Province of Gitega, in central Burundi. She has been selling bananas for three years and before beginning this activity, she was a farmer. She went to school up through 6th grade. She is a widow with five children who are all enrolled in school.   

She has requested a loan from Kiva to grow her working capital by buying large quantities of bananas for resale so as to make more profit. She is very optimistic about the boost for her business and hopes to succeed in her family life as her children manage to succeed. 

She is a member of a borrowing group called "Tambuka".

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey O. O. is 40 years old, widowed, and has three children between 18 and 2 years old. 

His business well known by the name Smile Migingo Agencies, and it is located at Kakamega town. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region. 

He sells soft drinks such as Afia juices, Alvaro, sodas and mineral water to the local people. He has been doing this business for three years now and has managed to give employment to three people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is seasonal changes. This is because during cold weather and rainy season the business goes down. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of KES 60,000 to buy more soft drinks to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to be the leading soft drinks distributor in Kakamega county and western province in the future. He describes himself as hardworking, innovative and a team player. He says since he joined SMEP he knew the sky is the limit.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 years old, married to Alice, and they have one child.  Simon has operated his motorbike business in Naivasha town for the last one year.

Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm produce like potatoes, maize, and transport them to the market for sale . 

In the future, Simon hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods to and from the market as his business grows.

loans.use: To buy farm produce and transport them to the market for sale.

loans.name: Eliana Cinthya

texts.es:
Eliana, es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras, tiene 20 años es madre soltera y tiene una hija de un año. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños. Eliana atiende pedidos de amigos y familiares, los días domingos viaja a la feria de Huanta, gracias a Dios le va bien. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería.
Eliana está en FINCA Perú hace 2 años, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por la facilidad en las que recibe los préstamos y por las capacitaciones que recibe, le enseñan a trabajar y a valorarse como mujer. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda grande ropa.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the “Emprendedoras” communal bank.  She’s 20 years old and a single mother of a one-year-old daughter.  She sells clothes for women, men and children.  She fills orders from friends and family members.  On Sundays she goes to the Huanta farmers market and thank God is doing well.  The loan will be used to buy clothes to stock her business.

Eliana has been in FINCA Perú for two years.  She likes her communal bank meetings because of the loan terms she gets and because of the training she receives; they teach her how to work and value herself as a woman.  Her dream is to be able to open a big clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfume, oil relaxer and hair pieces.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.pt:
Natural da localidae de Matimule distrito de Manjacaze provincia de Gaza. Tem dois filhos com idade compreendidas entre 2 a 4 anos de idade.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do salário que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seus amigos e colegas de trabalho, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
tornar-se cliente da Hluvuku ha mais de um ano. O seu primeiro emprėstimo foi no valor de 6.000,00mts para compra de um congelador, no segundo de 8.000,00mts para compra de cimento para fabrico de  blocos e pagamento de  mão- de- obra, terceiro no valor de 9.000,00mts para compra de chapas de zinco para cobrir a sua casa na sua terra natal. O presente emprėstimo de 12.000,00mts é para iniciar com uma nova obra na ponta de ouro, compra de cimento.
Tenciona ver  a sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento
texts.en:
Juvencio is from Matimule, in the Manjacaze district of the Gaza province.  He has two children ages 2 and 4.  He currently lives and works in the tourist zone of Ponta D'Ouro, in the Matutuine district.  His salary allows him to feed his family and save a bit in his bank account at BCI.  

He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with friends and coworkers.  He decided to learn more about the process og becoming a customer and benefiting from loans to complete his projects.  He has been a customer for more than a year.  His first loan was for 6.000,00mts, which he used to purchase a freezer.  The second loan was for 8.000,00mts which he used to purchase cement for cement blocks and for labor.  The third loan was for 9.000,00mts for the purchase of zinc to roof his home in his hometown. This loan  is for 12.000,00mts to purchase cement for a new construction project in Ponta D'Ouro. 

He is anxious to complete his home and will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for future loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Javier es cliente antiguo de la institución el es transportista vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de los  rosales el tiene un hijito y sus esposa trabaja como empleada en un supermercado el préstamo que solicita es para los arreglos de la casita ya que sus padres ya le dieron autorización para  que el realice los arreglos a la casita  y realizar unos cuartos para así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el es una persona muy amable dinámico y con muchas ganas de superación, deseando siempre el bienestar de toda su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Javier is a former client of the institution.  He is a taxi driver.  He lives at home with his parents in the Los Rosales area. He has one small child and his wife works in a supermarket.  The loan he is requesting is for home repair.  His parents have given him permission to make these repairs and to build some rooms to provide greater comfort for his family.  He is a friendly, dynamic person with a strong desire to improve himself.  He always wishes for the well-being of his entire family.  He is grateful to the institution for offering support. .

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio (58 años), casado con Emilia (57 años), fruto de esta relación tiene 3 hermosos hijos. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Eusebio es una persona que ha vivido penurias y sufrimientos, a causa de los desmanes ocasionados por la violencia política de las décadas  80 y 90. Por ello,  Eusebio tuvo que dejar la tierra que lo vio nacer y todo lo que poseía, para proteger  su vida  y la vida de su familia. El padre de Eusebio fue maestro constructor a base de barro y paja, por ello Eusebio al aprender la labor de su padre se dedico a construir su vivienda a base de paja y barro. Posteriormente, Eusebio notó que la gente poseía un ingreso económico más rentable y que los problemas sociopolíticos se iban solucionando; por lo que la gente optaba por tener una vivienda a base de material noble. Por esta razón, Eusebio decide capacitarse sobre construcciones y edificaciones en CAPECO, obteniendo el certificado de maestro constructor. Actualmente, Eusebio edifica las viviendas resaltantes, obras de arte de las calles de Pichari. Eusebio esta feliz con su trabajo y cuenta con el apoyo de sus trabajadores. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete a cumplir con las cuotas muy puntualmente. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles Eusebio comprara algunas herramientas con las que aun no cuenta.
texts.en: Eusebio (58), is married to Emilia (57), and together they have 3 beautiful children.  They live in their own home, located in the Pichari district.  Eusebio is a person who has experienced hardship and suffering, resulting from the excesses of political violence that occurred during the decades of the 80s and 90s.  Because of this, Eusebio had to leave his homeland and everything he owned in order to protect his life and the lives of his family.  Eusebio's father was a master builder of mud and straw, and so Eusebio learned this trade from his father and devoted himself to building houses made of mud and straw.  Later Eusebio noted that when people began to have better incomes and the socioeconomic problems were getting resolved, more people were opting to have homes built of more solid materials.  For this reason, Eusebio decided to get trained in construction and building in CAPECO, where he obtained a master builder certificate.  Now, Eusebio builds impressive homes, works of art on the streets of Pichari.  Eusebio is happy with his work, and has the support of his workers.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments on time.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles Eusebio requests, he will buy some tools that he currently lacks.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. 

Elmer is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline spent on the service.

Elmer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elmer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning to sail my ship.  That is Marilou’s favorite quote. She is 45 years old, married, and blessed with five school-aged children. At her age, Marilou shares that she has to be patient and work hard to prepare to give her children a college level of education.

Despite the problems she encountered, Marilou just considers them as challenges in her life. She doesn’t want to lose her hopes that someday she will overcome them and will succeed.

At present, Marilou has difficulties in sustaining her farm inputs because of price increase. She wanted to borrow a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to apply on her rice crop. Her goal is to expand her farm area. She also wishes to have productive crops.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Marivic has operated her general store for over four years. She earns about PHP 6,000 a month.

Marivic wants to expand her family business, that’s why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, school supplies, rice and feed to retail.
 
Marivic hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future and aims to educate her child so that she will become a professional someday. Despite the hardships of life, Marivic is striving to earn and save for the familys security and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, school supplies, rice and feed to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. This young man started his business in 2009 working as a private teacher receiving students at his house. He is especially talented at giving biology-chemistry lessons. His business is very important because with its income, he is able to help his parents pay for his university education fees.  

As is common in the young Lebanese generation, he has a job and is pursuing his education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his courses at the university. His only purpose is to pursue his education until graduating without facing financial issues.

loans.use: to pay for his courses at the university.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.
Lourdes runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.
Lourdes has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 44 years old and lives with her three kids and her father in an apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Her father is a retired older man who stays at home.  Her husband died in a factory accident and her oldest two kids are in college and younger one is in school. 

She has worked as a pharmacist since 2002.   She became a pharmacy owner in 2011.  Now she needs more assets in order to run a pharmacy business well. 

Tuvshinjargal is a strong and diligent woman who says, "Even though it was hard to raise three kids all by my own, I never stepped back and I never will."

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more medicine to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more medicine

loans.name: Simana A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Simana A Group in Western Kenya! Isabela is the facilitator of the Simana A group. Most of the farmers in this group joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and are now enrolling in their third planting season with the program.

Isabela takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Isabela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 32 bags on 2 acres of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Isabela was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 2 acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Isabela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Isabela will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana A group will each plant  between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 30 years old and married, with 2 children aged 3 and 7 years old. She owns a business selling secondhand clothes in the market. She has 8 years of experience in this business, working from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. 5 days a week. She currently employs two people to help her. 

Donatha has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 62, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to one child. With her child, she manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. She owns one tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar attached to it) that carries four to five passengers to their destination within the community. She earns an income through the boundary (daily quota) that her driver remits each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan for additional spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth hopes to be able to have another tricycle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Naneth has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands such as adobo, afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw the ingredients needed for making viands.

Naneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Naneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
José, es empleado como vigilante de una agencia bancaria, vive en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijas de las edades de 7 y 3 años, por medio de su salario ayuda a las necesidades de sus hijas y su esposa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la instalación de la energía eléctrica en la vivienda de su madre, además hará otros arreglos para ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de la casa de su mama.
Su aspiración con este préstamo, es poder instalar la energía en dicha vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su madre sintiéndose satisfecho por bien que ha realizado.
texts.en:
José is employed as a guard at a bank branch. He lives in his own house with his wife and 2 daughters who are 7 and 3 years old. His salary supports the needs of his wife and children.

Currently he is asking for a loan to install electricity in his mother’s house, and also to make other repairs in order to improve his mothers home.

His purpose with this loan is to install electricity in said residence in order to give his mother a better quality of life so that his mother will feel contented by what he has done.

loans.use: to install electricity

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, aged 30 years, is married to Catherine and they are blessed with one child, aged three years. Julius operates a motorcycle transport business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes 7,200.

This is Julius' first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to service his motorbike by buying new tyres and brakes, etc. Julius hopes to buy a taxi in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spares for repair.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepcion

texts.es:
Mercedes Concepción,  es una joven de 19 años, emprendedora, cuyo pasatiempo es escuchar música, y su comida favorita es el exquisito “Pollo a la Coca cola”, y a pesar de sus 19 años, ella tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y su puesto de venta de Comida, ella no tiene vergüenza por sus trabajos sino mas bien es muy luchadora y le dedica 4 horas diarias a su puesto de venta de comidas y a su negocio de venta de ropa le dedica 6 horas, si aunque no lo creen ella tiene la fuerza  y la dedicación para atender estos 2 negocios, al día puede atender de manera diaria alrededor de 50 clientes entre los 2 negocios, en un día puede ganar hasta  S/. 170,  en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.220, ella cree que le va bien es los negocios debido a su buen trato hacia los clientes y porque con esfuerzo y dedicación todo le va de buena manera, quien le da ánimo para seguir es su madre y sobre todo que Mercedes se siente feliz de que su madre la apoye en todo lo que ella hace. 

Actualmente Mercedes agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a su clientela, asimismo mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, con esto mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio se verá más bonito y atractivo para los clientes, lo que permitirá que tenga más ingresos para ahorrar y con el tiempo cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una Boutique de Ropa”.
texts.en:
Mercedes Concepción is a young person of 19. She is an entrepreneur whose pastime is listening to music and her favorite food is the exquisite "Pollo a la Coca cola." Despite her 19 years of age she has a business selling clothing and a food stand. She isn't embarrassed about her jobs, but rather is a fighter and dedicates four hours daily to her food stand and six hours daily to her clothing business. If you still don't believe that she has the strength and dedication to run these two businesses, she can tend to around 50 customers a day between the two businesses and in one day earn up to 170 soles. On a good day she can earn up to 220 soles. She believes that business goes well for her due to the good treatment of her customers and because with much effort and dedication everything can go well. It's her mother who encourages her to continue and above all Mercedes feels happy that her mother supports her in all that she does.

Currently Mercedes is very thankful to all those that loan their money through Kiva since with such support she will be able to buy a lot of merchandise for her business and have a variety of products to offer her customers. Also, she will be able to improve the infrastructure of her business and thus improve the quality of life of her family and her business will look nicer and more attractive to customers. This will allow her to have more income to save and with time, grant her big dream: to have a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing) and improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen, age 42, lives with her husband and six children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. 

She cultivates rice crops and takes some time to sell fresh fish in a local market for her livelihood. She earns approximately $1.50 per day to cover her daily expenses.
 
This is her second loan from Kiva and forth loan from HKL. Pen would like to borrow this loan to build a store and start selling groceries in her neighborhood. And with the remaining funds, she will buy a pair of tires for her plowing machine. 

She hopes that she will be able to improve her business and lead her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to build a store and start selling groceries in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 28-year-old married woman living in Al Bayader, Jordan. She is a mother of five children. 

Maha is looking to have a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can paint her house and make it more healthy. 

Maha is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to paint her house

loans.name: Luz Perla

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo de pocos meses de nación, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que es para y madre para él; lamentablemente Luz no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, ya que su familia es muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta visitar a su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con ellos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescado, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 7 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por sus buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como madera, calaminas y clavos, de esta manera Luz podrá terminar la construcción del techado de su vivienda, con ello espera poder podrá brindarle mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Luz seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder darle una buena educación a su pequeño y en un futuro no muy lejano desea verlo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Luz is 20 years old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her little son born a few months ago. She is a very kind person, hardworking and enthusiastic, who puts all her efforts into raising her child, as she is his mother for him. Unfortunately Luz was not able to finish her primary school studies, since from a very young child she had to work to help her parents. Her family is humble, but she would have liked very much to study for a professional career in education. In her free time she likes to visit her family and sometimes on these occasions to cook delicious fried fish to share with them.

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Luz works in her own small business selling fish. She works every day from early in the morning and can work for approximately 7 hours. She feels happy doing her work and believes that it is going well because of her good prices and the kind service she offers her customers.

Luz is very grateful for the Kiva loans as thanks to the support given she she can buy construction materials, such as wood, corrugated zinc roofing, and nails. This will allow Luz to finish the construction of the roof of her house, as she is hoping to be able to offer better security and wellbeing for her family. So Luz will continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of being able to give a good education to her child and in the not so far off future see him become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as wood, corrugated zinc roofing and nails, in order to complete the construction of the roof of her house.

loans.name: Angie

texts.es:
Angie ha trabajado en el comercio desde hace 10 años, siguiendo los pasos de Lina Sequeira, clienta de Fundación Mujer, quien la recomienda. Inició con el apoyo económico de su compañero y de Lina quien le vendió mercadería, ganando un margen por las ventas realizadas. Cuenta en la actualidad con una cartera de clientes y 2 personas que vende su mercadería en otras zonas de Puntarenas.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias, brindándole ingresos a otras 2 amigas de la zona,  las que ganan un margen con las ventas. Con espíritu de servicio y apoyo a otras personas, la clienta requiere de capital para invertir para el día de la madre y diciembre. Tiene una niña de 6 meses que le motiva a seguir trabajando, su hija mayor está en la escuela y el ingreso que obtiene en su actividad, le permite apoyarla en los estudios, así como a su compañero, en los gastos del hogar, mejorando así las condiciones del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Angie has worked in sales for the last 10 years, following in the steps of Lina Sequeira, client of Fundación Mujer, who recommended her. She started with financial support from her partner and from Lina, who sold merchandise to her and gave her a commission on the sales made. Currently Angie has a portfolio of customers and two people who sell her merchandise in other areas of Puntarenas.

Angie makes a living from selling clothing and sandals, providing an income for two friends in the area who earn a commission on their sales. In the spirit of service and support to other people, she requires capital to invest for Mother's Day and for December. She has a 6-month-old daughter who motivates her to keep working. Her older daughter is in school and the income from her business allows her to support her daughter in her studies as well as her partner with household expenses, improving the conditions for their nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the periods of August and December.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and lives in the town of Masindi, in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Grace has been working hard to manage her piggery farm,which sales pigs. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more piglets to sale. This will help Grace to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a bigger one, by creating more space for more pigs. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to sale.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en: Artemia is running a general store for a living. She is 56, widow and having four children that lives with their own family near Artemia's residence.Aside from this, she also was engaged in hog fattening selling pigs in town to earn a living. She borrowed a loan to buy new items like grocery goods, rice and feeds for sale. She is hopeful that with this loan, she can sustained the store and be able to have a stable source of income for their future.

loans.use: to buy new items like grocery goods, rice and feeds for sale

loans.name: Libertina

texts.en:
Libertina has successfully paid back a Rp 20.000.000 loan over six months. She achieved this through sales of solar lights to her home island of Sabu in Eastern Indonesia.

More people on this remote island are requesting these solar lights for their home and farming activities. Libertina requests another loan to purchase more solar lights to sell to her customers.  These life-changing products provide solutions to her customers’ lack of access to electricity.

Libertina is grateful for your support to increase her earnings. She is building a new home and uses the profit to purchase the building materials.

loans.use: to help introduce simple, clean energy products to her community

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru:
Нигинамо 60 лет. Нигинамо домохозяйка, и она много времени проводит дома, занимаясь шитьем. Шить и кроить для нее доставляет много удовольствие. Нигинамо проводит время приятно и полезно. Услуга швеи является основным источникам дохода для нее. Нигинамо шьет платья на заказ на машинке, на которой Вы видите на фотографии. 
Нигинамо имеет 2 сыновей и 2 невестки. Невестки помогает ей на работе, и они ведет домашнее хозяйство. Путем шитье она зарабатывает на жизнь. Она просит кредит для ткани, чтобы сшить на продажу. Нигинамо надеется на Вашу поддержку. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Niginamo is 60 years old. She is a housewife and spends a long time at home sewing. She really enjoys sewing and cutting. Niginamo spends her time in a pleasant and useful way. Her work as a dress-maker provides the main source of income for Niginamo. She makes dresses on order using the sewing machine you see in the picture. 

Niginamo has two sons and two daughters-in-law. Her daughters-in-law help her with sewing and do the housework. Niginamo makes a living by sewing. She is requesting a loan for the fabric to make more clothes for sale. Niginamo is hoping for your help. She is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Roxana Yanet

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 56 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 18 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es amigable, leal y muy honesta. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ caracterizada por encontrarse la terminal de buses con destino a poblaciones del norte, de clima frio y seco muy ventoso, con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Roxana es de tez morena, cabello largo castaño y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en último año de la escuela y acaba de tener un bebé, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, alimentos no perecederos y material de librería en su tienda de barrio, también cuenta con regalos como peluches, álbum de fotos, peluches, cremas, joyas de fantasía y otros, “al no conseguir trabajó decidí abrir mi propio negocio, tengo la suerte de ser la tienda más popular…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque cuenta con mercadería variada y está bien surtida. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes la prefieren porque está bien abastecida, la desventaja son las horas de trabajo porque la demanda le exige largas jornadas. Su sueño es que su hija tenga su propio negocio para que pueda abastecer a su recién nacido, ella desea comprar una máquina fotocopiadora para que su hija la administre y poco a poco se independice. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina fotocopiadora para que su hija la administre y se independice.

loans.use: para comprar una máquina fotocopiadora para que su hija la administre y se independice.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria D. is 58 years old. She lives in the village of Staro selo, which is 38 km away from Sliven. Maria has lost her husband 5 years ago and since then she lives alone and also alone breeds 8 cows in her farm. She breeds cows for more than twenty years. With money that she earns she helps her two sons who live in the city. Maria D. wants to buy one more cow and applies for $ 1 200 loan.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has Victoria as a long-standing client. She is very good at record-keeping and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $850 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Joseph Sitati

texts.en: Joseph is a father of three. He underwent training in electronics repair after which he opened his business.  This was inspired by the fact that there were no such services at the local community trading centre and residents had to go far to get electronics repair services. This was in the year 2004, and since then, he has been in the business which he says is booming.  Through his business, he has been able to support his family, educate his children and best of all bring services to the community at a fair price.  With a loan from PEMCI, he intents to purchase repair parts and expand his business and also purchase other equipment which he had been unable to do so because he had insufficient funds.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and repair parts in order to expand his business

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto Carlos

loans.use: Para la compra de joyas como anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aros// Purchase of jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings

loans.name: Antiga

texts.en:
Antiga is from Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and has no children.
She has been in business for 15 years. She has borrowed 5 loans from Normicro and has used them for business expansion. All loans were paid back on time. As her business is going well, she wants to borrow $1,000 from Normicro, again to improve what she sells. She wants to buy special wedding materials for wedding parties.

loans.use: To Increase Inventory

loans.name: Ni Kadek Suastini

texts.id:
Cutting hair has become main income for Ni Kadek Suastini. Even though she usually goes to her client's place to cut hair, she still maintains a salon at her home. Beside cutting hair, she also does help make-up for bridegrooms, and many of them are very happy with her work. However even not having clients everyday. She still manages to gain Rp.150.000 clean profit every month. This is used to assist her husband I Komang Suarmawa for their household expenses, and raising their child who is still schooling. With the financial assitance Ni Kadek Suastini intends to buy more make up tools to increase her selections, so that she can further serve her customer's better.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Memotong rambut sudah menjadi mata pencaharian bagi Ni Kadek Suastini. Walaupun sering dipanggil oleh pelanggan, Ni Kadek Suastini tetap membuka salon dirumah. Selain potong rambut, Ni Kadek Suastini juga bisa merias pengantin, baik tata rias pengantin adat bali maupun nasional. Banyak pelanggan yang senang dengan hasil riasannya. Tidak setiap hari ada yang kesalon tetapi dalam 1 bulan keuntungan yang diterima sangat memuaskan sebesar Rp.150.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk membantu suaminya, I Komang Suarmawa, dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dan menanggung biaya sekolah 1 orang anak. Ni Kadek Suastini berkeinginan menambah alat – alat untuk melengkapi perlengkapan salonnya agar bisa melayani pelanggannya dengan lebih baik lagi.

loans.use: Membeli perlengkapan salon - Buying salon items

loans.name: H. Iyah

texts.en: Iyah is 34 years old and has a 10-year-old son. She makes about $15 per week selling household goods at her small shop. Her husband, T., is a farmer who earns $1.50 per day growing and selling his crops. Iyah has applied for a $100 loan to expand her  business by buying more goods to sell to her customers. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru:
Kosim T. is 52 years old, has completed high school, is married and has 4 children. Mr. T. has been raising and selling cattle for the last two years and it is the main source of income for his family. Mr. T. is planning to use his loan to purchase 2 calves for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he will sell the cattle and use the money to purchase additional calves. According to his calculations he is planning to have two extra calves at the end of the loan cycle to pay back the loan. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Темиров Косим, возраст – 52 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4 -х детей. Косим занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет и это является его основным источником дохода. На полученный кредит Косим планирует приобоести 2 молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. Согласно прогноза в конце кредитного цикла ему должно остаться в качестве поибыли 2 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en: Mr. Ifeanyi E. is 33 years old and has one child. He hails from Benin-City, Nigeria. He has been in business for 7 years. He needs a loan of $850 to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Nile Lending Group

texts.en:
The chairperson of the group, Alice E., operates a general store operating from her home. She has run the business for seven years and has recently expanded to selling cold drinks from her refridgerator.
