She is a young, hard-working woman and her goal is to expand her business. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to buy a jukebox.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam V. O. tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive en el barrio de ingreso a Fortaleza a 12 km. de la ciudad, es profesional ingeniero Forestal y quiere trabajar en su profesión para lo cual necesita capital de inversión para los plantines de flores y construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda que está sin los mismos por falta de dinero.  

Ya tiene un pequeño vivero con plantas ornamentales las mismas que comercializa en la feria de los domingos en el barrio, esta actividad le ha estado ayudando a crecer poco a poco en su actividad.
texts.en:
Miriam V. O. is 27 years old. She is married and she has two small children. She lives in a neighborhood near Fortaleza, 12 Km. from the city. She is a professional forest engineer and she want to work in this field. She needs investment capital for flower seedlings and to build a perimeter wall which has not been built due to a lack of money. 

She has a small nursery with ornamental plants. She sells them at the market on Sundays in her neighborhood. This is helping her to grow her business little by little.

loans.use: with operating capital for her flower growing activities

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells basic needs such as oils, sugar, instant noodles, canned goods, baked breads, cooking ingredients and other types of dry goods. Teresa had been this business for five years. According to her, she is able to generate PHP 2,000 a month. 

Teresa is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, cooking ingredients, biscuits, soft drinks, instant noodles and other basic needs. In the future, Teresa hopes to increase the profit she generates from her business to be able to provide the needs of her family and for security purposes when she gets weak. She will be grateful if her requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, soft drinks, instant noodles, canned goods, cooking ingredients and other basic needs

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es: La  Señora Nicolaza tiene 33 años es  madre soltera con 2 hijos menores dependientes , vive con su madre que tiene 61 años en sector de Aguirre ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, La sra. Nicolaza se dedica a la agricultura produce papa, haba, oca en su terreno que tiene 1.6 has y 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno, es una persona humilde pero trabajadora,  ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico más semilla de papa, porque el capital que tenía lo ha invertido en la compra de una casa, ahora el lugar donde habita es propio. Para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos, por eso se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona y ofertar crédito, la Sra. Nicolaza está muy contenta de haber que tiene la oportunidad para comprar los insumos agrícolas para siembra, de este modo tendrá la seguridad de sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y también poder ahorrar dinero para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Nicolaza is 33 and a single mother of two children.  She lives with her mother, who is 61, in the town of  Aguirre, some 42 km outside of the city of Cochabamba. Nicolaza grows agricultural crops such as potatoes and beans on her farm of 1.6 hectares.  She cares for 4 cows, and is a very hardworking woman.  She seeks this credit to buy organic fertilizer to increase her potato crop yield.  She used a prior loan to pay for her own house. She does not have access to credit in large banks, and is very happy to be able to participate in microcredit and improve her family's situation, allowing her two children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and crop seed

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married, with three children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. Stella owns a cosmetics shop in Ndeeba selling all types of cosmetics such as cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids and weaves. She has been in this business for the last three years and sells at both retail and wholesale to all categories of people.

Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids and weaves. Her business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Stella hopes to see her business grow big so that she may own a bridal shop and start importing cosmetics herself. Stella lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Elsa Dionicia

texts.es:
Elsa Dionicia tiene 55 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, edwin 20 años, Gullermo 22, Jenny 25 y Maria 30 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz actividad que la realiza desde hace 10 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.No enfrenta desafios impportantes. Su sueño es tener una casa nueva.

Le gusta tener limpia la casa.
texts.en:
Elsa Dionicia is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children: 20 year-old Edwin, 22 year-old Guillermo, 25 year-old Jenny and 30 year-old Maria, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Elsa is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Elsa is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She does not face any major challenges.  Her dream is to own a new house.

Elsa enjoys having a clean house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Cruz Santos

texts.es:
Cruz de 41 años de edad, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola y ganadería.

Cruz tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1000 para comprar material y dar mantenimiento a su máquina,  así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.  Cruz con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante y a superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
41-year old Cruz lives in his own home which has water and electricity. It is located in Chepén district, a part of the department of La Libertad. The area is known for its agriculture and cattle.

Cruz’s job is making and selling clothing. He’s been doing this for several years. He works from home and has regular customers but takes orders as well. There’s not a lot of competition in this line of work. With the money he earns, he can pay for personal necessities. 

Cruz has asked Edpyme Alternativa through the program Capital Semilla (‘Seed Money’) for a loan of 1000 soles to buy fabric and also to service his sewing machine. In this way he can continue serving his customers well and complete the orders they have given him. In turn, these will provide him with more income so that he can improve his standard of living. He knows that with a lot of effort and hard work he can advance his business and do well in life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to service his sewing machine

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, vive con su esposo y una hija, tiene varios meses de estar en el negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, comprando maquillajes, labiales, cremas, lociones, y más accesorios femeninos, este préstamo le ayudara para elevar sus ventas y atender la demanda.
Ella aspira desarrollarse en el comercio, que su negocio sea cada vez más productivo y vivir en tranquilidad con su familia.
texts.en:
Karla lives with her husband and daughter. She sells cosmetics and has been in business for several months. Karla works Monday through Saturday.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise to restock her business. Karla plans to buy make-up, lipsticks, crèmes, lotions, and other women’s accessories. This loan will help elevate her sales and allow her to meet demand.

Karla aspires to develop in her trade and to be more productive in her business each day. She also hopes to live peacefully with her family.

loans.use: to buy make-up, lipsticks, crèmes, lotions, and women’s accessories.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Edilberto has a shop that sells cocoa fruits and coconuts. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy cocoa fruits and coconuts for sale.

Edilberto is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Edilberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy cocoa fruits & coconuts for sale

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 47 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  

Milly has a poultry feeds business, which she has had for 10 years.  To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase poultry feeds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.    

Milly is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old, married and has two children. To generate income and provide sustenance for the education of her children, Lourdes rents a stall in the public market and operates her beauty salon. Lourdes provides haircut services and she also does hair curling and coloring for all occasions such as weddings, debuts and graduations. She usually earns about P3,000 each month.

Lourdes is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy hair brushes, hair dyes, scissors and blowers to use in her beauty salon to improve the services rendered to her customers thus increase her earnings, too. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to have a good financial management in order to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair brushes, hair dyes, scissors and blowers to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy green maize, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.
Margarita has been in this business for 33 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock. Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 41 years old and lives in Taboc, Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married and has three children. Arlyn has a sari-sari store (general store) and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Blanca Ligia

texts.es:
Desde hace 30 años Blanca Ligia se dedica a la confección directa y a terceros, es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha soñado con tener un mejor futuro, y por ello trabaja con gran esmero para hacer progresar su negocio. Hoy en día quiere mejorar el servicio, y para ello debe comprar una máquina recubridora que agilice el proceso de confección y le de mayor calidad a sus productos terminados, pero Blanca no cuenta con la suma de dinero necesaria para la compra de la máquina, por lo que solicita un préstamo con que hacer dicha compra, pues es conciente que así su negocio tendrá mayores pedidos y nuevos clientes.

A sus 57 años de edad y como madre de 2 hijos su único propósito es llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida, mejorar las ventas y la capacidad de producción y finalmente estabilizar su difícil situación económica.
texts.en:
For 30 years Blanca Ligia has been sewing for other people and third parties.  She is an enterprising woman who has always dreamed about having a better future.  She works very hard to grow her business.  In an effort to improve her service she must buy an overlock sewing machine which will facilitate the sewing process and lend greater quality to the finished product.  Blanca does not have enough money to buy the machine so she is requesting a loan for the purchase, especially since she knows it will bring in more orders and new customers.

At her 57 years of age and as the mother of two children, her only goal is to have a better lifestyle, increase sales and production capacity, and eventually stabilize her difficult economic situation.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is a 34-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She is the main owner of an accessories shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past three years. She sells women's accessories such as bags, necklaces, bracelets, rings and perfumes. She cooperates with her father to pay the family expenses. Today, she is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes to attract more customers and therefore increase her sales. In the future, she plans to add women's clothes to her shop.

loans.use: To increase her store’s inventory of accessories and perfumes to attract more customers and therefore increase her sales

loans.name: Khaka Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Khaka group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

David takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed and One Acre Fund's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, David will build a new house for his family and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Khaka group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows David with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a thirty-three year-old lady from Mugen area of Vihiga County, Western Kenya. She is married to Francis who is a farmer, and they have four children.

Violet operates an agro vet in Mugen area, a business she has done for the last ten years. She recently joined KADET to get access to micro funding, and has been awarded a first loan, which she will use to buy a stock of agro vet goods. 

She intends to use the profits to provide for her family, and at the same time invest in building a residential house for them. Her hope is to grow her business and get access to KADET funding.

loans.use: To buy more agro vet stock.

loans.name: Yanci Azucena

texts.es:
Yanci, vive con su esposo,  se dedica a vender verduras en su casa, el oficio lo empezó por iniciativa propia hace varios años, todos los días vende de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería como: papas, yuca, repollo, zanahoria, debido a la época de diciembre y de esa forma podrá incrementar las ventas y podrá tener más ingresos.
El objetivo de Yanci con el tiempo poner una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y tener más clientes y de esa forma darles lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Yanci lives with her husband and sells vegetables from her home.  She started doing this through her own initiative a few years ago and sells every day, Monday to Sunday.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes, yucca, cabbage, and carrots.  Given that it’s December, this will allow her to increase her sales and income.

Yanci’s goal is to eventually open a grocery store, have more customers, and in this way provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 41 years old.  She is married with two children and lives in Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga.

To earn a living, Elita operates a small gasoline business.  She has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP to purchase 10 gallons of gasoline to sell.  She has been in business for five years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP each month.  Elita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Mario Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es un señor de 48 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene la motivación y la ayuda de sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con su vida. Además  le es muy importante arreglar este medio de transporte, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado, ya que Randall un gran trabajador.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Gerardo es un micro crédito de ¢600,000(seiscientos mil colones), para comprar repuestos y reparar su automovil, para movilizarse a su trabajo todos los días, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Gerardo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 48, lives with his family in Osa, a canton in the Costa Rican province of Puntarenas.  It's a largely rural area, much visited for its beaches, and the most important industries here are tourism and farming.  

Gerardo works hard for his family and he can count on their support.  He operates a taxi business and there's a strong demand for the service he provides because he's a hard worker.  

Gerardo will use this 600,000 (six-hundred thousand) colones loan to pay for repairs and buy spare parts for his taxi.  The investment will allow him to ensure that the taxi is properly maintained.  

Gerardo is a member of the Cana Blancal community bank, one of 150 organizations that belong to the EDESA network in Costa Rica.  This loan will help him to grow personally and economically.  He wants to emphasize, as well, that loans such as this one allow him to spend more time earning a living.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Sharel

texts.en:
Sharel is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sharel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector: she runs a general store. Although it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Sharel has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 750 Samoa talas (WST) a month (approximately $350 USD) from these activities.

In 2011, Sharel joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and for the ability to engage in business activities. Sharel is requesting her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. Sharel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 2 and 3 years, Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego learned entrepreneurship in the United States of America. After his graduation, he came back to his hometown to launch a booklet on software for secondary students. He sold more than 6,000.

He met with a Zafen analyst in an entrepreneurship camp. He seized the opportunity to present his business model. His objective is to bring new technology closer to poor students while making some money. His collaborator is a young student who earns some money to support her school fees.

With this loan, Diego will buy a printer, boost his Short Message Service platform and print out more paperback books.

He is pictured with Jenny (customer service agent).

Diego has another source of income to support his repayment. Finally, he will also create two part-time jobs for students.

loans.use: to launch a printing service for primary and secondary schools.

loans.name: Boiana

texts.en: Boiana G. is 33 years old. She is divorced and is looking after her 7 year boy. Boiana has a shop for jeans ware in Bourgas. She is in retail business for more than ten years. Besides this shop she is an official representative of an ice cream company and during the summer months she has several ice cream show cases in some sea resorts. Each year before Christmas she has many customers so now she wants to supply 500 pairs of jeans for her shop. The loan amount is $ 2000.

loans.use: To supply 500 pairs of jeans for her shop

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy has an experience of 7 years preparing and selling candies. He began working with a friend delivering bread. With the money he saved in the activity, he decided to buy an oven and moves to work as an independent with his wife. He has been able to begin building his cement house instead of the bamboo wood he had before. He works daily from 7am to 4pm selling the products and from 6pm to 2am to prepare it.

Freddy wants the Kiva loan to be able to buy products for the preparation of the candy, because at this time he is only delivery to schools and request from stores of the area.

Freddy is 34 years old, has 3 kids, two of them are in school already. Hi wife helps him preparing the candy and also works as a teacher in a school. His wish is to be able to improve his house so he can install his business there, because now he only works making deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Iyoh

texts.en: Iyoh is 40 years old and is married with one son. Her husband, Mawi, has a business of repairing shoes and sometimes earns $5 per day.  On other days, he can earn nothing.  To supplement her husband’s income, Iyoh sells cooked chicken noodles on the side of the road. In a day Iyoh can earn $5. She needs a loan of $50. With this loan, she can buy more materials to make more noodles and thus more or less double her income. Iyoh very much wants to earn more money  for her son's education and to give him a better life than what she grew up with.

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. They live in the locality of Apodaca in the state of Nuevo Leon. In order to try to acquire a house and improve her family's quality of life Maria and her husband have worked a lot. She began her own business with the cooking and sale of donas and empanadas. It is thus how little by little they have been saving to offer greater stability for their children. Thanks to the good quality of the products that Maria makes she quickly made a name for herself and they have increased their orders day by day. To be able to cover demand and continue growing her business Maria is asking for a credit of $925 that she will use in the purchase of ingredients and she promises to repay this loan in six months. For your important part in the life of this family contributing to the development of their business, many thanks.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, viven en la localidad de Apodaca en el estado de Nuevo León. Para tratar de adquirir una casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria y su esposo han trabajado mucho, ella inició su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de donas y empanadas, es así como poco a poco han estado ahorrando para ofrecerle una mayor estabilidad a sus hijos. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora Maria pronto se dio a conocer y se han incrementado sus pedidos día con día.

Para poder cubrir la demanda y continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria está solicitando un crédito por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos y se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients
Compra de insumos

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is a low-income resident of Beylagan. He is 44, married, and has 3 children.
He has been in business for 20 years. He is asking his first $1200 loan from Normicro to buy car tire disk removing instruments to serve the clients faster and increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy repair instruments

loans.name: Ofah

texts.en: Ofah is 42 years old and married. She lives with her son and her mother. Her other children are married and live away from her. She sells household goods on credit. Ofah is requesting a loan to expand her and her husband's business. They hope that this will earn more income for their children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Parmo

texts.en:
Mrs. Parmo M. is a 46 year-old widow, who since 2006 has been supporting herself by selling charcoal. These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to Parmo but to her customers who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford. Which is good news for Parmo, who requires a loan of $275 in order to add to her stock of mkaa and continue meeting the customer demand.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ratmini

texts.en: Ratmini, 58, is the mother of 2 children. Both her children have already finished their schooling. Her husband, K., works at a workshop earning a small income, so she sells snacks at her house, earning about US$ 1 a day, and also kerosene, earning about US$ 1.50 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little retail businesses

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She is a stylist and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2006. She needs a loan of $425 to buy a refrigerator for selling cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for selling cold drinks

loans.name: Gie Elybée Group

texts.fr:
GIE Elybée is a group of mixed male and female membership which specializes in cashew nut processing in Ziguinchor. Processed products are packaged in plastic bags and put up for sale by individuals and even hotels; the current loan is sought to strengthen the stock of raw materials.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Le GIE Elybée est un groupement mixte compose d' hommes et de femmes qui s' est spécialise dans la transformation des noix d’acajou a Ziguinchor. Les produits transfomes sont emballes dans des sachets plastiques et mis en vente a des particuliers et meme a des hotels ; le present credit est sollicite pour renforcer le stock de matieres premieres.

loans.use: Processing and marketing of cashew nuts

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en: Jameela I. is the leader of a group of three women and the mother of  two boys and one girl .Her eldest child is a day laborer; her daughter stays at home, while her youngest son attends a local school. Jameela has been a client of Asasah, a microfinance institution, for one year. With her first loan, she bought a donkey cart, and this year she will purchase a cow with her share of the loan. Jameela’s sub group members are: Shakila N., who is borrowing for her husband’s vegetables business, and Azra B., who will use her share of the loan to expand the family's flour store.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet S. is 34 years old, married, with 2 children. She acquired the skills of selling phamaceuticals for 3 years before setting up her own. She has been in the business for 10 years. Juliet has two children and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Juliet needs a loan of $450 to buy more drugs for sales. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better and also help her increase her profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drugs (pharmaceuticals) for sale

loans.name: Alatupe

texts.en: Alatupe T., 56, is married with 2 children.  She has had many years of experience in the Taro/bananas business. She sells to the village community and also at the market during peak season 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 $125 USD.  SPBD loans are Alatupe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Alatupe has used the loans to improve the business and help out in paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: She will use all of her loan to pay for all overhead costs of her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 58 years old, joined the Fund in 2001. Her family’s situation is very unfortunate; her husband passed away, leaving her to raise their one child by herself. The child is now grown and live at home with Mrs. Nguyen. When she first joined the Fund, the family invested in livestock. In every round of funding the family used the money successfully and brought in a large income. Currently she is investing the funding in general store run out of her home, and it is truly a business venture that brings strong results with high incomes. In her town, there are very few people running general stores, so the majority of the townspeople buy goods from her family’s store. Although her family situation was in a very desperate state, thanks to her perseverance the family’s finances are now very much improved. In this round of funding she is requesting 18,000,000 VND to continue investing in the general store. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên 58 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 hoàn cảnh gia đình chị vất vả, chồng mất sớm một mình chị vất vả nuôi 1 con hiện nay con chị đã trưởng thành và chị đang sống cùng con, khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị vay vốn cũng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, qua các vòng vốn gia đình chị đều sử dụng có hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao. Hiện nay chị đã đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh cửa hàng tạp hóa tại gia đình, đây chính là mô hình kinh doanh đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, tại địa phương chị có rất ít người kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa vì vậy chủ yếu người dân tại địa phương đều mua hàng của gia đình chị. Măc dù hoàn cảnh vất vả như vậy nhưng với sự cố gắng của bản thân đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá hơn rât nhiều. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in grocery, general goods

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni is a member of Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Yenni lives with her partner. She’s 29 years old and has 1 child. Yenni sells food at a kiosk located at the last stop of a city transportation line, which is located in her neighborhood, Quicapata. Yenni sells breakfast and lunch. He sales are done on credit and she gets paid in the evening.

Yenni, also sells salchipapas, a potato and sausage dish, at night, on the road near her doorstep.

Yenni needs a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, noodles and salt.

Yenni dreams of building her home with fine materials, and to have a large location where she can open a grocery store, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Yenni es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Yenni es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Yenni vende comida en un kiosco ubicado en el ultimo paradero de una empresa de transporte urbano, que esta ubicado en su barrio de Quicapata, Yenni vende desayuno y almuerzo, sus ventas son al crédito y por las tardes se encarga de las cobranzas.

Además Yenni por las noches vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa en una carreta.

Yenni necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa, fideo y sal.

Yenni sueña con construir su casa con material noble, tener un local grande para abrir una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Yenni needs a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, noodles, and salt.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 33 años, está separada, vive con su hijo Carlos de 3 años.
Se dedica a la venta de gas de forma ambulatoria, en la ciudad de Juliaca, actividad que viene realizando desde hace tres años, en un local alquilado, para mantenerse y mantener a su pequeña hija de tan solo tres años, Dina sabe que su pequeño irá creciendo día a día y que cada vez necesitará mayores atenciones, es por eso que le gusta esta actividad, ya que le permite pasar tiempo con él, lo difícil está en la  inesperada subida del costro de este hidrocarburo, eso desestabiliza su negocio.     
Con el dinero que pide comprara más balones de gas para hacer más rentable su negocio, el cual espera que crezca y de mayores ingresos económicos a su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is 33 years old and is separated from her husband. She lives with her 3-year-old son Carlos. For the last three years, Dina has been a street vendor selling gas from a rented space in Juliaca city. She does this to take care of herself and her young 3-year-old son. Dina knows that Carlos will grow up quickly and soon will demand more of her attention. That's why she likes her current business -- because it allows her to spend time with him. However, the unexpected increase in the cost of gas has made it difficult for Dina and destabilized her business. Dina plans to use the requested loan to purchase additional gas tanks (cylinders) to make her business more profitable. She hopes her business will grow and earn greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of gas tanks (cylinders) for her business

loans.name: Faamanuiaga

texts.en:
Faamanuiaga T., 43, is married with 7 children. She has 3 years of experience selling BBQ and pancakes to the village people and the public. She sells 6 days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

Faamanuiaga has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of the loan will be use to fund her business. Faamanuiaga's husband will help her operate the business.

loans.use: Purchase mutton flaps, chicken franks, soya, onions, and salt

loans.name: Raghed

texts.en: Raghed is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their 3 children. He works as a tile polisher. Raghed has asked for a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to buy raw materials for his work such as salt and gasoline for the generator, and also to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his work and pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 27 años, vive  con sus dos hijos. Trabaja desde hace 3 años en su restaurante que abrió en sociedad con su hermana, allí ofrecen una variedad de desayunos y almuerzos a precios módicos, está ubicado cerca de un hospital de su localidad, recientemente cambiaron de local porque el arrendamiento era muy costoso, ahora están en un local más cómodo. Eva trabaja diariamente y descansa  en la tarde después de vender los almuerzos y dejar todo limpio para el día siguiente, su mayor preocupación son sus pequeños hijos, ella es el único sostén que tienen, por lo que no puede quedarse hasta muy noche en su restaurante, su mayor anhelo es tener un restaurante de más categoría y en una zona más comercial. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue invitada por su banco comunal porque la conocen y saben que es responsable. Eva comprar con este dinero víveres al por mayor para la preparación de sus almuerzos y también vidrios para la decoración de sus mesas.
texts.en:
Eva is 27 years old and lives with her two children. She has been working for three years in a restaurant that she opened in partnership with her sister. In the restaurant, they offer a variety of breakfasts and lunches at modest prices. The restaurant is located near a regional hospital. They recently locations because the lease was very expensive. Their current location is more affordable. Eva works everyday and rests in the afternoons after selling lunches and cleaning the restaurant for the next day. Her biggest worry is for her small children. She is the only support that they have, so she cannot stay until late at night in the restaurant. Her greatest longing is to own a higher-quality restaurant in a more commercial area. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with MFP. She was invited by the village bank because the members know her and know that she is responsible. With this money, Eva will buy, in bulk, the food supplies needed to prepare the lunches and glass to decorate the tables.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supplies and glass to decorate the tables

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: A. Léonie est veuve et elle a 3 garçons, 32, 30, and 28. Elle est née le 16 juin 1952. Elle a commencé son activité il y a 8 ans avec la distribution des tissus et des gels. Les crédits de Kiva lui a permis de rester sur place pour vendre la nourriture comme le macaroni, le pate alimentaires et les boissons frais comme les jus du fruits, le bissap, et les sodas Beninois.  Avec ce crédit, elle veut acheter un deuxième congélateur pour ses boissons frais. Depuis qu’elle commence avec Kiva, elle a vu une augmentation de sa vente, et dans le futur elle veut ajouter les boissons comme Coca et Sprite.
texts.en:
Léonie A. is a widow, and she has 3 sons, aged 32, 30, and 28. She was born June 16, 1952. She began her business 8 years ago, selling cloth and gels. A Kiva credit has allowed her to stay in the same place and sell food such as macaroni, other pastas, and cooled drinks such as fruit juice and bissap (hibiscus flower tea). With this loan she wants to buy a second freezer for her cooled drinks. Since she began to work with Kiva, she has seen an increase in her sales, and in future she wants to add other drinks such as Coke and Sprite.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a freezer for her little business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive en un cuarto que alquiló en el lugar donde trabaja. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de caretas para panes en la ciudad de Juliaca, además para aprovechar el tiempo, vende ropa los sábados y domingos, y así aprovecha las ferias de fin de semana, de esto ya 2 años, en los cuales ha puesto todo su empeño para salir adelante. Felizmente a Roxana le gusta su trabajo y así es que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco, siendo cada vez más rentable. Pero hay algunas ocasiones que el trabajo se le hace muy cansado, ya que trabaja durante toda la semana, pero ella sabe que si se esfuerza ahora que aun es joven cosechará los frutos en el futuro. Roxana se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitad comprará material para seguir realizando sus artesanías (caretas), y también más mercadería en ropa para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old, single, and lives in a room she rents in the place where she works. She makes masks for bread in the city of Juliaca and to make the most of her time she has sold clothes on Saturdays and Sundays, taking advantage of the fair weekend these past 2 years, which has helped her succeed. Fortunately, Roxana likes her job and her business is slowly growing more profitable. There are some occasions when the work is very tiring since she works all week but she knows that if she stays strong now while she is young she will reap the benefits in the future. This is Roxana’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to buy materials to make her crafts (masks) and also more clothes to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Mrs. Ron Veurng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen members is located in Andoung Pour village in Kampong Cham province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ron V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Voeung Sa Em, is a policeman. Mrs. Ron V. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Vilma Rosibel

texts.es: Vilma Rosibel G. L., vive en Santa Tecla departamento de La Libertad. A sus cortos 19 años por problemas económicos en su familia Vilma a tenido que dejar a un lado su gran sueño de ir a la Universidad, Vilma ya termino de cursar el bachillerato, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar  puso su propio negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor y al detalle en su casa , Vilma viaja hasta el oriente del país a comprar mercadería ya que es allí donde la encuentra más barata y de esta manera ella tendrá mejores precios para ofrecer a sus clientes. El sueño de Vilma es abrir un pequeño local donde pueda contratar a alguien que le ayude en su negocio para que ella puede seguir estudiando una carrera en la universidad, pero hoy por hoy es solo un sueño ya que necesita de muchos ahorros para hacer esa inversión es por eso que Vilma solita un crédito para adquirir más mercadería y obtener mayores ganancias que sirvan para poder cumplir su sueño de ampliar su negocio y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Vilma Rosibel G. L. lives in the Santa Tecla neighborhood of La Libertad. At the young age of 19 Vilma has had to set aside her dream of going to the university because of her family’s economic problems. Vilma has already finished high school and when she found herself in need of work, she started her own business selling clothing at wholesale and retail prices from her home. Vilma travels to the western part of the country to purchase merchandise because it is much cheaper there. This way she will be able to offer her customers better prices. Vilma’s dream is to open a small store where she can hire someone to help her with her business so she can continue her studies at the university, but, as of now, it is merely a dream because she would need to save a lot of money in order to make such an investment. For this reason Vilma is applying for a loan to purchase more merchandise and obtain greater profits which will help her achieve her dream of expanding her business and continuing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothing)

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Djuma

texts.ru: Клиентка Ёрова Джумьа в возросте 46 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей, образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 8 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на центральном  рынке, она продаёт домашними малочными продуктами. Муж клиентки находится на зароботках в России. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет отремантировать свою квартиру.
texts.en:
The client Djuma Y. is 46 years old, married and has two children. She has no education. She lives in the town of Vahdat and has been in the retail business for more than eight years. She has her own vendor spot which is located on the central market where she sells homemade milk products. Djuma's husband is a laborer in Russia. She wants to use the loan to renovate her apartment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate apartment

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy W., a 44 year old trader, is divorced with three children in school. She is a very resourceful woman whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Dorothy supports her children and provides for the household through the sale of secondhand shoes and ladies' slippers. Secondhand shoes and slippers are in demand in Ghana, as brand-new ones are very expensive for the economically active poor. The selling of secondhand shoes and slippers has created a market for many women like Dorothy.

With her loan, Dorothy wants to purchase used clothing and slippers to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her save for her children’s education and also to rent a store for her trade. She belongs to a village bank called Jeremiah.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married to Vicente, a farmer, and blessed with five children: Jo Vincent, 37 years old, a policeman; Joel, 34 years old, a teacher; Jovelyn , 32 years old, also a teacher; Jennifer, 28 years old and their youngest is Jeffrey - 19 years old, still a college student. Some of them are already married. They are residing in Barangay Centro 2 of Angadanan, Isabela.

Evelyn has operated a typical village store in their place for almost 20 years. She utilizes her weekly net income of PHP 700 for the school allowance of her son and for some of their basic needs at home.

Evelyn wants to borrow PHP 6,000 that will serve as additional capital for her store. She believes that through patience and hard work, she can become successful in the future.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her store

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since he was young. Today, as the head of a household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income. He cares for his animals, getting up very early to gather grass so he can keep his livestock well fed. Abdurahmon sells the milk they produce as well as the grass that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking a loan for the purchase of calves to expand his business. Please support Abdurahmon’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya est composé majoritairement de femmes mariées vivant dans des familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 44 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers de liens de voisinage, d’amitié, de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle.
Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une cliente du prêt solidaire qui mène les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus qu’elles au marché de Médine. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers tels les habits brodés, les pagnes wax, l’encens, les chaussures etc. 
En vu d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles se sont organisées pour adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution. Elles  sont à leur 5ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts antérieurs. 
Ce nouveau  prêt servira à acheter, 4 pièces de bazin riche qui seront teintés avant d’être vendu, 150 paires de chaussure, 10 douzaines de parfums et de la matière première pour la préparation de l’encens (5kg de magnonkissèni, 5kg de n’guéni et un carton de parfums). Pour avoir une bonne qualité d’encens on imbibe  le magnonkissèni ou le n’guéni dans l’eau de Cologne  pendant un mois au moins avant d’assaisonner avec les autres qualités de parfums. Elles se ravitaillent toutes en matières premières à Ségou  au grand marché et effectuent leurs ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers et au grand marché  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 39.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.  
Elles ont pour ambition de devenir des fournisseurs dans les différentes activités qu’elles mènent.
texts.en:
This Badenya group is made up mostly of married women living in polygamous families with an average age of 44 and on average, 2 children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of the town of Ségou (4the administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through ties of neighborhood, friendship, marriage and through belonging to the same traditional association.

They learned about Soro Yiriwaso from a solidarity-loan client who has the same sort of business they do in the marketplace of Médine. They sell various items such as embroidered clothing, "wax-brand pagnes" (high quality lengths of brightly printed African cloth), incense, shoes, etc.

In the intention of increasing their working capital, they got organized to join our loan program. They are on their 5th solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the preceding loans. This new loan will be used to buy 4 bolts of high-quality "bazin" (a sort of damask) which will be dyed before being sold, 150 pairs of shoes, 10 dozen perfumes and raw materials for making incense (5kg of "magnonkissèni" and 5kg of "n’guéni"--seeds of wild exotic plants--and a case of perfumes). To have good quality incense you soak the "magnonkissèni" or the "n’guéni" in eau de Cologne for a month or more before using other sorts of perfumes to embellish it. They buy all the raw materials in Ségou in the big open-air market and sell their wares for cash and retail or for credit out of their homes and walking through the neighborhoods and the big marketplace, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They expect to make a monthly average profit of 39,000 F CFA which will be used to help their husbands support their families. Their ambition is to become big-time suppliers of the various items they sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles to make incense etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong A., 39, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province with her husband and four of her children. She and her husband typically make a combined $7 in revenue each day.

The climate conditions have been unfavorable for farming in Cambodia this past year and this has caused food prices to soar. Inflation has also been out of control, as this has turned into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kong A. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and a water pump to irrigate her farm. She sees this business opportunity as a way to increase her income and to provide a higher standard of living for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia N. is thirty-six years old and divorced with three children, a boy and two girls, who are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Wiawso is a farming and commercial town in the region. Felicia is a trader, selling cereals such as maize at the local market in her community. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days, and she supplies some vendors as well. Felicia has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and also to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: La Señorita Julia Patricia con residencia en la zona Independencia del municipio de Totonicapán su profesion es perito contador con especialidad en computacion graduada hace cinco años y presta su servicio para area de salud del departamento de Contabilida como asitente de contabilida, visita las oficina de la sucursal Asdir Totonicapan para solicitar un credito que le servira para finalizar la carrera universitara para un seminario en la ciudad de Quetzaltenango.
texts.en:
Miss Julia Patricia lives in the Independencia area of the municipality of Totonicapán. She graduated five years ago as a qualified accountant specializing in computing. She works as an assistant accountant in the Accounting Department of the Health Administration. She came to the local branch of Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan to complete her university studies by a seminar in the city of Quetzaltenango.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education expenses

loans.name: Kenyi

texts.en:
Kenyi R. currently sells bedsheets and dresses and requests for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.  She is 45 years old and married.  Kenyi has five children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more sewing machines sewing dresses, pairs of trousers, pairs of shorts etc.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged 12, 10, 5, and 3. She also cares for 3 other dependents.

Sarah started her own business selling charcoal 6 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sarah`s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sarah hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 39 años, es una madre muy dedicada y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos, Jonathan D. 12 y Maikel D. 10, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. Su bodega es la primera en atender en su barrio, desD. las 6 D. la mañana sus puertas ya están abiertas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la variedad D. la mercadería que tiene no dudan en visitar su tienda, ya que tienen la seguridad D. que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta  a Cirila D. su trabajo es vender y conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para tender su bodega, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinD. mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el quinto préstamo D. Cirila con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus socias, ya que es muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cirila is 39 years old, and she is a very dedicated and very loving Mom. She lives in her own home, together with her two children Jonathan aged 12, and Maikel aged 10. She wishes to proviD. them with a good education. Her convenience store is the first in the neighbourhood. She opens the doors at 6 a.m. to cater to the early morning clients. Her clientele know of the wiD. variety of merchandise in her store so they don't hesitate to patronize, knowing that they will find everything they need. What Cirila loves best about her work is the sales and chatting with her clients. She has been running the business for the past 10 years, and though she considers the hardest part is the early hours of work, she still feels the commitment to carry out her work. In the future she hopes that her business will expand and that it will proviD. her with better earnings.

This is Cirila's fifth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been on time with her payments and she will continue to be so. Among the members of the Community Bank she is very well liked, especially because she is so responsible. With the two thousand neuvos soles she will purchase products to add greater variety to her convenience store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase variety in merchandise.

loans.name: Gheta Group

texts.en:
Gheta is the group leader of Gheta group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business. Their requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.
Raqya and Zakera want to take a loan for her business of beading and Gheta wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store.Gullaly wants to take a loan for her business of husband’s. The all wants to buy necessary materials for their businesses. 
They want to say this loan is very use full because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business and become stronger in there business and life this group wants to thank this process of loan in Afghanistan

loans.use: they are expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
This is Jenneth M., 36 years old, who lives and does business in Baseco, Port Area, Manila. She is married to Jose, 63, a vendor like her. One of their two children goes to grade school.

Jenneth has been doing business for three years. She buys and sells assorted vegetables. Currently, she concentrates on onions and tomatoes. She has a stall in a nearby flea market. Jenneth earns a net income of P10,000 a month, although she says sales go down on rainy days.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. Jenneth is now on her 11th loan. She is expecting a new loan from the cooperative in the amount of P18,000 as additional capital. With this fresh capital, she can purchase more assorted vegetables from traders for her business.

She hopes to have a larger vegetable stall soon.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Bestina

texts.en:
Bestina sells foodstuffs like rice and cooking oils. She hawks her foodstuffs (goes door-to-door) within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a focused and hard working woman and is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

Bestina is 33 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an electrician. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Albino

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso R. vive en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León y se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador ya que labora como guarda de seguridad y a pesar de sus 60 años de edad, él continúa esforzándose por llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Es importante destacar que el señor Alfonso tiene un hijo en la universidad y requiere brindarle las posibilidades para que estudie. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en los gastos universitarios de su hijo porque su sueño es que él llegue a ser un gran profesional y pueda tener muy buenas condiciones para vivir y que siempre se sienta orgulloso del apoyo que le brindó su padre. Espera en que el crédito le será otorgado y así contribuirá al bienestar de su hijo y por ende de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso R., lives in the town of El Sauce, León department. He is notable for being a very hard worker who, despite his 60 years of age, continues to work as a security guard to continue to provide sustenance for his home. It's important to note that Alfonso has a son who is a university student and he wants to provide him with every opportunity to study. For this reason, he is requesting financing to invest in his son's university expenses because his dream is that his son become a great professional and have better living conditions and always be proud of the support his father gave him. He hopes that the credit will be approved so that he can contribute to his son's wellbeing and thus to the wellbeing of all his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pago de gastos universitarios para su hijo

loans.name: Joienel

texts.en:
Joienel Y. is a 29-year-old male entrepreneur. He is married to Jovelyn, also 29, a housewife. Their eldest child is now in grade school while the other two are at home as they are not yet of school age. They all live together in a village called Balubad (cashew) in Silang, Cavite. Joienel’s general store is now three years old and has been growing successfully over the years. He registers more than 10,000 PHP in net income monthly.
Joienel enjoys the many benefits provided by Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, to its members. He not only enjoys the loans provided by the cooperative to support his business, but also the company of other entrepreneurs in the community. Now on his sixth loan cycle, Joienel is hoping that he will be granted a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise, such as rice and soft drinks. He looks forward to converting his small store into a large grocery store some day.

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, such as rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Ol Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people who are all living in Prek Reang village in Kandal province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Srey O. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan in different purposes. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. PH. KH., is a piglet middleman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Srey O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for selling to earn more income. She is 41 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are fishermen while the others two are attending the local schoO. and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for selling to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia FLORENCIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres son independientes, tienes sus hogares y la socia vive con el menor de sus hijos de  9 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar  que son el cuidado, alimento y protección de su menor hijo con el comercio, Nuestra socia vende artesanía en un stand de la plaza principal de Pisac, ella aprovecha los veranos en el país vecino de Chile y lleva artesanía hasta ese país, su esposo tiene una botica en  nuestra socia también colabora con el negocio familiar de su esposo, La socia solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio de artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank “Pro Desarrollo” (Pro Development). She lives in Pisac, which lies in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Pisac is located 40 minutes away from the city. It is small town that inherited beautiful Incan structures, which is required sightseeing by all tourists who visit the city of Cusco.

Florencia is 37 years old, married, and has four children of whom three are independent and have their own families. She lives with her youngest child, who is 9 years old. Florencia divides her time between her household activities (such as caring for, feeding, and protecting her son) and running her business. She sells handicrafts from a stand at the main square in Pisac. She takes advantage of the summers in the neighboring country of Chile and brings back handicrafts made over there. Her husband manages a pharmacy, which is a family business where she also works. Florencia is requesting a loan to reinvest in her handicraft business.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her handicraft business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta G. is a married woman who supports her family by selling fish and running a general store. She lives in Brgy Miranda Bolobitoon, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her 41-year-old husband, Romulo, a labourer, and their four children who are 6 to 19 years old and currently going to school. Violeta has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000. She has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Violeta is now borrowing 23,000 PHP so that she can expand her fish vending and general store businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Violeta aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Antonia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad y es casada la socia tiene 1 hijo de 33 años de edad, nuestra socia es profesora de profesión, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia cría pollos y los vende, La socia  ahora que esta retirada de la docencia se dedica íntegramente a la crianza de pollos, para luego de engordarlos venderlos al por mayor y menor, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Antonia belongs to the Communal Bank "Capac Quoya". She lives in the Coya-Pisac district, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 52 years old and she is married. She has one son, 33 years old. She is a teacher. She alternates her homemaking activities with retail sales. She raises chickens and sells them. She is now retired from teaching so she works full-time at raising chickens and, after fattening them, selling them. She asks for the loan to buy chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being offered and she is committed to fulfilling all the repayment terms punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens

loans.name: Wilker

texts.es:
Wilker tiene 20 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres hace 5 años y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Siendo aun muy joven, sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de papa, choclo, zanahoria y alverja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas; lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. 
Para más adelante, tiene el deseo de comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar él mismo sus productos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Wilker con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de papa y alverja, además de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Wilker is 20 years of age, and a cheerful hardworking young man. He lives in the house he inherited from his parents five years ago. Wilker is inclined to work hard so that he can improve his quality of life.

When he was much younger, he knew he had to focus all of his efforts to making a life for himself through his work. Wilker grows potatoes, corn, carrots and peas. These crops are approaching the harvest season and he will sell them at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. His customers are aware of the quality of his crops, so they buy them quickly. What he enjoys most about his job is protecting his crops from pestilence. Wilker has been farming for four years and considers the most difficult part to be hauling his produce to the market where he sells because the sacks of produce are very heavy. Later on, he hopes to buy a car so that he will be able to transport his products.
